name: Tamley
description: Tamley Duskpot is a sly halfling who pretends to be a cheerful neighbor while quietly sabotaging others' crops.
look: She’s short and plump with perpetually muddy hands, twinkling brown eyes, and a patchwork kerchief. Her smile rarely reaches her eyes.
personality: She’s charming but frequently speaks in half-truths, often redirecting blame or attention with feigned innocence.
hook: Tamley is determined to become the most prosperous farmer in the village by ruining the harvests of nearby farms through sneaky means.
history: Years ago, her prized vegetable patch was trampled by jealous neighbors, planting a deep, vengeful streak in her heart.
voice: She speaks with rapid, high-pitched cheery notes that conceal pointed sarcasm and sharp retorts.
line_1: Oh, what a shame about your beans this year—pests can be so troublesome, can’t they?
line_2: My patch just keeps thriving; guess luck favors the persistent, hmm?
rumor: Oh, the old guesthouse? Folks have the strangest dreams there, all about a dark, shiny tower sinking into red sands.

name: Fenni
description: Fenni Marrowstick is a calculating halfling who secretly poisons rivals’ fields under the guise of giving helpful advice.
look: He’s lean with a sharp nose, wheat-colored hair, and worn boots stained with suspicious splotches. His gaze lingers a little too long.
personality: He’s polite but coldly formal, rarely smiling and never hesitating to twist words to his benefit.
hook: Fenni aims to expand his land by driving his neighbors out with crop failure, using foul methods to weaken their yield.
history: He inherited little and resented his more successful cousins, learning from a young age that subtle sabotage went unnoticed.
voice: His tone is measured, quiet, with a faint sneer curling at the end of sentences. He pauses before answers as if weighing every word.
line_1: Perhaps you ought to try my special mix—it’s done wonders for my carrots.
line_2: Strange how your apples went brown—maybe you watered them wrong.
rumor: I've heard tell, children tracing stars with fresh names—curious patterns drawn from naught but their own minds, or so they claim.

name: Loro
description: Loro Bramblebun bribes local pests to infest his neighbor’s plots, ensuring his own success.
look: He’s round-cheeked, short-fingered, wears a cap with bugs stitched into the brim, and often has dirt under his nails.
personality: Loro is sneaky, with a croaky laugh and a habit of watching others work from the shadows.
hook: He wants to gain leverage over others so they’ll owe him favors, using any underhanded tactic to disrupt their work.
history: Loro once traded a basket of berries to a wandering magician in exchange for a trick that attracts field mice—a secret he guards fiercely.
voice: He mumbles softly, sometimes whistling mid-sentence, with a chuckle after particularly biting remarks.
line_1: Mice find their way to the best pies—and sometimes the worst fields.
line_2: If your harvest’s in trouble, I might have just the trick… for a price.
rumor: Heh, that village nitwit's been scratchin' odd circles and speakin' tongues, whistlin' like the wind through the wheat.

name: Brinna
description: Brinna Goodmash cultivates weeds that strangle competitors’ crops, all while smiling sweetly and offering false advice.
look: She has freckles across her nose, an ever-clean apron, and keeps a pouch of mysterious seeds at her belt.
personality: Brinna is outwardly warm but quick to gossip and expertly manipulates others with kind-sounding words.
hook: She hopes to ruin anyone who threatens her standing at the market, orchestrating their downfall with cunning precision.
history: A fierce rivalry with her older sister left her unwilling to share success, and she extends that bitterness to all rivals now.
voice: Her tone is syrupy and sweet until crossed—a slight, sharp edge enters when things don’t go her way.
line_1: Why, you must’ve planted your potatoes too close, dear—it’s a rookie mistake, really.
line_2: Some folks’ gardens seem cursed, don’t they? I suppose some hands just aren’t meant for the soil.
rumor: Oh, dear hearts, you wouldn't believe the mischief afoot—gates swinging like a loose jaw at night and those poor pups tied up.

name: Cordi
description: Cordi Muckglen uses intimidation to force neighbors into bad trades, secretly undermining anyone who resists.
look: He’s stocky, with heavy eyebrows, an ever-muddy shirt, and constantly chewing on something tough.
personality: Gruff and direct, Cordi makes threats sound like bargains and rarely hides his disdain.
hook: He’s determined to corner the grain market, using fear and manipulation to force others into compliance.
history: After being bullied by rival farmers as a boy, Cordi swore never to be weak again, and now exerts his power at every opportunity.
voice: His words are clipped and gruff, often punctuated by snorts or the crack of cracking seeds between his teeth.
line_1: You’d better sell this lot to me—else you might regret holding onto it, friend.
line_2: A little mud never hurt business. Not like crossing me would.
rumor: Heard 'bout those tracks, eh? Mud don't lie—those beasts move like a bloody regiment.

name: Mivy
description: Mivy Tillowheat plots to sabotage the village well so she can charge desperate neighbors for clean water.
look: She has tightly braided auburn hair, keen blue eyes, and always carries a jug strapped across her back.
personality: Her outward hospitality veils a quicksilver mind and a penchant for scheming.
hook: She wants to profit from others’ misfortune, positioning herself as their only hope during a drought.
history: After her own crops failed due to water shortages, she vowed never to be caught unprepared—no matter what it costs her neighbors.
voice: Her speech is fast with a brisk confidence, though she lowers her voice when discussing ‘opportunities.’
line_1: Water’s precious out here. Lucky for you, I’ve always got a little spare—for a fair price.
line_2: Funny how the well’s been acting up—must be all that heavy use lately.
rumor: On those clear nights when the moon wears its pale ring, even the shepherds feel something's amiss, waking with their mouths full of ash, they do.

name: Randa
description: Randa Windlepot quietly hoards seeds, causing shortages among the village’s growers and selling back at unfair rates.
look: Her straw hat is full of old stains, her cheeks flushed, and she’s rarely seen without a heavy satchel.
personality: She’s friendly enough but often deflects questions, keeping her true intentions close.
hook: She wants to control planting every season, forcing others to rely on her for essential supplies.
history: A bad harvest left her desperate once, and she learned to exploit shortage for her own gain.
voice: Her tone is chipper but evasive, quick to change topic or giggle when pressed.
line_1: Seeds? Oh, I might have a handful—if you’ve got something good to trade.
line_2: Best not put all your beans in one patch, love. You never know what might sprout.
rumor: Oh, that ol' barn door? Just likes to swing open every dusk, slams shut at midnight—regular as clockwork, no wind needed, eheh.

name: Vibu
description: Vibu Softwhistle manipulates the market by spreading false rumors about rival farmers’ produce.
look: He’s slender with a limp and wears long breeches tucked into slightly mismatched boots. His tongue seems too quick for his smile.
personality: Vibu is sly, smooth-talking, and loves twisting a story to suit his needs.
hook: He aims to become the village’s trusted authority on produce, even if it means destroying reputations along the way.
history: Years ago, his family’s stand was shut down after a malicious rumor—he now believes words are his sharpest tools.
voice: He speaks in a cheerful singsong with a tendency to drag out the last word ominously.
line_1: I heard someone found worms in Old Henka’s apples...Shame, truly!
line_2: Of course, my cabbages are always crisp, never a spot! Some folk just aren’t as careful.
rumor: Oh, the old mill up yonder? Used to send us flour regularly, but now, well, nothing's come for thrice a moon, and those poor souls who went to inquire haven't returned yet.

name: Lidda
description: Lidda Puddlebank undercuts neighbors with stolen produce, laundering it as her own to dominate the local stall.
look: She has short-cropped hair, sharp grey eyes, and many smeared patches on her worn tunic.
personality: She is bold and audacious, her jokes masking a ruthless competitive edge.
hook: She wants to ensure no one else in the village turns a better profit, even if it means theft and lies.
history: Wrongfully accused of stealing as a child, Lidda grew to embody what others already believed about her.
voice: She cracks jokes quickly and is prone to sudden laughter, though her words cut close to the bone.
line_1: Funny how my basket’s always fuller than the rest—maybe luck follows the clever.
line_2: If folks don’t watch their turnips, well, someone will.
rumor: Heh, you heard 'bout the frost patterns, yeah? Odd shapes that'll make your eyes water and your nose bleed if you're daft enough to draw 'em.

name: Olo
description: Olo Snugbutton sours deals with false promises, making unreliable pacts and vanishing when it’s time to deliver.
look: He’s pudgy, with curling brown hair always half tucked under a faded green cap and a perpetual smirk.
personality: Charming and affable until pressed for commitment, then slippery as an eel.
hook: He wishes to keep others uncertain and dependent, all while grabbing the best deals for himself.
history: Burned by a failed partnership, Olo vowed to never let others benefit from his labor again—unless they pay twice over.
voice: He speaks out of the side of his mouth and tends to agree before immediately contradicting himself.
line_1: Of course, I’ll bring those potatoes tomorrow—unless something urgent comes up!
line_2: You know how promises are—some folks keep ’em, some folks remember who made ’em.
rumor: Oh, that ol' bridge down the trade road? Sure as the sun's bright, it just gave out—no storm, nothin'.

name: Dova
description: Dova Honeytwist secretly spoils others’ harvest wagons on market day so her produce always appears freshest.
look: She has honey-brown hair knotted in twin buns, with a sharp chin and hands always smelling faintly of vinegar.
personality: Dova is playful in company but enjoys letting others trip over her subtle tricks.
hook: She wants to be praised as the best grower, ensuring others can’t compete on taste or quality.
history: After losing a contest due to a rigged vote, Dova now makes sure every advantage is on her side by any means.
voice: She giggles with each statement and peppers her speech with knowing hums.
line_1: Oh, dearie, your beets look a bit wilted—mine, though, just picked this morning!
line_2: What a shame, limp lettuce again! Maybe next season you’ll get it right.
rumor: Heehee, ever wandered down the old road, love? Oh, the homes are all locked tight, but someone's been playin' house, I reckon.

name: Junso
description: Junso Trundleoak deliberately starts petty feuds to distract competitors and pillage their fields by night.
look: He is tall for a halfling, with a shock of black hair and an ever-scuffed vest.
personality: Quarrelsome and confrontational, Junso looks for every slight and knows how to escalate a dispute.
hook: He loves sowing chaos, hoping to seize neighbors’ best land while their backs are turned.
history: He was once caught raiding a neighbor’s orchard, but his cunning words got him off scot-free, emboldening him further.
voice: His words are sharp, with an accusing tone, often raising his voice for effect.
line_1: I saw you trample my fence—don’t think I won’t have something to say about it!
line_2: While you’re busy arguing, some of us get real work done.
rumor: I'm tellin' ya, those layabouts snoozing under trees are hearing eerie singin'—like the dead whisperin' for company.

name: Mira
description: Mira Stovepipe hires bullies to scare off farmhands from other plots, ensuring she has the best workers every season.
look: With a prominent nose, piercing eyes, and a sun-faded cloak, she carries herself with brisk authority.
personality: Mira is tough, demanding, and expects obedience; she intimidates as easily as she breathes.
hook: She aims to monopolize skilled labor, squeezing out competitors by threats and intimidation.
history: After seasons of losing hired help to richer neighbors, Mira now fights dirtier to keep her fields ahead.
voice: Her voice is low and steely, her words clipped and full of veiled threats.
line_1: If you want steady work, you come to me—no questions asked.
line_2: See anyone loafing on my land, and there’ll be trouble—mark my words.
rumor: Those caravans, marked with the hawk's eye, they're dodging the King's Road, slinking through my back lanes like they're above the law.

name: Darvo
description: Darvo Crispleaf sabotages irrigation ditches at night to ruin others’ crops, ensuring his fields never falter.
look: He’s wiry, with a sly smile, nicked ears, and boots in constant need of repair.
personality: He’s cautious but cruel, watching others’ misfortunes with thinly veiled delight.
hook: He wants to keep his own fortune atop the heap, convinced only by crushing the competition can he stay on top.
history: A dry season nearly ruined Darvo; now, he takes no risks and strikes first, always.
voice: He whispers habitually, flicking his gaze around before speaking, and often fidgets with his sleeves.
line_1: Strange, your field looks awfully dry... Sure you checked your ditches?
line_2: Sometimes the water just runs out, you know? Nature's fickle like that.
rumor: They say the fisherfolk won't dare the deep waters no more, whisperin' 'bout somethin' dark brushin' their boats at night.

name: Bettra
description: Bettra Underfen lures livestock from neighboring farms and claims them as strays, swelling her own herds deceptively.
look: Her toes are always unclad and caked with mud, and she twirls a straw between her fingers as she talks.
personality: Bettra is glib, always ready with an excuse, and puts on an air of forgetful innocence.
hook: She intends to quietly build the largest herd in the area, not caring if it means stealing from others.
history: As a child, Bettra grew up envying her neighbor’s fattened sheep, learning that ‘lost’ animals could be quickly claimed.
voice: She speaks breezily and never lets silences linger, filling them with idle chatter.
line_1: Well, if it wandered here, it’s clearly meant for my pasture, right?
line_2: Funny how animals seem to prefer my care above all others.
rumor: Oh, you haven't heard? That old mill's just been quiet as a mouse lately, but I'm sure it's nothing—perhaps they're just taking a little break, you know?

name: Tomo
description: Tomo Nibblestream encourages fungus growth in rivals' cellars, cutting into their profits while his own stay safe.
look: He’s round-bellied, his green vest always speckled with white dust, and cheeks dimpled even when he frowns.
personality: Tomo is friendly but nosy, always prying about others’ storage and hinting at helpful ‘solutions’.
hook: He’s set on making sure he’s the only one with fresh goods in storage, using mold as his weapon of choice.
history: Years of barely scraping by after a ruined harvest taught Tomo every trick for keeping produce fresh—and foul for others.
voice: His voice is teasing and singsong, with frequent sniffs and a habit of finishing others’ sentences.
line_1: Spotted a bit of mold in your cellar, did you? I might know a fix… for a fee.
line_2: They say some folks just can’t keep things fresh. What a pity, eh?
rumor: Oh, you haven't heard? The counting-house way over yonder, they're all sniff sniff, 'Only our shiny stamped coins for debts, thank you very much.

name: Harvo
description: Harvo Grumblebale spikes rivals’ animal feed to stunt growth, making his livestock the best at market.
look: He’s beefy with sun-roughened skin, a tangled beard, and sour-smelling overalls.
personality: Harvo is bitter and competitive, always quick with a complaint or a sly jab.
hook: He won’t rest until he’s broken every competitor, treating the market as a battlefield.
history: Mocked for his scrawny stock years ago, Harvo now believes only sabotage will get respect.
voice: He grunts and mutters, voice thick and gravelly, always ending his sentences with a huff.
line_1: Might be your feed’s off, friend—mine always fattens ‘em right up.
line_2: Some folks just aren’t born for good stock. Simple truth.
rumor: Them shiny-booted debt collectors been skulkin' 'round, leavin' nasty pictures after they shake us down, huff.

name: Milna
description: Milna Biscuitpatch spoils baked goods before rival bakers collect their ingredients, ensuring only her treats bake up right.
look: She has curly dark hair, patches of flour everywhere, and cheeks always red from the heat of her ovens.
personality: She acts bubbly and generous, but isn’t above a mean-spirited prank masked as a joke.
hook: Milna wants to win every bake-off and festival, sabotaging others’ food supplies when no one’s looking.
history: She was ever the runner-up until she realized fortune favors the shrewd over the honest.
voice: Her voice is sing-song and energetic, often pairing compliments with barbed undertones.
line_1: Oven trouble again? Maybe you should let me do the baking this time!
line_2: Competition’s stiff out here. Only the craftiest win.
rumor: Oh, darlings, have you seen those curious tracks out by the fields? They dance around like a merry band of soldiers—almost too perfect for mere beasts, wouldn't you say?

name: Bilco
description: Bilco Dapplebrook bribes harvesters to undercount rivals’ yields, making his barn the fullest come reckoning.
look: He’s lean, quick-moving, hair tied back, and often throws glances over his shoulder.
personality: Bilco is clever and secretive, rarely speaking plainly and seldom making direct eye contact.
hook: He aims to pad his numbers every season, angling for ‘unexpected’ surpluses while his rivals struggle.
history: After a crooked tallyman helped him once, Bilco learned the value of a well-timed bribe.
voice: He whispers with a sly smile, and his laughter never quite reaches his eyes.
line_1: Numbers can be fickle things—sometimes you just have to sweeten them a bit.
line_2: Harvests look thin this year. Unless, of course, you count differently.
rumor: Heh, they say a scribe's come pokin' 'round with sealed words, only whisperin' to a chosen few 'bout the lands we till.

name: Pym
description: Pym Muddleclod creates fake blights and then charges desperate neighbors for his ‘expert’ cures.
look: He’s broad-shouldered, with dirt always under his fingernails and a perpetual smudge on his cheek.
personality: Enthusiastic and convincing, Pym is always eager to spin a tall tale about farm maladies.
hook: He delights in causing panic and then profiting by offering solutions only he can provide.
history: He once failed to save his own crop and now tricks others to feel clever and in control.
voice: He speaks in an excitable rush, peppering his speech with exaggerated warnings.
line_1: You best watch out—that blight spreads quick! Good thing I’ve got the answer.
line_2: Not everyone knows the right tricks to keep fields safe. Lucky for you, I do.
rumor: Oh, you haven't heard? The birds, they're all in a frenzy, circling and screaming over nothin'—but I tell ya, something wicked's hiding on that old hill, mark my words!

name: Tamley
description: Tamley Puddlebank tends a bustling patch of vegetable beds and apple trees near the brook, always ready to lend a hand to neighbors.
look: His cheeks are rosy and round, with soil always beneath his short nails and a battered straw hat perched atop messy brown hair.
personality: Tamley greets everyone warmly and is quick to share a laugh or slice of pie, always giving gentle encouragement.
hook: He hopes to organize a village harvest feast to bring everyone together after a hard season.
history: Last year, poor weather ruined much of Tamley's crop, but the support of fellow villagers inspired him to focus on community spirit.
voice: Cheerful and lilting, with a tendency to chuckle mid-sentence and use playful metaphors related to gardening.
line_1: No matter how muddy things get, there’s always a fresh carrot somewhere to be found!
line_2: If we all chip in, I’m sure this year’s harvest will taste twice as sweet.
rumor: Oh, you've heard about that bountiful bunch, eh? They've been sprouting up, offering a king's ransom for our grains, then whisking them away under the moon's watchful eye.

name: Fenni
description: Fenni Windlepot is known for her bustling herb garden and gentle wisdom, often called on for advice by her neighbors.
look: Small even for a halfling, with a cascade of curly auburn hair and green-stained fingertips from constant work with herbs.
personality: Patient and motherly, Fenni listens intently and always has a comforting word or remedy at the ready.
hook: She is determined to pass on her knowledge of healing plants to younger halflings so her traditions aren't lost.
history: Years ago, Fenni’s remedies soothed a nasty cough that swept through the village, awakening her passion for sharing her craft.
voice: Soft and steady, sprinkled with gentle humming and old sayings about the land.
line_1: A sprig of mint and a smile can cure half the world’s troubles, I say.
line_2: Oh, you’ve got a sniffle? Sit down, dear, I’ll brew something right quick.
rumor: Oh, dearies, the hunters stumbled upon a circle of warm fire pits up yonder in the high meadow, with tracks of boots and beasts all entwined.

name: Brinna
description: Brinna Softwhistle cares for a flock of ducks and maintains tidy rows of root vegetables near the village pond.
look: She has twinkling blue eyes and freckles, with her hair pulled back in a practical scarf and duck feathers in her pockets.
personality: Brinna is lively and upbeat, a natural storyteller who charms both neighbors and visiting children.
hook: She wants to patch up a broken footbridge so the village children can safely reach the pond for lessons and play.
history: When one of her ducks fell through the bridge last week, Brinna vowed to see it mended quickly.
voice: Quick-paced and musical, her words often flit between laughter and gentle scolding.
line_1: Mind your step near the pond, love—unless you want to end up quacking wet!
line_2: Let’s not wait for another tumble before we fix that old bridge.
rumor: Oh, you didn't hear? After every storm, there's new chalk circles by the quarry, inching closer to the edge—somebody's up to a whimsical mystery, mark my words!

name: Loro
description: Loro Crispleaf manages a small orchard, always sharing fresh apples and stories with travelers passing by.
look: Round-faced and cheerful, with a sunburned nose and bits of leaf stuck in his tousled hair.
personality: Generous and talkative, eager to welcome newcomers and quick to offer help or ask questions.
hook: He hopes to find someone able to repair the old cider press so the harvest doesn't go to waste.
history: Last autumn, Loro’s cider press broke just before the apples ripened, leaving him unable to continue his family’s cider tradition.
voice: Friendly and enthusiastic, his words sometimes spill out in a rapid tumble.
line_1: If you’re passing through, please have an apple—no traveler should go hungry!
line_2: I’d give my best boots to see that press running again this year.
rumor: Oh hey there, friend! Did'ya hear 'bout that smoke billowin' up by the old crossroads? Scouts rushed over but found nothin' but cold ash, not a soul around—mighty strange, eh?

name: Dorbo
description: Dorbo Goodbarrel raises beans and keeps a tidy vegetable stall at the market, always happy to chat about recipes.
look: Chubby and spry, with silvering hair and a patched brown vest always smelling of pepper and earth.
personality: Inquisitive and warm-hearted, Dorbo asks as many questions as he answers and enjoys trading stories as much as goods.
hook: He wants to organize a recipe swap so everyone can benefit from new ideas using common crops.
history: He once won a village cook-off using an old family recipe, sparking his love of sharing food and knowledge.
voice: Rich and rolling, his voice dances with excitement when food or conversation is involved.
line_1: Try these beans with a pinch of sage—you won’t regret it, trust me!
line_2: No such thing as too many recipes, don’t you agree?
rumor: Ah, have ye seen it? Fresh notices on the old gallows, they are, marked with a strange seal and brimming with rules aplenty.

name: Miri
description: Miri Tillowheat is a steady hand with grains, tending the largest wheat field beyond the village lane.
look: She’s lean and tanned with a crown of gold-flecked curls and a bright yellow scarf around her neck.
personality: Level-headed and earnest, she prefers straightforward talk and follows promises with quick action.
hook: She is looking for help to keep the crows away from her fields without harming them, hoping for a humane solution.
history: Miri once caught a neighbor’s cat tangled in her old scarecrow, making her rethink how she protects her grain.
voice: Clear and concise, with a hint of rural stubbornness and the occasional hearty laugh.
line_1: It’s not the crows’ fault they like my fields so much, but I wish they’d share!
line_2: If you know a clever trick, I’m all ears—these birds are winning the battle.
rumor: Been hearin' war drums from them hills past three nights, gettin' nearer each time.

name: Vibu
description: Vibu Underfen oversees a marshy patch beside the river, growing unusual greens and cattail roots.
look: Short and stocky, with keen brown eyes and pants always rolled up, muddy past his knees.
personality: Resourceful and quietly witty, Vibu doesn’t speak much but always finds the right words when it matters.
hook: He hopes to prove his marsh-grown crops are as valuable as any dry-land harvest by persuading the other farmers.
history: After being teased in childhood for his muddy fields, Vibu’s determination grew to take pride in his unique crops.
voice: Gravelly and low, with a slow drawl and the occasional sly joke hidden in his words.
line_1: What grows in muck can taste just as sweet—they’ll see.
line_2: Some folks need persuading, but the proof’s in the pudding root.
rumor: Y'know, every week, as sure as the sun sets, them chapel candles snuff out together—quiet like.

name: Tella
description: Tella Buttonwick tends a clever patchwork of raised beds behind her grandparents’ cottage, always finding ways to grow more with less.
look: She’s petite, with wide brown eyes and a shock of straw-blonde hair tied with twine.
personality: Inventive and excitable, Tella can’t resist thinking aloud about new planting ideas and tools.
hook: She’s eager to trade seeds and tricks with travelers in hopes of improving her yields.
history: Inspired by a trader's odd seed gift, Tella has experimented with every planting method she can imagine.
voice: Breezy with quick, tumbling words and animated hand gestures.
line_1: Have you ever seen carrots grow in a barrel? Wait ‘til you see mine!
line_2: I’ll swap you three squash seeds for one of anything exotic!
rumor: Oh, have you noticed? When the moon wears its thin halo of light, the shepherds swear there's a queer ashy taste come mornin', like whispers of old fires long gone!

name: Rosko
description: Rosko Stovepipe is famous for his neat rows of beans and a smokehouse behind his tidy cottage.
look: Tall for a halfling, with bushy eyebrows, a round belly, and perpetually smoke-scented overalls.
personality: Steady and affable, Rosko loves to host neighbors and swap gentle jokes over a hot drink.
hook: He wants to help repair the village’s crumbling well to secure clean water for everyone’s fields.
history: The well once ran dry during a drought, and Rosko still remembers how it nearly ruined his entire crop.
voice: Deep, warm, and slow, nearly always with a stream of smoke curling from his pipe.
line_1: A good well keeps a good table and a happy belly, I say.
line_2: There’s always work worth doing if it means water in the cup.
rumor: Well now, jest the other mornin', I found this lil' bone doll, all swaddled in fabric like our missin' shepherd's cloak, right there on my doorstep.

name: Milna
description: Milna Fennylatch runs a small goat pasture where she makes sought-after soft cheese.
look: She has a sun-dappled complexion, long braids tucked under a floppy hat, and hands forever smelling of fresh milk.
personality: Nurturing and playful, Milna never shies from a joke and finds delight in small pleasures.
hook: She wants to organize a cheese-tasting but needs help convincing the shy neighbors to join in and share their own creations.
history: Years ago, Milna’s cheese won praise at a local fair, giving her the confidence to experiment and bring others together.
voice: Lively and inviting, with frequent laughter and a gentle teasing undertone.
line_1: You haven’t lived ‘til you’ve tasted goat cheese with wild honey—care for a sample?
line_2: Let’s tempt the others out of their shells—cheese works wonders for that!
rumor: Oh, you know the lone oak by the marsh? Folks say if you snatch a wink there, you'll wake with your toes where your head was! Ain't that a hoot?

name: Pippa
description: Pippa Rumbelly specializes in berry bushes and wild jams, often seen foraging along hedgerows with her baskets.
look: Twig-thin with tangled chestnut hair, smudged cheeks, and a berry-stained apron.
personality: Energetic and endlessly curious, Pippa rarely stands still and peppers conversation with questions.
hook: She’s searching for new berry patches and hopes to lead a foraging walk for village children.
history: An unexpected patch of cloudberries found as a child sparked her lifelong love of wild foods.
voice: Rapid, bright, and eager, her words bubble up as fast as her feet carry her.
line_1: I’ll wager there’s wild currants just over that rise—race you to find them!
line_2: You never know what the hedgerows are hiding ‘til you look.
rumor: Oh, oh! You won't believe what I found by the old stones—wildflowers bloomin' when they shouldn't, gorgeous they were, but the moment I plucked one? Blackened right in my hand, quick as a blink!

name: Jemro
description: Jemro Pebblebin grows potatoes and carrots, known for delivering surplus to anyone in need around town.
look: Broad-shouldered, with a beard spattered in earth and clothes patched with mismatched fabric.
personality: Dependable and modest, Jemro prefers to act rather than talk about his generosity.
hook: He wants to anonymously help an elderly neighbor repair a broken fence before livestock wander loose.
history: As a boy, Jemro relied on others for food during a hard season, prompting him to quietly aid those going through tough times.
voice: Straightforward and unhurried, with a low tone and more silence than most halflings.
line_1: If you see a need, best just get to it.
line_2: Fences don’t fix themselves, after all.
rumor: Aye, I've seen it myself at the crack of dawn, a queer green glow over the eastern hills.

name: Bilo
description: Bilo Whistlemead manages a patch of sunflowers and mead hives, humming as he works among the blooms.
look: Plump and short, with gold-flecked freckles, honey-sticky hands, and a perpetual flower tucked behind his ear.
personality: Sunny and optimistic, Bilo finds silver linings even when bees misbehave.
hook: He’s determined to save a struggling beehive and hopes to learn new hive care tricks from anyone willing to help.
history: A poor harvest last year was blamed on failing bees, motivating Bilo to become the best bee-tender he can.
voice: Light and sing-song, often slipping bee puns into casual chat.
line_1: Help me sweeten the deal for these bees, would you?
line_2: Busy as a bee? I know just what that feels like!
rumor: Oh, honey, have you heard? Those poor souls who wouldn't sell to the 'new charter' have had their barns burned to a crisp, all at the same un-bee-lievable time!

name: Dorry
description: Dorry Mossjug maintains mossy shaded plots perfect for mushrooms, sharing baskets with local kitchens.
look: Short and round with a shock of moss-green hair and sleeves always damp with dew.
personality: Calm and observant, Dorry prefers quiet company and enjoys hunting for rare fungi.
hook: She wants to find a friend to help her explore a new patch of woods rumored to be full of unusual mushrooms.
history: Dorry’s father once discovered a delicious mushroom variety by accident, making her eager for new finds.
voice: Soft and slightly breathy, each word delivered as if sharing a secret.
line_1: There’s stories of speckled caps just beyond the bend—care to look with me?
line_2: Quiet steps, now—mushrooms reward patience more than speed.
rumor: Y'know, I've heard tell that on waning moon nights, any milk left in the northeast corner of Old Keller's cellar curdles in a heartbeat—and no one’s brave enough to check why.

name: Gilna
description: Gilna Patchcobble runs a mixed farm on the village edge, known for lending tools and advice to new families.
look: Sturdy build, crimson cheeks, and crow’s feet from years of sun and laughter.
personality: Supportive and encouraging, she loves teaching and never hesitates to pitch in when help is needed.
hook: She hopes to rally volunteers to repair a stretch of the old farm path that’s become treacherous for carts.
history: After her own cart overturned last spring, Gilna vowed to see the ruts filled and the road made safe again.
voice: Firm but friendly, with a ready laugh and a habit of finishing others’ sentences.
line_1: No use grumbling—the best way forward is with good boots and good company.
line_2: Let’s get those potholes sorted before someone else’s wheel calls it quits!
rumor: Oh, those silent homesteads along the old road? They're locked up tight, but mark my words, someone's tending to 'em—laundry's fresh as morning dew.

name: Minno
description: Minno Cressmill cares for watercress beds beside the millstream and delivers bunches to the market each week.
look: Lithe and spry, with jet-black hair and perpetually damp trousers from wading in the shallows.
personality: Cheeky and clever, Minno loves a riddle and is quick to spot a bargain.
hook: He’s eager to discover a new way to keep fish from nibbling his crop, perhaps by enticing friendly critters to help.
history: Minno once lost an entire crop to hungry trout, convincing him to seek smarter solutions every season.
voice: Fast-talking and full of wit, often making little jokes on the fly.
line_1: If I only had fins, I’d have half the fish’s troubles and twice the greens!
line_2: Got any tricks for keeping clever mouths away from my cress?
rumor: Heard about that bookish fella, scampered off quicker'n a rabbit in a fox's den? Left behind a pile of scribbles, all hooded shadows and such.

name: Binna
description: Binna Tansybag maintains tidy rows of calendula and wildflowers, prized by the local healer.
look: Round glasses slide down her nose, with sun-kissed freckles and hands often sticky with flower resin.
personality: Inquisitive and bright-eyed, Binna is endlessly curious, peppering everyone with questions and observations.
hook: She wants to create a wildflower meadow on unused land to attract more bees and brighten the village.
history: Binna delighted in planting a tiny flower patch as a child, fueling her wish to share beauty with others.
voice: Quick and fluttery, words blooming into tangents before circling back.
line_1: Imagine the whole hillside alight with color this summer!
line_2: All it takes is a few seeds and a little patience, wouldn’t you say?
rumor: Oh, hello there, dearie! Did you hear about the old mill? No flour for weeks, and folks who went lookin'—poof!—like morning dew they've vanished, isn't that odd?

name: Hobin
description: Hobin Pickletun specializes in turnips and root vegetables, quick to bring pickled treats to neighbors in need.
look: Broad and rosy-cheeked, usually seen with a stained apron and a wooden spoon behind one ear.
personality: Helpful and jolly, Hobin can’t resist a good laugh or an excuse to feed someone.
hook: He wants to organize a pickling contest to lift spirits after a long, wet month.
history: Hobin once turned a blighted harvest into a pickled feast, boosting village morale.
voice: Booming with cheer, his sentences often end in hearty guffaws.
line_1: Nothing like a sharp pickle to put a smile on your face!
line_2: The wetter the season, the brinier the jokes, I say!
rumor: Ho ho, travelers! Did ya hear 'bout those raiders stackin' helmets and swords at the crossroads, toppin' it with a skull? Gives me the shivers, it does! Ha-ha!

name: Sarli
description: Sarli Breadmantle grows rye and barley, always sharing loaves and warmth with travelers at the crossroads.
look: Her skin is nut-brown, hair twisted into two thick plaits, and she carries the faint scent of baked bread.
personality: Kind and generous, Sarli listens more than she speaks but offers wisdom when it matters most.
hook: She hopes to gather stories from passersby to inspire a new bread recipe for the autumn fair.
history: An old family tale led Sarli to blend rye with honey, earning her a reputation for inventive loaves.
voice: Soft and soothing, with pauses that invite others to speak their mind.
line_1: A warm loaf and a new story—that’s the best way to break a day.
line_2: Every recipe has a tale behind it, just waiting to be told.
rumor: You know, folks say when you wander near that old tower, even the brightest lantern dims to but a mere glimmer.

name: Tippo
description: Tippo Meadowbun tends clustered bean trellises and clover lawns, encouraging everyone to stop for a chat under the shade trees.
look: Floppy-eared hat perched atop a wiry frame, with wind-burned cheeks and grass stains on his knees.
personality: Relaxed and neighborly, Tippo welcomes conversation and believes every problem can be solved together.
hook: He is puzzling over how to stop a mole from digging up his beans without chasing it away from its home entirely.
history: Tippo once rescued a baby mole, making him unwilling to harm even the trickiest of garden pests.
voice: Measured, with gentle pauses and a lilting cadence that invites comfort.
line_1: There’s room enough for both beans and moles if we think it through.
line_2: Got any solutions both the plants and the animals will sign off on?
rumor: Oh, you've heard about them wildflowers by the old stones, have you? Bloomin' when they shouldn't, but pick one and poof, it turns black as night, quick as a blink.

name: Fenni
description: Fenni Crispleaf tends to his vegetable plots with a no-nonsense attitude and little patience for idle chatter. He's known for the neatest rows and the strictest rules about trampling his cabbages.
look: Short and broad, with weathered arms, tanned cheeks, and straw-colored hair tucked under a floppy green cap. Dirt stains cling stubbornly to his elbows and knees.
personality: Pragmatic and quick to point out a waste of time, Fenni prefers getting things done over pleasantries. Not unfriendly, but brisk, and his dry wit sometimes lands harder than intended.
hook: Fenni wants to outdo a neighboring farmer in the next village harvest fair, believing the Crispleaf patch has gone underappreciated for too many years.
history: His bitter feelings started when he lost to his neighbor by a single prize carrot three years ago, souring what was once casual rural sport into a private rivalry.
voice: Speaks quickly and a little gruffly, often snipping words short. Sometimes clicks his tongue before answering.
line_1: Mind your step—that carrot bed's taken me three seasons to perfect.
line_2: If you fancy a real apple, you'll find mine best, despite what old Nelli Softroll says.
rumor: Oi, mark me words, somethin' big trampled straight through, no mind to fences nor fields.

name: Tamley
description: Tamley Windlepot manages several small plots with a knack for experimentation, always willing to try new planting tricks—sometimes to her own detriment.
look: Round-faced with a dusting of freckles, always seen in a faded yellow apron full of odd seeds and garden twine. Her hair is wild and sun-lightened.
personality: Enthusiastically curious, Tamley enjoys talking about plants more than people. She bounces between ideas but can lose interest quickly.
hook: Tamley believes a rare blue squash could thrive here and is determined to be the first to grow one—if she can find the right help.
history: She spent a season working as a trader’s assistant and brought back satchels of strange seeds, earning her both suspicion and admiration among neighboring halflings.
voice: Animated and a bit breathless, with a habit of humming words when pondering.
line_1: Ever seen a blue squash? No? Well, neither's anyone else—yet.
line_2: Careful now, that patch is trying something new—like me!
rumor: Oh, have you heard? That young blacksmith's lad, barely a sprout, he's churning out blades with ancient patterns! Says he 'remembers' 'em, hum-hmm, curiouser and curiouser!

name: Loro
description: Loro Goodbarrel manages his family apple orchard with businesslike efficiency but little personal attachment, viewing the farm as a means to an end.
look: Slim, neat, and always sporting a vest, Loro is rarely caught without a battered clipboard and ink-stained fingers.
personality: Reserved and calculating, preferring numbers to people; every conversation is weighed for its usefulness.
hook: He is planning to rent out a corner of his land to an outsider, hoping extra coin will get him closer to leaving village life behind.
history: Loro inherited the orchard from his aunt, but never shared her love of tilled earth, fueling his distant approach.
voice: Soft-spoken and precise, often pausing to consider every word before he speaks.
line_1: If you’re looking for the best yield, efficiency matters more than tradition.
line_2: I suppose sentiment has its place—but a field's not the place for it.
rumor: I've noticed, just as dawn's light graces the horizon, a curious hum stirring the still air.

name: Brinna
description: Brinna Puddlebank runs the marshy plots near the river, growing roots and reeds other farmers avoid. She takes quiet pride in her overlooked corner of the fields.
look: Petite with tangled brown hair and boots always caked in mud, sleeves perpetually rolled to the elbows.
personality: Resourceful and a touch secretive, she picks her words carefully and rarely raises her voice.
hook: Brinna longs for someone to finally value the flavors her marsh herbs can bring to the inn's stew but struggles to gain notice among bolder farmers.
history: She once shared her best pickings with the local cook, only to have her contribution forgotten during a festival. The memory still stings.
voice: Quiet, steady, and with a soft country lilt. Occasionally trails sentences off if she feels ignored.
line_1: There’s good eating found in mud, if you know where to look.
line_2: Maybe next season, the kitchen will remember whose turnips kept folk warm…
rumor: Reckon it's true what they're whisperin', that loudmouth against the co-op was left tied up, no more words to say.

name: Rello
description: Rello Fennylatch keeps a small but tidy plot behind his elder sister's cottage, preferring solitary work and keeping mostly to himself.
look: Lanky for a halfling, with straw-blonde hair, worn cord trousers, and patched sleeves, hands always stained with fresh earth.
personality: Introverted, methodical, and rarely smiles. He chooses his company as carefully as he weeds his garden.
hook: He is determined to master a new grafting technique to finally win modest praise from his demanding sister.
history: Rello once ruined a crop by following his sister's hurried advice, prompting him to focus on self-reliance ever since.
voice: Soft, halting speech; sometimes mumbles the end of his sentences, especially around family.
line_1: Best let a plant grow how it wants, instead of how someone tells it.
line_2: A quiet patch is worth more than a field full of noise, if you ask me.
rumor: Heard from the Miller’s boy, a wagon come down from the old fort, scrap metal all, and not a whisper of the folk who drove it.

name: Dorbo
description: Dorbo Butterroot tends goats and root vegetables, notorious for his ever-changing opinions about the best way to cure cheese.
look: Chunky with curly brown hair and a perpetual smear of cream on his tunic. His cheeks are bright and nearly always sunburnt.
personality: Opinionated and talkative, Dorbo loves a friendly argument almost as much as his cheese.
hook: He wants to convince the village council to fund a communal cheese cellar, thinking it'll cement his status as 'the' cheese expert.
history: Last autumn, his best wheels spoiled in a damp storage room, costing him a blue ribbon and sparking his campaign for better storage.
voice: Loud and jovial, with a big laugh that punctuates his own jokes. Surprising flexibility in tone when talking cheese.
line_1: You haven’t tasted real cheese unless it’s aged just right—take it from me.
line_2: Council's pockets may be tight, but so were my curds after last season’s disaster!
rumor: Heh, I've seen those hefty lads practicing with spears by twilight, claiming some mystery captain's their leader.

name: Milna
description: Milna Rumbelly juggles her carrot field and a thriving sideline in pickled preserves, never fully settling on which she prefers.
look: Round-hipped and soft, with tousled auburn hair usually tied under a faded kerchief. She wears clothes splashed with brine and carrot stains.
personality: Cheerful but always hurrying, sometimes frazzled, and easily distracted by new ideas.
hook: Milna wants to impress the innkeeper enough to buy her whole season’s supply of preserves, hoping it’ll give her more time to focus on tending crops.
history: Several years ago, she saved a failing pickle batch with a last-minute change, winning her first steady customer and setting her on the current sideline.
voice: Fast-talking and singsong, sometimes interrupts herself mid-sentence when a new idea strikes.
line_1: Oh, try this one! I swear, it’s spicier than last season.
line_2: If you know anyone keen on cucumbers, send ‘em my way!
rumor: Oh, you know, that lil' ol' prayer group in Jenkins' barn, it's not so little anymore—half the village's there, whisperin' 'bout power and who's really pullin' the strings, yes sirree!

name: Pavo
description: Pavo Softwhistle cultivates wildflowers between his vegetable beds, believing they keep his spirits and his crops in harmony.
look: Lean with sun-bleached hair and a tidy patchwork vest. Often seen with hands full of floral cuttings.
personality: Gentle yet stubborn, he dislikes conflict but silently resents when others mock his methods.
hook: Pavo wants to prove that his wildflower approach can boost the village’s honey yield, seeking someone to help gather evidence.
history: After his younger cousin’s bees struggled one year, Pavo began wildflower planting, but skepticism from others persists.
voice: Soft and airy, often trailing into gentle whistles or humming little tunes.
line_1: The bees know, even if folk don’t—the flowers keep us well.
line_2: They’ll scoff today, but I’ll have the honey to show for it come autumn.
rumor: I've tended these fields near the old tower for years, but recently that weather vane spins with no wind, like it's following something we can't see.

name: Orla
description: Orla Stovepipe runs the biggest pumpkin patch on the southern end, making her a fixture at harvest feasts and village gossip circles.
look: Tall for a halfling, with striking red braids, usually spattered with dirt and leaf bits, and a broad straw hat atop her head.
personality: Boisterous and charismatic, she loves a good story and isn’t above embellishing her successes.
hook: Orla is intent on keeping her title as 'biggest pumpkin grower' after a rival challenged her last winner’s weight.
history: Two years ago, her prized pumpkin mysteriously vanished before the judging, leading Orla to suspect a rival still.
voice: Loud, hearty, booms and laughs easily—her voice is impossible to miss at any gathering.
line_1: No one can out-pumpkin Orla—not this year, not ever!
line_2: You’d best keep your eyes peeled, friend. Competition runs thick in these fields.
rumor: Hah! You'll never believe it, but my own shadow's gone rogue—starts movin' before I even twitch! And now it's pointin' at things, things me eyes can't see!

name: Vibu
description: Vibu Buttonwick manages a tidy kitchen garden and a herd of squeaky ducks at the edge of the stream.
look: Petite, with springy dark curls and large brown eyes. Vibu often sports a patched apron stuffed with fresh herbs and a feather or two.
personality: Chatty but slightly scatterbrained, gives advice freely, solicited or not.
hook: She is secretly planning to breed a duck with blue-green feathers, hoping this curiosity will draw folk to her little stand at market.
history: Her penchant for dabbling with animal breeding began after a neighbor mistook her duck’s egg for a rare bird’s, much to Vibu’s glee.
voice: Quick and trilling, with bursts of excitement; sometimes mimics her ducks in conversation.
line_1: Heard of a blue duck? You just wait, I’ll show you yet!
line_2: My ducks may quack loud, but they know a good lettuce when they see one.
rumor: Oh, you didn't hear? Two nights back, horns were hollerin' across the hills, back and forth they went, quackin' like my ducks when they spy a fox!

name: Bodo
description: Bodo Tillowheat splits his days between grain fields and making repairs for neighbors, though he seldom lingers to talk after his chores.
look: Broad-shouldered and ruddy-cheeked, usually wearing sturdy boots and a faded shirt fastened with mismatched buttons.
personality: Reserved and practical, prefers work over conversation, but is fiercely diligent in all tasks.
hook: He wishes to replace an aging grain millstone and is quietly bartering for parts, wary his rivals may try to undercut him.
history: He once botched a repair that forced an entire season’s crop to be ground by hand, a mistake he refuses to repeat.
voice: Gruff and spare with words, stoic, but softens his tone when discussing tools or machinery.
line_1: A job done right is worth more than three done quick.
line_2: Mill needs a new stone soon—or else we’ll be sore of arm by midwinter.
rumor: Some nights, I'm out late with the harvest, and that hill ground near the gallows—it's like it's breathin'.

name: Peppi
description: Peppi Underfen manages root crops in the shadowy marsh, always keeping a nose for secrets and a knack for swapping news.
look: Slim, slightly stooped, with quick fingers and eagle-sharp eyes, always sporting a green scarf and muddy boots.
personality: Cunning and sly, never a word wasted and always eager to trade information for favors.
hook: Peppi wants to learn why the marsh’s water level is dropping, hoping to profit by being the first to act.
history: He discovered a neighbor’s leaking irrigation ditch last spring, which nearly cost him his own crops and left him wary of others’ carelessness.
voice: Low, quick, whispers when others draw near, often peppers speech with knowing winks.
line_1: There’s more beneath the mud than folk think—if you know where to look.
line_2: Noticed the water’s off? Might be worth finding who’s to blame, eh?
rumor: Oh, you've got an ear for the obscure, aye? Just between us—mention the old Costgrave lineage, and watch as your ink dances a dark, spreading waltz across the parchment.

name: Gilly
description: Gilly Sweetstem’s berry patch sits at the edge of the woods, producing the juiciest fruit, though she rarely shares with outsiders.
look: Round-faced, rosy, with jet-black ringlets kept under a sunhat. Berry stains dot her hands and sleeves.
personality: Protective and a touch mistrustful, measuring strangers with a calculating glance.
hook: She hopes her berries can fetch a higher price this year, and carefully guards her patch to keep thieves at bay.
history: Last summer, a group of children raided her berries for pies, leaving Gilly determined to watch the edges more closely.
voice: Pinched and cautious, often adds a huff at the end of sentences.
line_1: Keep your fingers out of my bushes unless you plan on paying.
line_2: One missing berry, and I know exactly who to ask first.
rumor: I've seen them frost patterns on the windows, even in the summer's heat, all sharp and twisty-like.

name: Tero
description: Tero Stovepipe maintains an orderly onion field, famous for its lack of weeds and the sharpness of its harvest tools.
look: Short and stocky, reddish hair kept in a neat ponytail, sleeves always buttoned up, and a weathered belt full of gardening knives.
personality: Disciplined and brisk, little tolerance for delays or disorder.
hook: Determined to teach the younger folk pride in neat fields, Tero wants help organizing a tidy-up contest for the village children.
history: When his nephew’s plot was ridiculed at a fair, Tero decided the next generation would value order as much as he does.
voice: Clipped, efficient speech; often points with a tool for emphasis.
line_1: A clean row means a healthy harvest—simple as that.
line_2: Let’s see who keeps the tidiest patch this time!
rumor: Those kids, mark my words, they're pointing at stars, naming 'em with names no one's heard before.

name: Nella
description: Nella Crispleaf keeps a neat herb plot and acts as an informal advisor among her neighbors, though her advice is sometimes as sharp as her parsley.
look: Petite, with chestnut hair pulled back under a woven headband. Her hands always smell of mint and fennel.
personality: Direct and sometimes brusque, with a knack for getting to the heart of any matter.
hook: She wants to host a midsummer tasting event, hoping to remind everyone why her herbs deserve their reputation.
history: Years ago, she earned modest fame when a trader praised her mint at market, sparking her determination to keep her herbs in the public eye.
voice: Level and pointed, often clicks her tongue when she’s impatient.
line_1: Taste this—tell me you’ve tried a better mint.
line_2: Folk may chatter, but the flavor speaks for itself.
rumor: I've seen 'em, cloaked folks with smooth words, peddlin' loans to us farmers.

name: Jopi
description: Jopi Goodbarrel manages cider apples and prefers working alone, rarely seen without a flask of last year’s best batch.
look: Slight and wiry, wind-reddened skin, always with pockets full of apple cores and half-peeled sticks.
personality: Taciturn, slow to trust, but softens around earnest helpers or fellow cider lovers.
hook: Jopi is testing a secret yeast, eager to impress the next traveling merchant and boost his reputation.
history: After a batch was spoiled by careless help, Jopi learned to keep his orchard locked and rarely relies on others.
voice: Low, gravelly, punctuates rare words with careful pauses.
line_1: Good cider takes patience—both in brewing, and in folk.
line_2: I’d rather let apples rot than have them mishandled again.
rumor: Heard tell 'bout them wildflowers by the old stones—bloom outta season, they do.

name: Binna
description: Binna Puddlebank maintains vegetable beds along the soggy banks, mingling farming with a love of frogs and small critters.
look: Spry, springy gait, hair always tangled with twigs, and sleeves damp from river work.
personality: Playful and curious, often distracted by the creatures hiding among her plants.
hook: Binna is desperate to protect a clutch of rare frogs she discovered among her beans, sure they’ll be trampled without careful watch.
history: She once cared for an injured hedgehog until it recovered, giving her a soft spot for all creatures living in her fields.
voice: High-pitched and singsong, often imitates frog croaks mid-sentence without realizing.
line_1: Shh! There’s a nest in there—listen closely and you’ll hear them singing.
line_2: If it’s life you seek, you’ll find it in muddy banks like these.
rumor: Oh, you know the old tower's weathervane, croak-croak, it's gone all silly, pointing to secrets beneath our feet instead of the whistling winds, ribbit-ribbit! What's hiding down there, I wonder?

name: Tolli
description: Tolli Buttonwick runs a tidy bean patch, investing more energy in perfect rows than in chasing bigger yields.
look: Short and sturdy, with cropped brown hair, round glasses, and a perpetually wrinkled apron.
personality: Detail-oriented and proud, enjoys pointing out the tiniest improvements in his methods.
hook: He is trying to out-do an older cousin’s patch by winning a prize for straightest rows, hoping to settle a friendly family rivalry.
history: Lost his temper at last year’s fair when a crooked furrow cost him the prize, causing some gentle teasing in the family.
voice: Measured and slightly nasal, with an undercurrent of competitiveness when beans are mentioned.
line_1: A single crooked row, and it’s all anyone talks about—never again!
line_2: Straight lines, straight thinking—that’s my approach.
rumor: I've seen it myself, that mist hanging stubborn as a weed in the old orchard, clear skies or no.

name: Dori
description: Dori Rumbelly keeps an orchard on the edge of the woods, enjoying both the solitude and a few sips of plum cordial among the branches.
look: Plump, silver-streaked hair, soft eyes, and an easy smile. Always wears an apron smeared with fruit stains.
personality: Relaxed and easygoing, but wily when it comes to bartering fruit at market.
hook: She seeks to broker a deal with the local baker for exclusive rights to supply fruit, hoping to keep competitors at bay.
history: Dori missed out on a large delivery last autumn, losing profits to a rival. She’s keen not to be outmaneuvered again.
voice: Warm and lilting, often with a chuckle or sly wink.
line_1: Ah, to taste my plums fresh from the tree—there’s nothing finer.
line_2: Deals are best made in the shade, with a bit of trust and a bite of fruit.
rumor: Heh, ye heard 'bout that scribe at the manor, aye? Started jabberin' 'bout extra lines appearin' on his copy o' some dusty old scroll.

name: Tando
description: Tando Windlepot farms potatoes at the crossroads, always eager for new visitors to share a drink or a story.
look: Reddish hair, an easy smile, and cheeks marked by laughter lines. Padding around barefoot even on chilly mornings.
personality: Open-hearted and inquisitive, sometimes nosy, but always welcoming.
hook: Tando wants to gather tales from travelers for his evening gatherings, hoping to attract more visitors—and custom—to his farmstand.
history: He once hosted a wandering bard, whose music tripled his sales for a week. Since then, he’s dreamed of recreating that magic.
voice: Friendly and warm, quick to laugh, with a booming voice that carries across the field.
line_1: Every traveler brings a story to trade—care for a pint and a tale?
line_2: You never know who you’ll meet at the crossroads, eh?
rumor: Heard those miners struck into a queer sort of place, with carvings in the rock so fresh, you'd think someone's been at it just yesterday.

name: Orlo
description: Orlo runs the village’s only inn with a forced smile and an eye for opportunity, always watching for an angle to benefit himself.
look: He’s round-faced and spry, with oily brown curls and ruby cheeks that shift easily between a welcoming grin and a sly frown.
personality: Charming on the surface but calculating underneath, Orlo uses flattery and humor to get what he wants while holding grudges quietly.
hook: He wants to control the village’s local trade by gently sabotaging rival businesses and collecting secrets on guests for leverage.
history: After a failed attempt to blackmail a traveling merchant, Orlo learned to be subtler in his deceptions and now prefers manipulation over open threats.
voice: Speaks quickly, sprinkling jokes into every sentence, but his tone sharpens if conversation turns serious or crosses his interests.
line_1: Let me fetch you something special—on the house, for a friend, eh?
line_2: Best keep your purse close here; not everyone is as trustworthy as me.
rumor: Heh, you'll get a kick outta this one: Our local jester's been doodling ancient gibberish in the dirt like some possessed scholar—probably knows more secrets than he lets on, eh?

name: Brinna
description: Brinna oversees the inn’s kitchen and rooms with tight control, ensuring guests never see what goes on behind closed doors.
look: She is plump and constantly dusted with flour, her small hands always clutching a ledger or ring of heavy keys.
personality: Gruff and bossy, she manages staff with intimidation and expects obedience from everyone under her roof.
hook: Brinna aims to quietly drive out families she dislikes, so she can buy up their homes for cheap and expand her influence.
history: Years ago, she ousted a rival baker by spreading rumors about tainted bread, proving she’s willing to ruin reputations for gain.
voice: Low, clipped, and almost barked, her words come sharply—except when sweet-talking travelers with fat purses.
line_1: You’ll find the beds clean, but don’t cause trouble in my house.
line_2: Funny, how some folks never last around here—maybe they just don’t belong.
rumor: Heard about the deer strung up like a butcher's prize? Those night hunters ain't normal—leaving a bloody mess as a warning.

name: Fenni
description: Fenni manages the common room with an infectious laugh and a knack for eavesdropping on every important conversation.
look: Short and wiry, with gap-toothed smile and sparkling hazel eyes always darting about the room.
personality: Appears friendly and chatty but collects gossip and secrets, enjoying others’ misfortunes a bit too much.
hook: She is building a hidden book of local secrets to quietly blackmail guests and townsfolk for favors and coin.
history: Once caught snooping in the mayor’s home, she narrowly escaped trouble with a clever lie, learning deception could open doors.
voice: Her voice is lively and mischievous, often ending sentences with a quick giggle or conspiratorial whisper.
line_1: You’d be amazed what folks say after two ales and a slice of pie!
line_2: Now, now—careful who you trust in this place. Secrets have a way of slipping out.
rumor: Oh, haven't you heard? Those poor riders sent to the watch-post, not a soul returned, and the flag's all in shreds now.

name: Loro
description: Loro acts the warm, welcoming host, but ensures travelers fall victim to overpriced meals and watered-down drink.
look: His round belly is always stuffed into brightly colored vests, and his quick eyes miss nothing that passes through his inn.
personality: Effusively friendly in public, but privately enjoys manipulating prices and taking advantage of outsiders.
hook: He wants to drive all competition out of the food trade by fixing prices and spreading false rumors.
history: Years ago, Loro managed to bankrupt a traveling cookshop by steering rumors and complaints their way.
voice: Smooth, velvet tone—his voice drips with false concern and practiced hospitality.
line_1: Welcome, welcome! You’ll not find a finer stew, though it’s a wee price.
line_2: Strange, those others always complaining—maybe they just don’t have the palate for good food.
rumor: Oh, dear guests, have you heard the tragic news? Those poor farmsteads just wouldn't join our community effort and, alas, what a coincidence their misfortune is.

name: Tamley
description: Tamley watches quietly from behind the bar, pocketing unattended coins and listening for loose tongues.
look: Slim, pale, and slightly hunched, her sharp brown eyes rarely blink, and she always wears a faded apron.
personality: Cautious and secretive, she prefers to work in shadows and lets others do the talking while she observes.
hook: She is collecting evidence of villagers’ misdeeds to blackmail them for personal profit and protection.
history: After avoiding eviction through threats, Tamley now gathers secrets to keep anyone from crossing her again.
voice: Quiet and deliberate; speaks rarely, but her words land like stones when she decides to talk.
line_1: Quiet nights are best, don’t you agree? No one looking where they shouldn’t.
line_2: People only notice coins when they go missing—best remember that.
rumor: Some whisper that my shadow has grown a mind of its own, lagging behind with a touch of defiance, gesturing towards unseen specters only it perceives.

name: Vibu
description: Vibu’s inn is the cleanest in town, but he hires desperate folk for pennies and bullies them into silence.
look: Stocky and well-kept, with tidy silver hair and spectacles perched low on his nose.
personality: Polite to guests but curt and domineering to his staff, never tolerating mistakes or backtalk.
hook: Desperate to maintain his spotless reputation, he quietly threatens and discards any worker who might expose his cruelty.
history: A former stable boy, Vibu once lost a position after complaining about abuse; now, he ensures in secret that no one dares challenge him.
voice: Measured and cold when addressing staff, but becomes overly sweet and formal with guests.
line_1: Our standards are high here, and I expect the same from all my helpers.
line_2: If you see a staff member slacking, do let me know—I like to keep things running perfectly.
rumor: Oh, dear guests, please pay no mind to the trivial countryside superstitions about those crude totems by the creek.

name: Milna
description: Milna feigns kindness, but quietly adds questionable ingredients to meals for those who cross her.
look: Chubby and red-haired, always wearing a cheery kerchief and flour-dusted cheeks that mask sharp green eyes.
personality: Bubbly on the surface but vindictive if insulted, she remembers every slight.
hook: She wants to keep her authority unquestioned by punishing rude guests with tainted food or unpleasant surprises.
history: Local tales whisper how a rival who insulted Milna once fell mysteriously ill after dining with her.
voice: Singsong and high-pitched, but her words trail off into pointed silences when displeased.
line_1: Oh dear, you look famished—let me whip up something you’ll never forget.
line_2: We try to treat everyone right… as long as they respect our house.
rumor: Oh, dearies, have you noticed? On the clearest nights, the stars play hide-and-seek in the puddles before twinkling above.

name: Dorbo
description: Dorbo pretends to be everyone’s friend but encourages quarrels and feuds among guests for his own amusement.
look: Ruddy-faced with a droopy mustache and a habit of wringing his hands whenever things get tense.
personality: Jovial in appearance but stirs discord with sly remarks, enjoying the chaos he sows.
hook: Dorbo provokes trouble so guests are too distracted to notice him shortchanging them or snooping in their belongings.
history: He once narrowly avoided exposure when a traveler caught him pocketing valuables during a staged argument.
voice: Talks fast, voice rising with excitement whenever confrontation brews.
line_1: Did you hear what she just said about your boots? Imagine!
line_2: No need to thank me; folks love a bit of spirit around here.
rumor: Oh, you'll love this one—those hunters swear by it, a lantern just dancin' through the trees, bobbin' along, defying the very whims of the wind! Ain't that a hoot?

name: Sibba
description: Sibba’s inn boasts the cheapest beer, but she waters every cask and hands out the leftovers to unsuspecting guests.
look: Petite with bushy brown curls, always seen wiping the counter or eyeing the coin box.
personality: Bitter and penny-pinching, she feigns poverty to avoid scrutiny while padding her profits.
hook: She wants to trick wealthier travelers with counterfeit spirits and make off with their belongings while they’re distracted.
history: Long ago, Sibba was caught stealing beer from her father’s cellar and learned to hide her moves with fake tears.
voice: Her tone shifts from pleading to sharp, adapting easily to get what she wants.
line_1: Try the special—can’t get a better deal anywhere, I promise.
line_2: Times are hard, friend... but a little generosity makes it better for everyone.
rumor: Oh, dear hearts, have you heard? Every single week, that chapel's candles snuff out all at once—no wind, no nothing.

name: Jorin
description: Jorin’s back rooms are rarely empty—they serve as a nest for small-time thieves he shelters for a cut of their loot.
look: He’s swarthy and wiry with sharp, darting eyes and a permanent half-smile shadowing his lips.
personality: Quiet and observant, he always seems to know more than he admits, preferring the company of scoundrels.
hook: Jorin wants to attract the right ‘guests’ to grow his own cut of petty theft, keeping honest folk out of his way.
history: He once protected a young pickpocket from town guards in exchange for half the stolen goods, seeing profit in crime.
voice: Soft, sly, and a little too friendly; pauses often as if weighing every word.
line_1: You need a room out of sight? I can be discreet, for the right price.
line_2: Some inns judge. I just serve—no questions asked.
rumor: Oh, those travelers? They've been whispering of ghostly steps in the fog.

name: Reni
description: Reni is well-liked on the surface, but she maintains her popularity by spreading rumors about rivals and manipulating friendships.
look: Freckle-faced and always in bright yellow scarves, she bounces lightly on her feet wherever she goes.
personality: Playful and nosy, she weaves gossip effortlessly and enjoys social maneuvering.
hook: She wants to remain the center of the village’s attention by quietly turning the community against competitors.
history: As a child, Reni was left out by others until she realized influence comes from shaping rumors, not truth.
voice: Talks in rapid bursts, peppered with laughter and pointed comments just shy of outright mockery.
line_1: Did you hear what Tomlin’s up to now? Oh, I’d never spread tales, but folks ought to know.
line_2: It’s amazing how a few words can change a person’s luck, isn’t it?
rumor: Heard about the crossroads? Raiders made themselves an art piece... good! Can't wait to see who's missing their head, eh?

name: Cella
description: Cella smiles sweetly as she serves guests but pockets anything left unattended or dropped.
look: Small and sprightly with sharp dimples and nimble fingers stained with fruit.
personality: Deceptively innocent-seeming, she acts helpful and resourceful to distract from her thieving habits.
hook: She wants to amass a hidden trove of minor treasures by pilfering from distracted guests.
history: Caught stealing pies as a child but talked her way out of it, making theft a secret art form.
voice: High-pitched and singsong, with nervous laughter whenever serious topics arise.
line_1: Oh, don’t worry, I’m just tidying up—let me get that for you.
line_2: It’s funny how much folks forget behind when they’re not looking.
rumor: Oh, have you heard? That poor healer, such a dear, but everything she touches just spoils—teehee!—and her fingers, oh! They're like little charcoal sticks now, so strange!

name: Bendo
description: Bendo keeps the fire hot and the gossip hotter, trading secrets with shady travelers for a price.
look: Broad-shouldered for a halfling, with black soot smudges on his arms and a permanently arched eyebrow.
personality: Gruff toward most but quickly warms up to those who offer coin, always ready to sell information.
hook: Bendo hopes to buy back a lost family plot by selling the secrets and weaknesses of his guests.
history: He lost his family land to swindlers and now values money over morals, seeing guests as opportunities.
voice: Gravelly, with slow and deliberate speech; low chuckles punctuate his sentences when he finds an angle.
line_1: Careful—fire’s hot, and so’s the news if you’ve coin to spare.
line_2: Folk might not trust me, but they still want what I know.
rumor: Heh, those shepherds claim their sheep are gettin' all cozy at night, starin' out toward the dark hills.

name: Mapla
description: Mapla’s inn is famous for its hearty meals but infamous for her habit of overcharging outsiders and shorting their portions.
look: Round, rosy-cheeked, with a large apron, curly hair, and a permanently smug smirk.
personality: Ostentatiously warm but quick to anger if questioned about prices or missing goods.
hook: She seeks to line her pockets as much as possible by taking advantage of travelers, especially those who can’t count in the local currency.
history: When her father left her deep in debt, Mapla resolved to never let sentiment interfere with profit again.
voice: Loud and theatrical, her words sing-song until money is mentioned, when she turns curt.
line_1: Hearty servings cost hearty coin, you know!
line_2: If you can’t pay, you’d best find another place to sleep.
rumor: Oh, dearies, have you heard the latest? Such strange tracks in the mud, prancing 'round like soldiers on parade, not mere creatures of the wild.

name: Tillo
description: Tillo offers false friendship to travelers, conning them with rigged games and loaded dice after dark.
look: Lanky for a halfling, always wearing a battered cap and shifty eyes; his left ear is pierced twice.
personality: All smiles until gambling’s mentioned, at which point his demeanor turns razor sharp.
hook: He wants to win enough through cheating out-of-towners to pay off an old gambling debt and restore his reputation.
history: He was run out of a neighboring village after a game went sour, so now he cheats with greater caution.
voice: Whispery, thick with sly reassurance, his voice hitches nervously when confronted.
line_1: Fancy a little game after supper? The dice are lucky tonight.
line_2: Life’s about chances—just try not to lose your last shirt.
rumor: Ah, travelers, lean in close—there's talk of a forest path, freshly carved, where a meal's been left steaming.

name: Belba
description: Belba’s inn looks charming but she blackmails fellow villagers with knowledge overheard from guests.
look: Soft-featured with a perpetual gentle smile, her brown curls always perfectly in place.
personality: Quiet but never misses a detail, she lets others underestimate her while collecting leverage.
hook: She maintains influence by using secrets as currency, trading favors for silence.
history: After overhearing a scandal and using it to get her way, Belba found blackmail more profitable than honesty.
voice: Melodic, gentle, almost motherly, but sometimes her words linger with a subtle warning.
line_1: A little privacy can be worth so much, don’t you find?
line_2: People trust me with their stories—sometimes I wish they wouldn’t.
rumor: Oh, dearies, have you heard? That wagon from the old fort, they say its cargo was melded by some unseen fire—still warm, even.

name: Fen
description: Fen shows eager hospitality to strangers while plotting to sway travelers into ‘finding’ goods he wants stolen.
look: Tall for a halfling and quick on his feet, with sandy hair and a mischievous twinkle.
personality: Playful and clever; he nudges others into temptation under a mask of innocent mischief.
hook: He wants to use gullible travelers to do his dirty work by suggesting small thefts or vandalism for his own gain.
history: Fen once profited by guiding strangers to burgle his competitor’s cider stock, making it look like an accident.
voice: Witty and fast-talking, with sly hints and meaningful glances.
line_1: Sometimes things just go missing—can’t imagine why!
line_2: A clever guest can make a little extra with the right opportunity.
rumor: Oh, you didn't hear? A strange trail's been etched across the farmlands, as if some gargantuan guest forgot the courtesy of using the roads.

name: Nilo
description: Nilo carefully tracks each guest’s worth, gradually raising prices for those who appear wealthier.
look: Neatly dressed with ink-stained fingers, his spectacles constantly slipping down his nose.
personality: Calculating and precise, he rarely speaks to anyone he suspects cannot pay handsomely.
hook: He wants to increase his fortune by selectively cheating wealthier guests, keeping poorer ones at bay.
history: After being cheated out of an inheritance, Nilo swore never to miss a chance to skim a little extra.
voice: Measured, always polite but with a clipped efficiency; pauses to adjust his glasses when nervous.
line_1: Apologies for the rate change—times do change, after all.
line_2: You get what you pay for, and sometimes, a little more.
rumor: I've heard the war drums, each night a crescendo of impending doom.

name: Delyn
description: Delyn ingratiates herself with important travelers, using their trust to spy or set traps for rivals.
look: Bright red hair tied back in ribbons, and a few careless flour stains on her knuckles.
personality: Charming and enthusiastic, but her warmth is calculated to extract secrets or favors.
hook: She wants to outmaneuver a local rival by working with well-connected strangers to subtly sabotage them.
history: She once betrayed a close friend for a better spot at the market and found victory sweet enough to repeat.
voice: Cheerful, full of exclamations and laughter, but occasionally lets slip a coldness when angered.
line_1: Guests like you make life here interesting—so many stories to share!
line_2: Don’t mind me; I always keep an ear to the ground for useful news.
rumor: Oh, bless your heart for asking, dearie! Have you heard? They say those poor, lost miners' lanterns still flicker deep underground, dancing like will-o'-the-wisps through the cracks.

name: Rabbo
description: Rabbo keeps a ledger of debts and uses it to quietly control both staff and frequent guests.
look: Balding, with bushy sideburns and large, expressive eyes that never quite close.
personality: Stern but outwardly jovial, he focuses on obligation and loyalty as tools for manipulation.
hook: He wishes to rule the village’s commerce by keeping others constantly in his debt.
history: Rabbo pulled his family out of bankruptcy by ensnaring neighbors through unfavorable loans and careful record-keeping.
voice: Slow, reassuring, punctuated by gentle laughter that feels oddly hollow.
line_1: A debt’s a simple thing—easy to acquire, hard to forget.
line_2: I always look after my friends, for a price.
rumor: Heh-heh-heh, you know, they say that travelers resting under that old oak by the marsh, they wake up all turned around, same spot but different gaze, curious, isn't it?

name: Milna
description: Milna Rumbelly runs the village’s busiest inn with cheer and a warm welcome for every guest. She is known for her endless patience and quick wit.
look: A round, rosy-cheeked halfling with springy chestnut curls, flour dust on her apron, and twinkling green eyes. She keeps her sleeves rolled up and never seems to stop moving.
personality: Milna is jovial, quick to laugh, and always eager to share a story or bit of gossip. She has a knack for putting people at ease and never raises her voice in anger.
hook: She hopes to bring the whole village together by hosting a harvest feast, secretly wishing to mend a few local grudges in the process.
history: After settling a long-standing quarrel between two regulars last spring, she’s made it her mission to encourage harmony among villagers.
voice: Her voice is melodic and brisk, often punctuated by gentle chuckles or reassuring murmurs.
line_1: You sit down and I’ll have you full and smiling in no time, promise!
line_2: Oh, don’t mind poor Dillie—he grumbles, but he’s got a sweet tooth all the same.
