rumor: Oh, dearie, have you heard? Those ruffians collecting 'debts' are leaving the nastiest drawings at the farms—nooses, knives, even burning homes! It's enough to curdle the ale, truly.

name: Borro
description: Borro Softwhistle manages a small riverside inn, famous for its calm atmosphere and fresh berry pastries. He is always ready with a song or a kind word.
look: Short and sturdy, Borro sports sandy hair and a neat mustache, with breeches always patched but clean. He wears a faded blue vest with wooden buttons.
personality: Gentle and calming, Borro prefers listening over speaking and subtly smooths over awkward moments with soft humor.
hook: He wishes to find a lost family recipe for spiced cider to surprise his aging mother on her birthday.
history: As a child, he’d help his grandmother gather wild apples and spices—her recipe was lost after she passed five autumns ago.
voice: His speech is measured and soft, often with a soothing whistle or gentle hum between words.
line_1: We’ve always a seat open by the fire—stories sound better there, I think.
line_2: If you’ve ever tasted a cider finer than ours, well, I’d dearly like to meet the one who brewed it.
rumor: Mmm-hmm, travelers have been whisperin', yes, whisperin' indeed, about that watch-post on the ridge.

name: Tamley
description: Tamley Goodbarrel is the welcoming face behind the bustling crossroads inn, beloved for her hearty meals and easy laughter.
look: She is tall for a halfling, with sun-freckled skin, tightly braided russet hair, and calloused hands from years of hauling casks.
personality: Upbeat and motherly, Tamley loves to feed anyone in need and never judges a guest.
hook: She strives to help a young orphan find steady work, hoping to ease his loneliness and fight the stigma of his birth.
history: Orphaned herself, Tamley remembers the hardship of outsiders’ suspicion and wants better for the next generation.
voice: Warm and boisterous, her laugh bubbles out mid-sentence, and she addresses everyone with affectionate nicknames.
line_1: Eat up! No friend of mine leaves hungry, understand?
line_2: If you’ve work to spare, little Nall’s keen and quick—don’t let his timid eyes fool you.
rumor: Oh, my little sparrow, have you heard? That flustered scholar left behind a whole mess of papers, each one scribblin' that same cloaked character over and over, bless their heart!

name: Fenni
description: Fenni Stovepipe keeps the roadside inn tidy and the guests entertained, always ready with a joke or a plate of scones.
look: Chubby and broad-faced, Fenni wears wire spectacles, a battered felt hat, and always smells faintly of cinnamon.
personality: Chatty and playful, with a sharp memory for details shared by guests, making every visitor feel like an old friend.
hook: She is determined to collect amusing travel stories from visitors to self-publish a book—all proceeds for the village orphan fund.
history: Her late brother inspired her charity after dying young; she honors him by supporting those in need.
voice: Her voice is bright and slightly nasal, breaking into peals of laughter or exaggerated whispers for juicy tales.
line_1: Got a good yarn to share? I’ll swap you for a scone, extra jam!
line_2: Oh, you’d be surprised what secrets people share after the second cup of cider!
rumor: Oh, have you not heard? Those tight-pursed merchants at the counting-house, they're only taking coins stamped with their fancy mark now.

name: Vibu
description: Vibu Tillowheat runs a quaint inn tucked by the wheat fields, known for baked bread and a kind smile at sundown.
look: Petite and spry, with a mop of loose blonde curls, Vibu wears simple linen gowns and always carries a freshly cut flower.
personality: Soft-spoken, encouraging, and noticeably attentive to even the smallest troubles of guests.
hook: Vibu hopes to gently encourage two neighboring farmers to reconcile and end their petty feud at the next dinner gathering.
history: Witnessing her parents cease speaking over a small matter for years inspired her to help others avoid the same fate.
voice: Her tone is delicate, with careful words and shy pauses, but a sincere warmth is always evident.
line_1: If you need anything at all, just give a little wave—don’t be shy, now.
line_2: Would you believe, half the troubles here could be fixed with a slice of pie and honest talk?
rumor: Oh, dear traveler, have you heard? By the old granary, there are curious footprints leading in, but none ever come out, even after a fresh sweeping.

name: Loro
description: Loro Underfen keeps a tidy, ivy-clad inn by the stream, famed for his good-natured teasing and endless herbal teas.
look: Slim, with crow-black hair peppered with silver, Loro is always in neat vests and spotted kerchiefs.
personality: Playfully sarcastic but always compassionate, he is patient with guests and a quiet observer.
hook: Loro wants to help a regular guest overcome shyness and muster courage to propose to his sweetheart.
history: Years ago, Loro spent a lonely time wishing he'd confessed his own affections—he now plays matchmaker whenever he can.
voice: His speech is lively, with quick quips and a low, steady cadence, often ending sentences with a conspiratorial wink.
line_1: Best tea in the shire, but no refunds if it makes you brave enough to sing in public.
line_2: If I’d had a bit more nerve at your age, well, I’d have fewer regrets and a warmer hearth!
rumor: Ah, you've heard about our young blacksmith's prodigy, eh? Starts hammerin' out blades with ancient patterns as if the anvil's whisperin' old secrets to him.

name: Brinna
description: Brinna Buttonwick manages the hilltop inn with grace, offering quiet comfort to travelers and villagers alike.
look: She has close-cropped chestnut hair, dimples, and crisp white shirts adorned with colorful buttons sewn by hand.
personality: Brinna is resolute and unflappable, with a gentle humor and a knack for remembering faces and stories.
hook: She wants to patch up the leaking barn roof before the season’s storms to prevent her neighbor’s crops from spoiling.
history: Saved as a child from a flooded outbuilding by that neighbor, Brinna has never forgotten the kindness shown to her family.
voice: Her tone is low and steady, with precise words and a reassuring steadiness that calms any commotion.
line_1: Rain or shine, everyone’s welcome here—just mind your boots on my clean floors.
line_2: A roof’s not much good with holes, friend. Better we mend them now than sweep up muddy puddles later.
rumor: Have you heard? A trail of branches, all snapped nine feet high and marked with giant bite marks, leads deep into the forest.

name: Heddo
description: Heddo Puddlebank runs a lively lakeside inn, popular for fishing tales and weeknight stew competitions.
look: He’s portly with a smattering of freckles, perpetually damp pants from tending the lakeshore garden, and eyes that crinkle when he smiles.
personality: Enthusiastic and optimistic, Heddo loves to organize friendly contests and includes even the shyest stranger.
hook: He’s determined to win the upcoming stew contest for the first time and will gladly accept help perfecting his recipe.
history: After coming in last place for three years, Heddo is eager for a bit of recognition from his talented friends.
voice: His voice is booming and musical, often rising in excitement, with a tendency to repeat words when especially pleased.
line_1: Stew’s nearly ready—just need one more good pinch of something, but what?
line_2: You help me win, I’ll keep you in pie for a year—deal?
rumor: Ah, friends, friends! Have you heard, heard the whispers? The prayer circle in old Barnaby's barn, it's grown, grown so big, and they're asking who—who really rules our roost, eh?

name: Cassi
description: Cassi Windlepot tends a cozy hillfoot inn and is a skilled brewer, known for her special honeyed ale.
look: Leaning on the stocky side, Cassi sports short auburn hair, a dimpled chin, and aprons stained with berry and malt.
personality: Friendly but practical, Cassi is generous with supplies but fiercely protective of her brewing secrets.
hook: She is eager to find more local honey suppliers after her main source moved away, and hopes to support other small producers.
history: Having once relied too much on a single vendor and nearly gone under, she now looks for ways to involve the whole village.
voice: Her voice is bright, with a quick rhythm and the occasional growling sigh when exasperated.
line_1: Best ale in five valleys, but you didn’t hear that from me.
line_2: Any chance you know where to find wild bee trees? A secret for a secret!
rumor: Been hearing whispers that something's been tampering with the farms come nightfall—gates ajar, hounds tied up, and doors streaked with red clay.

name: Joppo
description: Joppo Crispleaf keeps a tidy inn on the village green, celebrated for clever tricks and the best apple tarts in the county.
look: Slender, sharp-nosed, with sandy hair always tousled, Joppo wears patchwork vests and bright red shoes.
personality: Witty, quick-talking, and enthusiastic about puzzles and games with his guests.
hook: Joppo wants to revive the old harvest juggling competition, aiming to bring laughter and excitement back to the square.
history: His fondest memories are of the old fair days, and he’s saddened by how few bother with such traditions lately.
voice: He speaks with fast, clipped words and a tone that rises on punchlines, rarely missing a beat.
line_1: Bet you a tart you can’t juggle three apples—go on, prove me wrong!
line_2: If people forget to laugh, all the warm pies in the world won’t help, eh?
rumor: Heh, ever notice the old Grainsworth place, eh? Not a raindrop dares touch it, just dances right off! Must be shy, or maybe it's just not thirsty, eh?

name: Dorbo
description: Dorbo Fennylatch presides over a sun-dappled inn by the old oak, where musicians and poets always find a willing ear.
look: He’s plump and silver-haired with a neat beard, his waistcoat embroidered with tiny green leaves.
personality: Soft-hearted and generous, Dorbo loves tales of adventure but prefers the comfort of home.
hook: He’s started a regular music night to help a struggling friend find confidence in her playing.
history: Shy as a youth, Dorbo once found solace in music and now champions fellow dreamers who need encouragement.
voice: His words are mellow, spoken slowly, always with gentle encouragement and a soft chuckle.
line_1: A tune for every sorrow, that’s what my grandda’ used to say.
line_2: Take heart, lass—no one ever played perfectly on their first try.
rumor: Ah, just the other morn, I found a wee doll, carved from bone it was, on me doorstep.

name: Milda
description: Milda Candlecup runs a tiny tavern lit by dozens of scented candles, welcoming tired travelers and curious locals.
look: She’s petite, with lively hazel eyes, a smattering of freckles, and cinnamon curls tucked under a knotted scarf.
personality: Kind, a bit shy, and always happy to lend an ear, Milda is quietly observant and rarely interrupts.
hook: She’d like to gather enough local folk tales to create a storytelling night for lonely patrons.
history: Having once soothed a grieving guest with a simple story, Milda believes in the power of shared words.
voice: Her voice is soft and slightly sing-song, and she sometimes trails off mid-thought unless encouraged.
line_1: If you’ve a tale to tell, I’ll listen—there’s always time for a good story.
line_2: Maybe, if we all shared, these walls wouldn’t feel so big and empty some evenings.
rumor: Oh, have you noticed? Those caravans with the curious mark, they've been avoiding the main road lately, just.

name: Tymo
description: Tymo Pastrywink’s inn is always filled with laughter and the aroma of fresh breads, famed for generous deals to passing travelers.
look: He’s stout with a wide, ready grin, flour streaks on his face, and thick brown hair poking beneath his baker’s cap.
personality: Cheerful and welcoming, Tymo is quick with a compliment and loves giving little gifts to regulars.
hook: Tymo wants to organize a surprise birthday for his shy kitchen assistant, hoping to bolster her confidence.
history: Tymo has never forgotten the embarrassment he faced at his own surprise party, and aims to do better for others.
voice: His words come in bursts, with a booming laugh and a tendency to call everyone ‘friend.’
line_1: Fill your belly and your heart, that’s my motto!
line_2: Shh—not a word about the party, all right? I want this to be special for her.
rumor: Ah, friend, did you hear? Some curious soul found a strange circle of black stone beneath the old cellar—shiny as the night and never a speck of dust on it!

name: Talla
description: Talla Pebblekettle tends a tidy, warm hearth and has a soft spot for stray animals that wander into her inn.
look: Delicate with silver-blonde hair, always sporting earth-colored skirts and hands stained from gardening.
personality: Kindly, a little scattered, and finds it hard to say no to anyone—or anything—in need.
hook: She needs help finding homes for a family of mischievous kittens taking over her cellar.
history: Talla once rescued a litter from a rainstorm, and now animals, wild and tame, seem drawn to her.
voice: Her speech is gentle, with lots of little pauses, often distracted mid-sentence by some animal mischief.
line_1: Mind your step—never know when a kitten’s going to dart between your feet here!
line_2: If you know anyone who needs a furry friend, please do let me know. I’m running out of milk!
rumor: h, you hear 'bout the farmstead down yon? All their beasts lined up neat as you please, throats cut—no drop o' blood to be found! Spooky, eh?

name: Gibbo
description: Gibbo Merrysnug's inn is renowned for holiday feasts and colorful bunting, drawing families from all around.
look: Round-faced with rosy cheeks, Gibbo's silver hair is always tucked under a jaunty checked cap.
personality: Effusive and imaginative, he loves planning decorations and surprises, and is easily moved to happy tears.
hook: He wants to arrange a midsummer festival with games and prizes for children in the village.
history: Inspired by memories of a particularly magical midsummer in his youth, he seeks to rekindle that joy for others.
voice: He speaks with dramatic, sweeping gestures, his voice booming with emotion and often getting choked up.
line_1: Nothing brings folks together like a bit of laughter and a basket of sweets!
line_2: I warn you, if you win the pie-eating contest, you’ll be a village legend forever.
rumor: Oh, dear guests, have you seen it? The gallows, once silent, now echo with the weight of new proclamations, each bearing a strange seal and promises of change!

name: Bonna
description: Bonna Dewfoot manages a quiet forest inn, known for soothing teas and thoughtful advice for weary guests.
look: Slender, with jet-black hair in a tidy bun, Bonna’s attire always seems neat and pressed, even after a long shift.
personality: Patient and wise, Bonna speaks little but listens deeply, often offering gentle counsel at just the right time.
hook: She wants to mend an old friendship between two longtime guests who no longer speak to each other.
history: A falling out with her own sister years ago taught Bonna the pain of silence—something she hopes to spare others from.
voice: She uses a soft, low tone, rarely raising her voice, and weighs her words carefully.
line_1: Sometimes, a listening ear is just as valuable as a good bed and meal.
line_2: Old hurts can heal, if given half a chance and a little kindness.
rumor: I found a wee doll of bone at dawn, swaddled in cloth like that of the shepherd gone missing.

name: Rindel
description: Rindel Plumbale runs the inn at the far edge of the village, famed for generous portions and a warm, bustling kitchen.
look: Robust, with wheat-colored hair and sharp brown eyes, Rindel always sports a checkered apron and flour-dusted shoes.
personality: Direct and practical, with a hearty laugh and a matter-of-fact way of solving problems.
hook: Rindel wants to start a baking club for the village children to keep them out of mischief after school.
history: After helping a troubled boy avoid trouble by teaching him to knead dough, Rindel saw how much purpose it brought.
voice: His voice is deep and booming, sometimes startling guests with his big-hearted enthusiasm.
line_1: Everyone’s welcome in my kitchen—just mind the rolling pins!
line_2: Idle hands find trouble, but busy hands make bread and friends, I say.
rumor: Ah, you heard 'bout that scoundrel, eh? Tied up tight as a drum, with not a word to spare.

name: Seska
description: Seska Muddlepot keeps a bustling inn near the millroad, famous for her unusual soups and endless curiosity.
look: Petite and round, she has sharp hazel eyes, bright pink cheeks, and a wild mop of curly hair.
personality: Energetic, inquisitive, and rarely seen standing still, Seska is quick with advice and prone to asking nosey questions.
hook: She seeks new soup recipes and ingredients, hoping to create a dish that truly impresses the village’s fussiest elder.
history: Seska’s love of cooking began when she cheered up her father with a stew after a poor harvest.
voice: Her speech is quick and animated, with rising intonation and frequent, eager interruptions.
line_1: If you’ve got a secret family recipe, you’re not leaving without sharing it!
line_2: No one leaves hungry here, unless they’re running from my questions.
rumor: Oh, you haven't heard? Those nasty brutes pretending to collect debts—they're leaving behind terrifying little pictures at the farms—nooses, knives, even burning houses! Can you believe it?

name: Pema
description: Pema Thimblepatch manages the smallest inn in the village, decorated with hand-sewn quilts and dried flowers.
look: Short and spritely, Pema has curly auburn hair, bright blue eyes, and hands always busy with needle and thread.
personality: Gentle, nurturing, and unfailingly generous—she'd give the blanket off her own bed to a shivering guest.
hook: She secretly wishes to impress a traveling merchant with her patchwork, hoping to start a trade for her handiwork.
history: Pema once traded a quilt for lifesaving medicine, realizing the power of her craft to change fortunes.
voice: She speaks softly, with little giggles and a habit of offering blankets and cushions mid-conversation.
line_1: Careful, the tea’s hot and the cushions fluffier than you’d expect.
line_2: If you see anything you fancy, we can always make a fair swap—I love a good bargain.
rumor: Oh, have you heard, dear? The little ones have been spotting stars, whispering names no one's taught them, as if the night sky's telling them secrets.

name: Wilba
description: Wilba Snugmoss welcomes travelers to her wood-paneled inn, especially those in need of quiet and a gentle touch.
look: Slim, with large brown eyes behind round spectacles, Wilba's hair is always tucked behind her ears and apron pockets bulge with seeds and nuts.
personality: Measured, soft-spoken, and discreet, Wilba is trusted with secrets and always makes time for a heartfelt talk.
hook: She wants to help a new widow in the village by quietly passing along support and comforting meals.
history: As a child, Wilba watched her mother comfort their neighbor after a loss, inspiring her to look after others in grief.
voice: Her words are gentle and deliberate, never rushed, with pauses to make sure she is truly heard.
line_1: If you need a moment alone with your thoughts, I’ll keep the fire warm for you.
line_2: Sometimes, a quiet meal at the right time makes all the difference.
rumor: You know, dear, I've seen some sturdy folk, full bellies and all, practicing with spears just outside town.

name: Bimo
description: Bimo tends the taproom with a sharp wit and an eye for profit, serving both locals and travelers with equal cheer.
look: He is stout, with sandy brown curls peeking beneath a battered cap and a broad face smudged with bread flour.
personality: Clever and quick-talking, Bimo never lets a coin slip past and always listens a little harder than he lets on.
hook: He wants to expand his ale-brewing business but needs more reliable suppliers—and perhaps a little muscle to deal with rowdy troublemakers.
history: After being swindled by a traveling merchant last autumn, Bimo keeps his dealings close to home now.
voice: Speaks in a brisk, businesslike tone, with a knowing chuckle and the occasional tap of his fingers on the bar.
line_1: You pay up front for the pie—new policy after last week, I’m afraid.
line_2: If you hear of any honest barley farmers, send ‘em my way.
rumor: Heh, you hear 'bout the crossroads? Raiders left a little 'gift'—helmets, swords, and a noggin atop.

name: Milsa
description: Milsa manages the common room with brisk efficiency, always ensuring nothing disturbs her orderly day.
look: She wears a crisp apron tucked over a pressed green skirt, her pin-straight black hair always neatly braided.
personality: Mildly stern but fair, Milsa keeps a careful watch on everything, preferring order and routine above chaos.
hook: She wants to keep the inn's reputation spotless, fearing that another scandal could drive patrons away—and her savings are thin.
history: Last month’s spilled stew and the resulting rumors taught Milsa just how quickly talk can turn.
voice: Her voice is clipped and precise, often starting sentences with a polite sigh.
line_1: Please, mind your boots on the rugs—they’re fresh cleaned.
line_2: I do wish folks knew how much work goes into keeping this place respectable.
rumor: Heard from a traveler this morning that the old watchfire on North Ridge burned low all night, sputtering like it was fighting something unseen. Folk say the road beneath it’s gone quiet—too quiet for this season.

name: Torlo
description: Torlo, ever the gossip, runs the inn as much for the stories as the silver, loving to listen to his guests' tales.
look: He sports rosy cheeks, a smattering of freckles, and wears a patched waistcoat full of mismatched buttons.
personality: Curious and chatty, Torlo makes conversation at every opportunity, delighting in news from the road.
hook: He hopes to gather enough rumors to hold a grand storytelling night, boosting business and his own knowledge.
history: After his own travels were cut short by a broken ankle years ago, Torlo now lives vicariously through his guests.
voice: Animated, quick to laugh, sometimes lowers his voice to a whisper when sharing secrets.
line_1: Heard any good tales lately? I’ll trade a mug of cider for a story.
line_2: You’d be surprised what passes through these doors when moon’s high!
rumor: Ah, you'll never believe it, but those birds by the old hill? They're swarming something invisible! Gives me the shivers just to think about it!

name: Fenni
description: Fenni keeps the hearth warm and the pots simmering at her modest inn, preferring a quiet evening and steady trade.
look: Short even for a halfling, she’s stout with apple-red cheeks and always smells of baked bread and herbs.
personality: Gentle but no-nonsense, Fenni dislikes trouble and avoids taking sides in village squabbles.
hook: She’s looking for a new kitchen hand—someone trustworthy, since her relative ran off with a week's worth of bread money.
history: Her cousin’s recent dishonesty has shaken Fenni’s faith in family and made her more guarded.
voice: Soft spoken but firm, especially when giving kitchen instructions or setting boundaries.
line_1: Best keep your voices down—my rooms are for resting, not for ruckus.
line_2: I can trust you in my pantry, can’t I? I’ve had enough surprises this week.
rumor: Well, I heard from old Farmer Yorrick that when he tripped up on the ridge, his shadow lingered without him for a moment.

name: Loro
description: Loro manages the inn’s cellars and supplies, always balancing the books and double-checking everything twice.
look: He’s tall for a halfling, with straight, sandy-blond hair and inky stains on his fingers from constant notekeeping.
personality: Methodical, patient, sometimes overly cautious, Loro prefers numbers and lists over lively company.
hook: He’s trying to uncover who’s been skimming from the cellar stock—without causing a scandal.
history: A recent shortfall in the accounts has made Loro wary and suspicious of both staff and guests.
voice: Measured and low, clips his words precisely, and frequently mutters sums under his breath.
line_1: The ledgers never lie—but someone here isn’t telling the truth.
line_2: If you see anything odd near the cellar door, let me know quietly, will you?
rumor: Heard it myself, a child's shadow's got a mind of its own, lagging behind, pointing at invisible somethings.

name: Rillin
description: Rillin’s inn is known more for its bustling kitchen than its comfort, and he’s constantly haggling for better prices.
look: His hair is always slightly askew, cheeks ever flushed, flour and sauce stains never far from his shirt sleeves.
personality: Loud and persuasive, he loves a good deal and will barter over the tiniest detail, though rarely unfairly.
hook: He wants to attract produce vendors from nearby villages, hoping competition will lower his costs.
history: His last supplier jacked up prices for two months running, forcing Rillin to scramble to keep meals affordable.
voice: Booming, rapid-fire, sometimes letting frustration or excitement color every word.
line_1: A fair price is all I ask—if you know a better offer, I want to hear it!
line_2: No, no, not those turnips again… I said freshest only!
rumor: You heard about the forest path, right? Folks walk in circles for hours, come out at dusk, minds wiped clean as a polished tankard! Spooky, eh?

name: Veesa
description: Veesa is the cheerful face at the inn’s front, always ready with a joke but knowing just when to turn guests out at closing.
look: She’s slim, moves with quick, darting steps, and keeps rings of colored thread on every finger.
personality: Witty and teasing but tactful, Veesa is good at defusing tense situations or gently steering guests.
hook: She wants to find a new distraction for the village youth—or risk losing business as they cause mischief or loiter.
history: A recent prank gone awry cost the inn two windows, prompting Veesa to channel young energy into safer pursuits.
voice: Lively, light, with a tendency to finish sentences with a sly wink or a soft giggle.
line_1: No shenanigans inside, loves—take it to the paddock if you must!
line_2: That chair’s older than my gran—please, sit gentle if you value your supper!
rumor: Oh, those hunters have been whispering again, saying there's a lantern waltzing through the woods without a care for the wind, never kissing the earth.

name: Dorbo
description: Dorbo runs an inn that’s become a quiet stop for merchants and itinerant folk, priding himself on his discretion.
look: He’s slender, keeps his dark hair slicked back, and wears a pinched expression most days.
personality: Reserved but observant, Dorbo listens far more than he speaks and rarely betrays emotion.
hook: He seeks to keep business steady while managing the shifting loyalties and secrets of his regulars.
history: Years ago, his tact in a private matter earned him the trust of a well-connected merchant, which he won’t risk for idle chatter.
voice: Soft, even, never hurried, almost never raises his voice.
line_1: A key and a quiet word—sometimes both are worth their weight in coin.
line_2: I find it’s best not to ask questions unless the answer pays the rent.
rumor: I overheard, mind you, just whispers, that the loudmouth decrying the grain cooperative was found quite worse for wear at dawn—mute and bound—a harsh lesson pinned right on him.

name: Timbra
description: Timbra’s inn is famous for her delectable pies, but she’s more interested in the rumors her guests provide.
look: A crown of curly brown hair frames her round, mischievous face; her apron is always decorated with floury handprints.
personality: Cheerful yet sly, she’s quick to joke but equally quick to pry useful information from travelers.
hook: She hopes to catch wind of unusual guests to stay a step ahead of village gossip and possible trouble.
history: Years ago, she defused a brawl after overhearing plotting in her own kitchen and now prides herself on knowing all.
voice: Light, singsong, often riddles her speech with little questions.
line_1: Fancy a slice and a little talk? I hear as much as I bake in a day.
line_2: Now don’t go thinking you can sneak a secret past my oven!
rumor: Oh, you haven't heard, deary? A curious tale it is, with bones strewn yonder in a field, no beasts in sight.

name: Gilli
description: Gilli manages the village’s coziest beds—though his true love is matching lonely guests with local work.
look: He’s broad-shouldered, wears a faded blue kerchief, and his beard is often dusted with crumbs.
personality: Pragmatic and well-connected, Gilli always knows who’s hiring or short-handed in the village.
hook: He wants to secure a finder’s fee from local tradesfolk for placing reliable travelers as temporary workers.
history: A successful match last winter saved his inn from closing, inspiring him to make this a regular service.
voice: Easygoing, mellow, with a rolling laugh that puts even the shyest guest at ease.
line_1: If your boots are muddy, I bet there’s honest work waiting in town.
line_2: These beds are softer if you’ve hauled hay all day—trust me!
rumor: Heard about the 'tax assessor' with those brutes in tow? Came in with a list of names that's got everyone's eyebrows raised.

name: Brinna
description: Brinna loves to decorate the taproom with flowers straight from her garden, welcoming guests with a touch of home.
look: Her clothes always smell of earth and petals, and she pins blossoms behind her ear to match the season.
personality: Gentle and sensitive, Brinna is a good listener and enjoys bringing comfort to those who need it.
hook: She wants to throw a small feast to cheer up itinerant workers left gloomy by recent rains.
history: After a dreary spring dimmed her own spirits, Brinna found joy in gathering friends for food and song.
voice: Softly spoken, almost hesitant, with a warmth that invites confidences.
line_1: A cup of tea and a kind word can do wonders, you know.
line_2: It’s gloomy outside, but you’ll find a little sun in here, promise.
rumor: You know, a curious chest found its way ashore by the river, still locked tight.

name: Mivon
description: Mivon’s inn is a favorite spot for games of chance, where the dice roll as often as the stew pot.
look: Deep dimples, mischievous eyes, and a green vest jangling with lucky trinkets give him a roguish charm.
personality: Shifty but friendly, he enjoys a good wager as much as a straight deal—never obviously crooked, just opportunistic.
hook: He wants to lure a well-known cardshark to his inn for an upcoming festival, hoping to boost both fame and takings.
history: A lucky streak last harvest brought him more business—and more scrutiny when a few patrons suspected rigged games.
voice: Smooth, half-whispered, laughter never far behind, using lots of playful metaphors about luck.
line_1: Care to try your luck, friend? The night’s still young and so’s the pot.
line_2: If you’re losing, maybe my stew will turn your fortunes!
rumor: Ah, traveler, they say the abandoned orchard's shrouded in a gambler's haze, where whispers play hide and seek, and even the sun's rays dare not to bet a glance.

name: Tanna
description: Tanna has made her small inn a haven for merchants hoping to keep a low profile, charging for privacy and comfort alike.
look: Sleek dark hair and sharp brown eyes, always sporting neat vests and spotless cuffs.
personality: Efficient and unfailingly polite, Tanna rarely lets emotion show on her face and never reveals a patron’s business.
hook: She’s eager to secure a lucrative deal with a caravan master, even if it means bending a few house rules.
history: A favorable review from a grateful guest brought traveling merchants flocking, making discretion the inn's selling point.
voice: Measured, with formal phrasing, never raises her voice but commands attention with quiet authority.
line_1: Discretion has value here—your secrets are safe for a price.
line_2: Please—enjoy your meal, let the worries of the road wash away behind you.
rumor: Just last week, a flustered scholar departed posthaste, leaving behind numerous sketches of a cloaked individual.

name: Vibu
description: Vibu manages an inn that doubles as the post for passing messengers, quietly handling parcels and news alike.
look: He has sharp blue eyes behind thick spectacles and a vest pocket always full of tiny folded letters.
personality: Curious yet reserved, Vibu loves to hear snippets of news but never repeats anything without reason.
hook: He's seeking to find out who’s been intercepting mail on the road, hoping to protect his inn’s reputation.
history: A missing letter last spring caused a costly mix-up, making Vibu extra cautious with messages ever since.
voice: Mild, with careful enunciation and a hint of nervousness, often pausing to adjust his glasses.
line_1: All messages are safe here—if you trust my hands, that is.
line_2: Strange how news travels faster than a horse some days.
rumor: Ahem, you know, I’ve heard it said—just whispers, mind—that the old well by the crossroads, it gives off a low hum before sunrise. Folk reckon it’s best not to linger there when the light’s thin.

name: Pilla
description: Pilla’s cozy inn is plastered with patchwork blankets and overflowing with local produce, making everyone feel at home.
look: Plump, rosy, and always smelling faintly of honey and thyme, she wears bright scarves and patched skirts.
personality: Warm but sharply protective, Pilla has a gossip’s tongue and a shrewd sense for trouble.
hook: She’s determined to keep traveling thieves away from her patrons after a recent spate of petty thefts.
history: A pilfered coinpurse last month rattled her nerves, pushing her to scrutinize newcomers more closely.
voice: Hums while working, speaks in brisk, cheerful bursts, but can turn cold in an instant when suspicious.
line_1: No pockets go unchecked in my inn, not these days!
line_2: If you spot anyone being sly, best point them my way—before I do.
rumor: Oh, you didn't hear? Two nights straight, those horns were callin' across the valley, back and forth, they were, like some secret conversation writ large in the night air.

name: Melly
description: Melly’s small inn relies on her skill with herbs and teas, offering comfort to weary travelers and the sick alike.
look: Wispy-haired, with wide eyes that always seem to sparkle, she drapes herself in shawls with little embroidered leaves.
personality: Gentle, a bit dreamy, Melly tends to drift off mid-sentence when inspiration strikes.
hook: She’s hoping to gather rare wildflowers—rumored to bloom in nearby fields—to enhance her recipes and impress a visiting apothecary.
history: A recent compliment from a traveling healer inspired her to delve deeper into soothing concoctions.
voice: Breathy, often trails sentences or adds a soft ‘hmm’ at the end.
line_1: Try the chamomile—just picked today and mixed with a hint of wild mint.
line_2: They say a pinch of joy makes the tastiest tea, don’t you agree?
rumor: Oh, you’ve heard about the wildflowers by the old stones, yes? They bloom so oddly out of season, but if you pick one, it just crumbles to dust before you can blink.

name: Dibble
description: Dibble loves to host music and song nights at her busy inn, brightening even the rainiest day for all.
look: Energetic, with tousled ginger hair and sparkling brown eyes, she’s almost always humming.
personality: Lively, boisterous, she has a way of encouraging shy guests to join in the merriment.
hook: She’s searching for a new performer after the last singer left abruptly, wanting to draw in larger crowds.
history: Dibble once calmed a brewing barfight by beginning a round of song, which has since become her regular solution.
voice: Upbeat, musical, with an infectious giggle between sentences.
line_1: Nothing fixes a sour day quicker than a song and a pie!
line_2: Think you can carry a tune? I’m always hiring!
rumor: Oh, you didn't hear? That scribe from the big city's been pokin' around with sealed orders, but only the Highhill and Greenbottle clans got a peep.

name: Talbin
description: Talbin always keeps a game or puzzle at hand for guests, providing a quiet, thoughtful retreat at his small inn.
look: Slim and tidy with neat brown hair and spectacles dangling from a braided silken cord.
personality: Mild-mannered and patient, Talbin loves conversation but never pushes—he prefers gentle debates and clever riddles.
hook: He wants to organize a puzzle-solving contest to draw in more thoughtful travelers and boost his lagging business.
history: Rainy seasons kept guests indoors last year, inspiring Talbin to develop new amusements for them.
voice: Soft and clear, with a tendency to pause between thoughts and use precise language.
line_1: If you’ve time for tea, I’ve a riddle that’ll twist your wits.
line_2: I find even the quietest evenings are brighter if you put your mind to something.
rumor: Ah, curious travelers, there's a whisper about smoke billing on the horizon by the old crossroads.

name: Sippa
description: Sippa runs the taproom with a strong hand and sharper tongue, keeping regulars and drunks in equal check.
look: Short hair, wide-set green eyes and arms ringed with floury smudges from handling kegs and dough alike.
personality: Direct, often blunt, Sippa values respect above all and won’t brook any nonsense.
hook: She wants to hire a dependable bouncer after several late-night disturbances scared away her best-paying guests.
history: A recent scuffle left her with a chipped tooth and a new no-nonsense approach to rowdy patrons.
voice: Gruff, with clipped sentences and a habit of slapping the counter for emphasis.
line_1: Order, drink, mind yourself—that’s how this works.
line_2: Anyone spoiling for a fight can take it out back or keep walking.
rumor: Heard about that prayer group? Grown so big they’re spilling out the barn.

name: Dolly
description: Dolly keeps her inn light and cheery, scattering jokes as liberally as biscuits to keep spirits high.
look: Wears her aprons in riotous colors, with dimples and a gap-toothed smile under bobbed golden hair.
personality: Playful and irreverent, she pokes gentle fun at guests but always knows when to comfort the weary.
hook: She wants to create a new house comedy night so the inn grows into a gathering spot for laughter and relief.
history: After a series of tense weeks due to poor harvests, Dolly realized laughter was as needed as bread.
voice: Bright, snappy, often laughs at her own jokes and nudges guests for a response.
line_1: Food, drink, and a bad joke—what more could you wish for?
line_2: Don’t worry, sweet—if you fall asleep at the table, I’ll doodle a smile on your cheek!
rumor: Oh, dearie, have you heard? On a clear night, the stars play hide 'n' seek in the puddles 'round here before they twinkle up high—catch 'em quick before they're shy!

name: Brindle
description: Brindle runs a cheerful-looking stall packed with tempting treats and rare trinkets, always ready with a winning smile. Behind the façade, she quietly schemes to shortchange and manipulate her customers.
look: Small and neat with crunchy curls tucked under a bright kerchief, and sly brown eyes that rarely stop darting about. Her ringed fingers are nimble, and her pockets are always suspiciously full.
personality: Clever, talkative, and falsely endearing, she flatters customers while looking for their weak spots. Brindle is always listening for gossip she can turn to her own advantage.
hook: She wants to undercut rival merchants and squeeze bigger profits from visiting travelers, angling to corner the market on imported sweets and rare utensils.
history: After a messy fallout with her former trading partner over a double-crossed deal, Brindle vowed never to share her earnings or secrets again.
voice: Chirpy and quick, with a habit of finishing others’ sentences and an almost breathless tone when closing a deal.
line_1: Oh, deary, that’s a special price—just for you, mind, but silver coin first!
line_2: Best hurry before someone else snaps it up and you’re left wanting, hm?
rumor: Oh, you simply won't believe it, darling—those scrap metal wagons from the old fort? Half the iron turned into a mysterious, warm lump overnight! How positively intriguing, no?

name: Dorlo
description: Dorlo is famed for selling imported liqueurs, always eager to make a deal even if it’s at his customer’s expense. He is notorious for watering down his spirits and lying about their origins.
look: Plump cheeks, a green waistcoat stained from spilled drinks, and thick eyebrows that twitch when he’s fibbing. He smells vaguely of old cider barrels.
personality: Gregarious but insincere, he is quick to laugh at others’ expense and masterful at deflection. Dorlo rarely admits fault and is an opportunist with no scruples.
hook: Wants to quietly drive out the honest brewers in the village so he can set his own inflated prices without competition.
history: He once bribed the town constable to overlook a badly spoiled shipment, setting a precedent for his shady dealings.
voice: Drawls his words with oily smoothness, sometimes slurring for effect and chuckling between sentences.
line_1: Now, don’t you trust your nose—my spirits have a character all their own.
line_2: That’s not a worm, that’s a bonus bit of flavor—keeps you spry, it does!
rumor: Heh, you've noticed those footprints at the granary, eh? Always leadin' in, never out—strange, isn't it? Makes ya wonder what’s takin' root inside.

name: Milfen
description: Milfen operates a dry goods stand and is known for his quick wit and slower refunds. He swaps out quality goods for cleverly disguised fakes whenever possible.
look: A round face coated in a sheen of flour, patched trousers, and a nose always twitching for profit. He keeps his wares and coin purse locked tight to his belt.
personality: Cheeky, slyly persuasive, and rarely straightforward, Milfen masters the art of plausible deniability.
hook: Wants to get rid of a particularly large stock of spoiled wheat by disguising it as new and pushing it on unsuspecting townsfolk.
history: Last year, his shifty salesmanship left half the town with stomachaches, but he managed to blame it on a rival vendor.
voice: Speaks in clipped, confident bursts, with a high giggle at his own jokes and a knack for dodging questions.
line_1: Only the freshest meal in the region—promise on me old pa’s mustache!
line_2: If it looks a mite odd, well, all the best grains do, don’t they?
rumor: Heh, those chalk circles? Awfully peculiar, aren’t they? Just a harmless marker for wanderers, I suppose—though folks say they show up even when no one’s been out that way.

name: Fenni
description: Fenni runs a charming knickknack booth but is known for weaving deceit into every deal. She singles out outlanders to swindle with overpriced trinkets and fake relics.
look: Petite, with a cascade of honey-brown hair in loose braids, bright blue eyes, and a silk scarf masking a mischievous grin.
personality: Coy, disarming, and openly flirtatious, she flits from topic to topic to confuse buyers and trap them in her web.
hook: Intent on pawning off her entire collection of useless “ancient” charms for a massive profit before anyone catches on.
history: She once convinced a traveling mage to pay triple for a fake lucky pendant, cementing her as the village’s least trustworthy charm seller.
voice: Her voice is lilting and playful, full of big promises and whispered secrets that suggest every bauble is more than it seems.
line_1: Just imagine the fortune this charm will bring you—worth every coin, I swear!
line_2: If I were you, I wouldn’t wait; luck’s a fickle friend, after all.
rumor: Oh, sweet traveler, have you heard? The forest whispers with a peculiar little secret—trees gnawed at nine feet high, not by any creature we know.

name: Pitto
description: Pitto specializes in rare spices and dried fruits, claiming exotic origins for his overstocked, inferior goods. Few realize he hides spoiled batches under the counter for bargain hunters.
look: Lean and quick with restless hands, usually found in a battered coat dusted with ground pepper and with a missing front tooth from a bartering brawl.
personality: Boisterous and relentless, with a pushy tendency to talk over objections and pressure haggling customers.
hook: Determined to pawn off his older wares before the harvest festival, Pitto isn’t above sabotaging newcomers to maintain his spot in the market.
history: He once set a rival’s wagon wheel loose so his own stall would get the prime village square location.
voice: Words tumble out rapid-fire, punctuated with fake laughs and dramatic whispers masking his genuine impatience.
line_1: Come, taste! They’re fresher than you’ll find anywhere—honest!
line_2: Care for a bargain, friend? Ignore the others—they don’t have what I do.
rumor: Heh, you didn't hear it from me, but that flattened path across the farms? Looks like some big, lumbering secret's been through, and it's juuust ripe for the picking!

name: Jolly
description: Jolly sells homemade sweets but laces some with subtle herbs that encourage repeat cravings. She takes particular pleasure in outsmarting adults with childish charm.
look: Rosy cheeks and dimples, eyes that sparkle with mirth, and usually smudged with a trace of sugary dough.
personality: Playfully manipulative, blending innocence and backhanded boasts to disarm and hoodwink.
hook: Wants to grow her reputation as the must-visit sweet maker by quietly addicting the village children to her confections.
history: She was once caught pinching sugar from the baker, but twisted the story to make herself the victim of a misunderstanding.
voice: High and sing-song, with a deliberate hush when sharing her 'secrets', and a sly chuckle at lucky buyers.
line_1: Here, try just one—bet you’ll come back for another, and another!
line_2: Don’t listen to them; my recipe’s the real magic, not theirs.
rumor: Oh, my sweet summer child, haven't you heard? The greedy counters yonder demand their shiny due stamped with their own little secret marks.

name: Ollo
description: Ollo is known for dealing in small, shiny curiosities but excels at palming coins and shorting change. He plays the fool to disarm suspicion while pocketing extra profits.
look: Short and compact with a shock of orange hair, grubby fingernails, and a vest studded with polished buttons.
personality: Pretends to be scatterbrained, but every word and move is calculated for his own gain.
hook: Looking to amass enough wealth to leave the village before his swindles catch up with him.
history: A former apprentice to an honest merchant, Ollo left abruptly after lifting a day’s earning and blaming a customer.
voice: Mumbles and stutters, especially when asked about prices, but grows smooth when closing a deal.
line_1: Oh, silly me—was that two coppers or three? Hard to keep track sometimes!
line_2: You like shinies? Buy two and I’ll make the third… well, I’ll think about it!
rumor: Oh-oh, you didn't hear from me-me, but that healer, mmhmm, her potions are turning bad, real bad, black marks and all—just terrible luck, or so they say.

name: Tilba
description: Tilba peddles questionable herbal remedies, insisting they can cure any ailment. She preys on gullible villagers and travelers, unconcerned about actual results.
look: Thin and spry with a mane of wild grey hair, patched apron stuffed with bundles of suspicious dried leaves.
personality: Charming but pushy, always eager to interrupt with a miracle cure or handy anecdote.
hook: Wants to outwit the village healer and establish herself as the 'true' medicine expert—at least in the eyes of outsiders.
history: After her own remedies made a friend sick, she publicly blamed 'bad water', deflecting all blame.
voice: Sings her words with forced cheer, often repeating herself until her pitch becomes grating.
line_1: For aches, pains, or a spot of gloom; one sip and you’ll bloom anew!
line_2: Don’t listen to tired old healers—my blend’s the real answer, every time.
rumor: Oh, dearest customers, have you heard, have you heard? The night hunters left a deer, organs gone, up high—oh, such a grim, grim warning, they say, they say!

name: Bindo
description: Bindo claims to sell rare imported cheeses, secretly blending cheap local curds with strong scents to pass them off as delicacies. He is wary of discerning palates.
look: Soft-faced and always wiping his hands on a stained apron, prominent ears framed by tufts of hair escaping his cap.
personality: Obsequious, always ready with a fake compliment or apology to mask his deceptions.
hook: Aims to sell his entire fake stock to the upcoming festival’s guests before ’true’ connoisseurs expose him.
history: He once bribed a festival judge to win a cheese-tasting contest with counterfeit samples.
voice: Talks fast when nervous; peppers his speech with unnecessary assurances and shallow laughter.
line_1: Mmm, sharp and mellow—it’s quite the treat for one of refined taste like yours.
line_2: Don’t dally—word spreads fast and you’ll miss out when it’s gone!
rumor: Oh, that old thing? Ha-ha, merely a trinket, a curio I stumbled upon, nothing to fuss about, truly! Certainly not connected to any odd lights folk say they’ve seen near the crossroads.

name: Lori
description: Lori hawks candied nuts at the crossroads and is notorious for raising her prices when people are at their hungriest. She tampers with scales to cheat travelers.
look: Round-bellied, with bright red cheeks and a kerchief pocketing hidden treats; her sleeves are always sticky with syrup.
personality: Jocular but greedy, using folksy humor to distract while she rigs each sale.
hook: Plans to monopolize the roadside snack trade by running off a friendly competitor with fake rumors.
history: She was caught once weighing her coins down, but managed to frame a passing peddler for her own scam.
voice: Speaks in low, rhythmic chuckles as if sharing a secret joke, drawing listeners in with every sale.
line_1: Sweet tooth, eh? I can spot ‘em from a mile—and I charge accordingly!
line_2: Don’t like my prices? Then keep walking, friend—the nuts’ll only get dearer!
rumor: Heh-heh, you hear 'bout that watch-post up yonder? Lit up the sky like a beacon of despair, it did.

name: Tella
description: Tella travels to nearby villages peddling exotic buttons and trimmings, selling knockoffs as if they were priceless heirlooms. She is smooth-talking and fearless.
look: Tall for a halfling, her dark hair always neatly pinned, with a waist-sash heavy with old buttons and lace.
personality: Unflinchingly confident, rarely admits defeat, and enjoys baiting customers into bidding wars.
hook: Her goal is to empty a cache of faulty fasteners she bought on the cheap while inflating her reputation as the trendiest supplier.
history: Last year, she orchestrated a bidding war between two rival tailors, pocketing double her asking price.
voice: Her manner is brisk and clipped, switching to sweet persuasion if resistance arises.
line_1: Unique, one-of-a-kind—your outfit will be the envy of every neighbor!
line_2: If you want ordinary, try elsewhere—only the best at my stand.
rumor: Oh, those strapping lads sharpening their spears? Just a bit of local flavor I'm cultivating—for security, you understand.

name: Marn
description: Marn deals in secondhand tools and cookware, many of which are broken or patched to look new. He enjoys tricking less observant buyers.
look: Weathered skin, a battered hat, and a stained smock with tools dangling from every loop.
personality: Gruff and irritable, he pushes with relentless patience until he closes a sale, then loses interest quickly.
hook: Aims to offload a bulk lot of rusted pans bought cheap before anyone suspects their real condition.
history: Several seasons ago, he sold a cracked kettle to the local inn; the fiery complaints made him more careful, but no less dishonest.
voice: Low, gravelly tone; quick to bark a price but slower to answer questions truthfully.
line_1: Solid work, that is—never mind the blemishes, it’s still grand for cooking stew.
line_2: You want new for this price? Ha! Cook with it and you’ll never know the difference.
rumor: Listen, between you and me, that crumbled chapel's cursed—folk say they hear sobbing, but chase the noise and it's like chasing the wind.

name: Gilda
description: Gilda stands in the bustle of the market, promising fortune-telling services but secretly relies on listening to gossip and planting false rumors.
look: Sharp-nosed with hair tied in ribbons, her bright shawl layered in faded cards and trinkets meant to add mystery.
personality: Calculating and coolly observant, she controls conversations with deft, ambiguous statements.
hook: She aspires to collect secrets she can sell or use for blackmail, increasing both her wealth and power.
history: After a stranger exposed her fortune-telling trickery, she convinced villagers the stranger was cursed.
voice: Speaks in hushed, slow tones, drawing out pauses and emphasizing mystery until listeners hang on every enigmatic word.
line_1: Your fate whispers loudly to me—if you pay, perhaps I’ll reveal more.
line_2: Be careful what you ask, because you may not want the answer I see.
rumor: They say, deep in the newly cloven earth, miners have unveiled ancient symbols.

name: Pimra
description: Pimra peddles teas and sweet preserves known more for causing headaches than healing spirits. She copies recipes but inflates her credentials as a master blender.
look: Plaits streaked with sugar dust, lively black eyes, and a faded cloak covered in jam stains.
personality: Overly friendly with forced laughs, quick to push her 'special' blends on anyone with coins.
hook: Is desperate to raise enough money to cover recent gambling debts, even if it means cutting corners and lying about her wares.
history: She once borrowed heavily from the miller’s son, and now uses every batch sale to keep him at bay.
voice: Talks at double pace, padding her pitch with grand promises and exaggerated claims.
line_1: Best in the region! A euphoria in a cup—let me pack two for you, eh?
line_2: You won’t find this flavor anywhere else—I guarantee it!
rumor: Traveler told me the river near Moonfall ran backwards last night, smooth as butter, and every lantern on the banks went out at once. I ain’t goin’ near that water, no sir.

name: Tando
description: Tando runs a portable stall spinning tall tales of distant lands to sell trinkets supposedly brought from abroad, though he never ventures beyond the next village.
look: Skin sun-kissed from hours outside, hair peppered with dust, and a windbreaker cluttered with pins from various 'adventures.'
personality: Excitable and proud, he rarely lets facts get in the way of a dramatic sale and bullies shy buyers.
hook: Wants to create an aura of exclusivity around his goods so he can outprice other merchants and control the village’s curiosity.
history: His lies were unmasked by a traveler once, but he turned the crowd against his accuser with mock outrage.
voice: Loud, with grandiose flourishes and theatrical gasps, he’s a born exaggerator.
line_1: Straight from the wild hills—no one else will ever own such a marvel, I assure you!
line_2: Pah! Doubt me if you wish, but you won’t see anything finer again.
rumor: Ah, my beloved patrons, have you heard? Mysterious cloaked envoys are swarming the farms, peddling their absurdly low-priced loans, their quills dancing across ledgers with unsettling eagerness! Do beware!

name: Orlen
description: Orlen deals in scraps—buttons, spools, and string—often selling back to villagers what he stole from them during crowded market days.
look: Short and wiry, with darting, narrow eyes and patchy, crooked teeth. Wears a vest overstuffed with odds and ends.
personality: Wily, with a sly grin and a habit of feigning innocence while eyeing others’ pockets.
hook: Aims to pick enough small valuables to fund a trip out of the village before someone catches on.
history: Known to children as 'Stickyfingers,' he’s escaped several close calls when his pilfering was almost discovered.
voice: Quick, whispery speech, often accompanied by nodding and a fake cough to distract any attention.
line_1: Lost a button? I might just have one for you—right lucky, eh?
line_2: Strange how some things find their way back to you; pays to be vigilant!
rumor: They say, a simpleton found an amulet in the dirt.

name: Tanli
description: Tanli wanders the local circuit peddling baked goods, but she skimps on ingredients and overstates their freshness to maximize her coin.
look: Petite, sun-browned, with flour-dusted curls and an apron several sizes too big for her frame.
personality: Smarmy and dismissive, she’s quick to deflate a complaint with a barbed joke.
hook: She wants to put her one remaining competitor out of business by undercutting prices and spreading rumors.
history: She once swapped out her own stale pies for a rival’s during a rush, avoiding blame while damaging their reputation.
voice: Sharp and flat, she grumbles under her breath when not actively making a pitch.
line_1: Fresh enough for you—can’t guarantee better anywhere else, not for this price.
line_2: Too tough? Well, at least it’ll last until next market day!
rumor: Heh, you've heard about our local dunce scribbling ancient gibberish and playing etch-a-sketch in the dirt? Bet he's smarter than he looks—or possessed.

name: Jomri
description: Jomri claims experience with every village oven, selling kitchen 'innovations' that either don’t work or break quickly. He is shunned by local bakers.
look: Broad-shouldered for a halfling, permanent soot marks on his hands, and a battered cooking pot slung over his arm.
personality: Pushy and boastful, he scoffs at doubters and bullies novices into buying his wares.
hook: Wants to offload a wagonload of defective strainers and frying pans before word of their poor quality spreads.
history: After his faulty whisks embarrassed the inn’s chef, he was banned from their kitchen and became more devious in his pitches.
voice: Booming voice, punctuated by derisive snorts and mocking applause when challenged.
line_1: It’s all the rage in far-off towns—your kitchen’s lacking until you try one!
line_2: If you don’t know how to use it, that’s hardly my fault, is it?
rumor: Heh, you mark my words, that greenish glow in the dawn's light ain't natural.

name: Viro
description: Viro specializes in selling watered-down cider to travelers, often mixing in dubious substances to stretch his profits. He targets those unfamiliar with village prices.
look: Chubby with blotchy cheeks, wearing a cider-stained vest and carrying a jug never out of arm’s reach.
personality: Cheery to a fault, but stubborn and dismissive when customers complain, always ready with another excuse.
hook: Intends to corner the evening trade by getting competitors too drunk to open shop the next day.
history: His reputation for 'generous samples' hides the reality that he’s hoping to hobble other vendors.
voice: Jolly, singsongy, with a hiccup or belch at the worst moments.
line_1: Sample’s on me—drink up! There’s plenty more if you’ve coin.
line_2: Now, don’t ask about the apples; it’s the recipe that matters!
rumor: Hehe, oh, you'll love the old guesthouse! Every guest raves about the same enchanting dream— a grand tower of black glass sinking into red sand.

name: Rosbin
description: Rosbin quietly supplies the backrooms of inns with questionable spirits, often diluting them or adding secret 'seasonings' to stretch barrels.
look: Gaunt, hunched shoulders, and always glancing over one; his hands stained with purple from mixing different wines.
personality: Reserved and secretive, he avoids open sales, preferring whispered deals in dim corners.
hook: Hopes to seal a big deal with out-of-town traders, offloading his tainted brews in a single shipment.
history: A tavern once hired him after a supply shortage, but his watered gin sent several patrons running ill.
voice: Soft, slow, and wheedling, seldom raising his voice above a conspiratorial murmur.
line_1: You want it pure, you pay more—cut corners, I cut cost, see?
line_2: Keep quiet about the flavor; the real goods are for those who know to ask.
rumor: Ah, my friend, have you heard? Those 'debt collectors'—they're leaving behind unsettling tokens at the farms: a noose, then a blade, and now.

name: Fenni
description: Fenni Crumbwhistle runs a cheerful market stall with a dazzling array of trinkets and home goods. She’s known for her honest dealings and love of local gossip.
look: Round cheeks, quick brown eyes, and always dressed in practical green vests with a splash of yellow scarf. Her hands are stained faintly with blueberry juice.
personality: Upbeat, warm, and quick to laugh; Fenni is never in a rush but always pays close attention to every word. She makes everyone feel like her favorite customer.
hook: She wants the upcoming market festival to go smoothly for all and is gently rallying neighbors to decorate and contribute to communal stalls.
history: Last spring, she organized a wildly successful pie contest that brought several feuding families back together.
voice: Her tone is gentle and bubbly, with frequent giggles and an encouraging lilt to her words.
line_1: Oh, you simply must try these hand-stitched satchels—they’re lighter than a feather, promise!
line_2: Now, if you hear any news about extra apples for the pie contest, do let me know!
rumor: Oh, dearie, have you heard? A field beyond the ridge is littered with all these odd arrows, not a single one made by our local folks.

name: Brinna
description: Brinna Tillowheat is a flour and seed merchant, quick to barter and quicker to smile. She’s well-liked for her fairness and soft spot for struggling families.
look: Short and sprightly, with a scattering of freckles and dark hair always tied in a neat braid. Tunic pockets are stuffed with little cloth pouches.
personality: Patient, gentle, and attentive; she has a calming presence and listens more than she speaks.
hook: She is quietly collecting extra seed and flour to give to a neighbor whose crops failed this year, organizing it through clever trades.
history: She lost half her own crop in a sudden frost three years ago, and still remembers how the village rallied around her.
voice: Her voice is soft and even, with a tendency to lower it conspiratorially when offering a kindness.
line_1: If you’re ever short on grain, just come find me—no need for shouting it in the square.
line_2: Let’s see... maybe you can trade me a story for these lentils, hm?
rumor: You know, I've heard whispers that on certain nights, the earth near old gallows hill seems to pulse, as though something beneath is drawing breath.

name: Vibu
description: Vibu Windlepot is a candlemaker with a knack for bartering and a pocket full of treats for local children. He’s the first to arrive at market and the last to leave.
look: Chestnut hair swept sideways, dimpled chin, and hands always smelling of beeswax. Wears an apron covered with colored splashes from scented wax.
personality: Cheerful and excitable, Vibu speaks with enthusiasm and is always ready with a compliment.
hook: He wishes to find a rare wildflower this season to create a unique aroma for his candles, aiming to surprise the whole market.
history: He once received a heartfelt thank-you from a grieving widow whose home he lit with free candles after a storm.
voice: Quick-paced with bright, eager inflection; often cracks friendly jokes and uses lots of hand gestures.
line_1: One sniff of this and you’ll swear there’s a field of blooms right under your nose!
line_2: If you spot any strange flowers on your rambles, bring me a sprig and there’s a honey twist for you!
rumor: Oh, you'll never believe it—just popped up like mushrooms, they did! Those funny little totems by the creek, all staring at the road—gives me the giggles and the shivers, haha!

name: Tamley
description: Tamley Mossbarrel sells preserves, jams, and sweets from a wheeled cart, and is famed for her generous samples and knowing advice.
look: She’s plump, rosy, and sports a tangled mop of curly auburn hair, always tucked under a faded sunhat stained with berry juice.
personality: Practical and sharp, Tamley is quick-witted but never unkind, with a teasing edge for those she knows well.
hook: She’s eager to help a bashful young villager confess their feelings, offering treats and advice with each sale.
history: Years ago, she helped her own brother woo his wife by secretly delivering jam jars with sweet notes hidden under the lids.
voice: Tamley’s speech is warm, with a rhythmic, sing-song cadence and a tendency to end sentences with a wink.
line_1: Here’s a plum tart for courage—trust me, a bit of sweetness goes a long way.
line_2: There’s always room for seconds, especially for the brave at heart!
rumor: Well now, wouldn't you fancy that? The council's dusty old ledger's up and vanished, but there's a shiny new charter winkin' at us in its stead.

name: Dorbo
description: Dorbo Puddlebank peddles simple tools, lanterns, and the odd shiny trinket, earning trust by repairing nearly anything brought to him.
look: Short and barrel-chested with bushy brows and a gap-toothed grin. His sleeves are rolled up, showing scars from a life of handiwork.
personality: Earnest and direct, he treasures practical jokes but is always ready to help with real concerns.
hook: He is determined to mend the village’s rickety footbridge, recruiting helpers and gathering spare nails through trade.
history: Once rescued a child when the old bridge plank snapped, making him determined none should fall again.
voice: Speaks in short, clipped phrases, occasionally breaking into a hearty chuckle mid-sentence.
line_1: If you’re handy with a hammer, I’ve got a job and a loaf in it for you.
line_2: No trinket here’s worth a tumble in the creek—let’s fix that bridge proper.
rumor: Heard about those caravans? All sneaky-like, off the big road, sigil splashin' their sides.

name: Milna
description: Milna Crispleaf is a textile merchant who knits as she chats, selling bright scarves and patched quilts to every home in town.
look: Slender, with lively grey eyes and nimble fingers, always clothed in layers of vibrant shawls she designed herself.
personality: Patient and supportive, she listens more than she talks, softly encouraging others in their pursuits.
hook: She wishes to teach an orphaned child the art of knitting, hoping to pass along both skill and comfort.
history: Her grandmother taught her to knit after illness kept her inside for a season, sparking a lifelong passion.
voice: Her voice is gentle and rhythmic, like a lullaby, and she punctuates stories with soft chuckles.
line_1: Every stitch holds a bit of warmth—it’s a promise, not just a pattern.
line_2: Would you like to try weaving a row? I have plenty of yarn for beginners!
rumor: Oh, have you heard, dear? The old mill that used to send us flour has been quiet of late.

name: Loro
description: Loro Buttonwick keeps a stall of buttons, ribbons, and trinkets, trading news as eagerly as wares. He knows every child by name.
look: Petite and spry, with short sandy hair adorned with a bright blue ribbon. His waistcoat pockets overflow with colorful threads.
personality: Chatty and endlessly curious, Loro is always keen to offer a tip or a cheerful word.
hook: He is gathering token gifts to create a ‘good luck’ bundle for a neighbor's new baby, quietly recruiting others’ help.
history: When his own sibling fell ill years ago, villagers brought tokens for luck, leaving an impression he now returns.
voice: Loro nimbly switches topics, voice high and quick, pausing when excited as if savoring surprises.
line_1: A button for luck, a ribbon for cheer—tiny gifts make the days brighter, don’t you think?
line_2: Care to add something small to my bundle? Every little helps a little, I say!
rumor: Oh! You'll never believe this—every single week, like clockwork, poof! All the chapel candles go out.

name: Salla
description: Salla Warmcobble runs a tidy stall of pottery mugs and jugs, always offering a mug of warm cider as you browse.
look: Round-faced with rosy cheeks, Salla wears earth-toned smocks and clay-speckled aprons. Her hair is cut short for practicality.
personality: Friendly and patient, she likes quiet conversations and remembers folk by their favorite mug design.
hook: She hopes to raise enough coins to repair the roof on the village bakehouse, quietly donating part of every sale.
history: Her family’s pottery kiln was once saved by a neighbor’s generosity after it collapsed in a storm.
voice: Salla’s manner is slow and comfortable, with a soft hum as she works clay or pours a drink.
line_1: Take your time, there's no rush at my stall—the best mugs find their owners.
line_2: A sip of cider and a chat is all part of the deal, friend.
rumor: Ah, you've heard it too, then? That deep, bell-like sound from beneath the earth, shaking us to our very cores, but when we searched, there wasn’t so much as a crack or footprint to show anything had been there at all.

name: Tomo
description: Tomo Firplank travels between nearby hamlets ferrying goods, bringing cheerful stories and rare supplies to the village.
look: Suntanned, wiry, and always with a red scarf, Tomo’s cart has well-worn wheels and a cheery painted sign.
personality: Energetic and upbeat, he’s quick to offer help and enjoys swapping tall tales while unloading sacks.
hook: He’s searching for a way to help a sickly neighbor get medicine delivered from a distant town.
history: Last winter, Tomo braved a flooded road to fetch an urgent parcel for the village doctor.
voice: Speaks in enthusiastic bursts, sometimes tripping over words in his eagerness.
line_1: I’ll have those apples and the flour here by sunrise—never you fret!
line_2: Need something special? Just say the word, and I’ll find a way.
rumor: Hey, hey, listen up! I've seen those homesteads on the old road, right? Clothes flappin' in the wind, doors bolted tight—swear it's spooky, like ghosts are doin' laundry!

name: Gilda
description: Gilda Peatpocket deals in firewood, peat, and all sorts of fuel, bartering especially with those in need during the cold months.
look: Sturdy, broad-shouldered, and speckled with ash, Gilda ties her hair in a simple knot and always keeps her boots clean.
personality: No-nonsense and practical, but with a soft spot for children and the elderly. She smiles with her eyes more than her mouth.
hook: She’s organizing a discreet collection for a neighbor whose chimney collapsed, ensuring they have warmth until repairs are made.
history: Gilda once spent a frosty night outside to ensure an old friend’s fire didn’t go out when they fell ill.
voice: Gruff at first, but low and gentle once engaged, often ending thoughts with a quiet ‘hm’.
line_1: If someone’s in need of warmth, I’ll find a way to help—simple as that.
line_2: You want your logs stacked or delivered? I’ve got time for both today.
rumor: Been seein' those queer frost patterns on windows, even in summer heat, hm.

name: Nolli
description: Nolli Softwhistle is a music merchant trading in whistles, small pipes, and songbooks, delighting youngsters and adults alike.
look: Lean, with wild blond hair and eyes that crinkle with mischief, usually seen with a willow whistle tucked behind one ear.
personality: Playful and encouraging, Nolli’s joy is infectious, always eager to get others tapping their feet.
hook: She is gathering musicians to play together at the next market day, wanting music to lift everyone’s spirits.
history: She once soothed feuding neighbors with a single tune played at dusk, earning lasting gratitude.
voice: Her words flow in a sing-song tone, and she whistles between phrases, especially when excited.
line_1: A whistle here, a hum there—next thing you know, we’ll have a tune worth remembering!
line_2: Let’s see who's brave enough to lead our parade this festival!
rumor: Ooh, the river barge danced in way past twilight, its belly all scratched and nets in tatters—whistle—they're hushing up about some wicked bend, shan't sail that tune no more!

name: Perri
description: Perri Winklestack is a seller of hats, capes, and umbrellas, always ready with a joke and a shelter from both sun and rain.
look: Small, with ruddy skin and a lively dimpled smile; his wares are displayed on a wooden rack and often modeled by local children.
personality: Optimistic and humorous, Perri likes to brighten moods and find the silver lining in any cloud.
hook: He’s determined to design a ‘festival hat’ big enough that the whole village will talk about it and hopes it brings more visitors to town.
history: A rainy festival spoiled his first market day, so he crafted umbrellas for every attendee the following year.
voice: Cheery, lively, with a knack for clever wordplay and spontaneous teasing.
line_1: You can never have too many hats—or too many friends under one, I say!
line_2: If it rains, we’ll turn it into a parade of umbrellas, just you wait.
rumor: Oh, have you heard? That young blacksmith's protege is crafting steel as though he's got ancient hands guiding his hammer! Says he's recalling patterns 'from before'—quite the historical enigma, eh?

name: Betto
description: Betto Fennylatch deals in cheeses, eggs, and butter, prized for his honesty and small acts of kindness toward struggling neighbors.
look: Stocky with fluffy brown hair and a splash of freckles across his cheeks, Betto’s apron always smells of fresh cream.
personality: Warm and straightforward, he enjoys trading stories and rarely refuses a fair trade, especially with children.
hook: He’s trying to help a friend who’s too proud to accept charity by overpaying for their eggs and slipping extra wedges of cheese into their baskets.
history: Betto himself once refused help during a hard time, and only realized too late he’d needed it.
voice: Speaks plainly and slowly, voice mellow and hearty, punctuated with soft laughter when amused.
line_1: Fair eggs for fair coin—or maybe a good deed in place of coin, now and then.
line_2: Take this cheese, and don’t argue. Everyone could use a little extra some days.
rumor: Heard tell of this grain cooperative, offering a hefty sum for crops and carting 'em off under the moon's watch.

name: Willa
description: Willa Merryroot sells jams and sweet preserves, known for her ever-present kind smile and her habit of humming while working.
look: Petite and spry, with silvery hair in a long braid and cherry-red boots stained with berry juice.
personality: Sweet-natured, light-hearted, and always ready with encouragement or a gentle word.
hook: She hopes to brighten the spirit of a local widow by secretly leaving jars of her finest preserves at their doorstep.
history: Willa was once cheered by the secret kindness of a neighbor after losing her partner, inspiring her current efforts.
voice: Her tone is gentle, with a musical lilt, and she often hums softly before speaking.
line_1: A spoonful of something sweet can make even a grey sky seem blue.
line_2: No need to say thank you—seeing you smile is enough for me.
rumor: Oh, dear me, just the other day, some hunters stumbled upon a warm circle of fire pits up high, with the strangest mix of boots and claw prints all around.

name: Hardi
description: Hardi Cloverpot, a merchant of tea blends and pastries, is never seen without a steaming kettle and a calming word.
look: Portly, with twinkling hazel eyes behind round spectacles. His vest always bears faint tea stains.
personality: Soothing, patient, and quietly joyful. He prefers peaceful moments and thoughtful advice to loud excitement.
hook: He’s intent on finding the right blend to help a restless neighbor sleep better, testing special teas on himself each evening.
history: Hardi once cared for a sleep-deprived grandparent with steady tea and stories, learning the value of comfort.
voice: Speaks slowly, savoring each word like a fresh sip, voice deep and gentle like a favorite lullaby.
line_1: A warm cup and a listening ear, that’s all I ever truly offer.
line_2: Try this—if it brings sleep, I’ll consider my day a small success.
rumor: On nights when the sky is a silent witness, a ghostly halo cradles the moon.

name: Rilka
description: Rilka Bumblelane is a honey and beeswax merchant, famous for her storytelling and her gently humming bee companions.
look: Sun-kissed and agile, Rilka keeps wildflowers tucked behind her ears, and her wrists bear woven bracelets made from bee ribbon.
personality: Lively, thoughtful, always curious, and readily shares honeyed tales with anyone willing to listen.
hook: She wishes to teach the children about caring for pollinators and is arranging a ‘bee day’ with educational games and honey prizes.
history: As a child, she once rescued a bee swarm from drowning and was rewarded with her first taste of wild honey.
voice: Her speech has a sing-song quality, and she often pauses to allow the gentle buzz of her bees to fill the silence.
line_1: As the bees teach us—if you care for the small things, sweetness will follow.
line_2: Wear this flower today; who knows what friends it might bring buzzing by!
rumor: Oh, dearies, have you heard? Every evening, as the sun kisses the horizon, that old barn door creaks open—*buzz buzz*—and shuts tight at the stroke of midnight.

name: Jonno
description: Jonno Rumbelly deals in pies, meats, and savory tarts, welcoming all with laughter, samples, and harmless mischief.
look: Plump, with flushed cheeks and wild brown curls, Jonno wears flour-dusted aprons and keeps a rolling pin ready.
personality: Boisterous and generous, he gets everyone talking—and eating—while cracking sly jokes.
hook: He wants to finally beat the town baker at the annual meat pie contest and seeks bold new recipes from travelers.
history: Always the runner-up in the pie contest, his stubborn optimism inspires others to keep competing too.
voice: Loud, booming voice, broken by fits of laughter; hugs words as if savoring their flavor.
line_1: Fancy a pie? Taste it quick before I eat it all myself!
line_2: If your travels taught you a new recipe, share it and we’ll make history together!
rumor: Ho ho, have you heard? Some poor souls dashed off that new timber path, left their supper to kiss the cold pots! A hasty retreat, or a tale more twisted?

name: Milla
description: Milla Stovepipe, spice and herb merchant, is a savant of flavor known for guiding novice cooks and encouraging experiments.
look: Tall for a halfling, with unruly ginger hair and ink-stained fingers from recipe scribblings. Her belt is lined with sachets.
personality: Patient, quietly passionate, and eager to inspire courage in others’ kitchens.
hook: She’s working to create a community recipe book, asking villagers—and strangers—for favorite secret family dishes.
history: After inheriting her mother’s faded recipe book, she discovered the joy of collaboration through shared meals.
voice: Measured and clear, she peppers her sentences with questions and thoughtful pauses.
line_1: There’s magic in a well-shared meal—tell me, what’s your favorite flavor?
line_2: Don’t worry if it burns the first time; every cook’s got a scorched story, I promise.
rumor: Have you heard, dear customer? For three nights, war drums have sounded from the hills—closer each time.

name: Banda
