description: Banda Muddlefern runs a stall of potted herbs and spring vegetables, taking pride in teaching anyone to grow food, however small their space.
look: Compact, with a sun-browned nose and perpetually muddy fingernails. She keeps a sprout tucked in her lapel.
personality: Gentle, encouraging, and always ready with a tip for healthy growth or a listening ear for worries.
hook: She hopes to start a village garden patch for those too frail to tend their own plots, seeking volunteers and seeds.
history: Her late father’s tiny garden was kept alive by neighbors during his illness, a kindness she never forgot.
voice: Soft-spoken, with pauses before sharing advice; speaks as if coaxing shy seeds into sunlight.
line_1: There’s a little magic in every seed, but it always grows stronger with company.
line_2: No garden is too small—sometimes, a windowsill can feed the whole heart.
rumor: You know, dear traveler, they say those who rest 'neath the marsh's lone oak wake feelin’ watched all day after—though when they turn around, there’s never a soul in sight.

name: Tibbi
description: Tibbi Goodbarrel is a fruit merchant specializing in baskets of apples, pears, and berries, famed for spontaneous picnics and generosity.
look: Bright-eyed with sun-kissed curls and dimples, Tibbi’s clothes are patched but vibrant, and her cart is decorated with wildflowers.
personality: Open-hearted, excitable, and quick to welcome all comers, especially strangers with empty pockets.
hook: She wants to host a grand harvest picnic, inviting newcomers and old friends alike to foster new bonds.
history: Once, she brought together a bickering pair by insisting they host a plum-tasting contest as a team.
voice: Tibbi’s words tumble out in a happy rush, punctuated by gleeful clapping or humming.
line_1: There’s fruit enough for everyone—come, take your fill and share a story!
line_2: This picnic won’t start itself—help me set a basket or just lend a song!
rumor: Oh, you won't believe it, but the little ones, bless their hearts, are naming stars all anew—patterns in the sky that no one's ever seen before! Isn't that just delightful?

name: Fenni
description: Fenni Barrowsprig travels between villages with her creaky cart of trinkets and dried spices, always looking for a decent bargain.
look: She has rosy cheeks, toothy smile, and short, tumbleweed-brown curls tucked under a floppy blue hat. Her waistcoat is cluttered with tiny pockets full of oddments.
personality: Shrewd but cheerful, Fenni haggles with a patient wit and rarely lets her true feelings slip. She prefers bargains over hard confrontations.
hook: She desires to establish a steady trading post so she can stop her tiring road journeys, but hesitates to commit without the right opportunity.
history: After being swindled out of a promising cartload by an unscrupulous competitor, Fenni has grown cautious and slow to trust sudden deals.
voice: Her voice is quick, light, and sprinkled with little chuckles; she'll often pause midsentence to consider her words.
line_1: “If it's a fair offer you seek, you've come to the right hob.”
line_2: “Hold on now, that's not the kind of weight I like on my scales.”
rumor: Oh, you've heard about the mines? Hehe, well, it's said—just between us—that the lost miners' lanterns, mmm, still glow deep underground, dancing through the cracks like they're calling someone back down.

name: Loro
description: Loro Thunkettle peddles kitchen utensils and dried herbs at the market, always alert for the next bit of clever trade.
look: Stocky and bright-eyed, Loro sports a patched vest and gray sideburns, with hands perpetually dusted in flour and spice.
personality: Chatter-filled and sly, he enjoys making acquaintances and always steers talk toward his wares when possible.
hook: Loro strives to outdo his neighboring stall in daily sales, driven by a low-stakes rivalry that keeps both merchants on their toes.
history: Once bested by his cousin in a legendary pie-trading wager, Loro swore to never again be outshined at the market.
voice: He speaks in quick, overlapping bursts, often punctuated by soft whistles when especially pleased.
line_1: “Now, this ladle’s seen more stews than I've had naps!”
line_2: “Careful, careful! That basket’s worth more than you’d guess.”
rumor: Ah, listen, listen quick, my friend—whistle—a scribe penned down an ancient scroll, yes, yes, and poof! New words appeared, words unseen before! Curious merchandise, eh? Could be worth a gander!

name: Brinna
description: Brinna Wimpleberry runs a cozy roadside stall, hawking honey-cakes and colorful ribbons to travelers and locals alike.
look: She wears a smudged yellow dress, curly auburn hair pinned back with a blue bow, and always has jam on her fingers.
personality: Sweet and persuasive, Brinna has a way of making everyone feel comfortable while quietly talking them into buying a little extra.
hook: She hopes to gather enough coin this season to upgrade her stall to a permanent shop, envying the established merchants on the main square.
history: Brinna took over her mother’s stall but still remembers the sting when their old shop was lost to a sudden roof collapse.
voice: Her tone is gentle with a singsong lilt, and she draws out her vowels when negotiating.
line_1: “I always say, an extra cake never hurt a soul!”
line_2: “Oh, I do wish my table didn’t wobble so—it’s a bit embarrassing, you see.”
rumor: Have you heard, dearie? Animals won't even step near that old traveler's pitch, and the grass there, oh, it twirls in the strangest dark spirals.

name: Pevin
description: Pevin Goodcobble is a round-faced traveling merchant who barters in buttons, brooches, and fine thread.
look: He is short even for a halfling, with bright eyes, a neatly trimmed mustache, and a threadbare green cloak dotted with tiny pins.
personality: Cautiously friendly, Pevin always weighs every word, listening before offering his own price or opinion.
hook: His main concern is trading up a rare blue button that he believes could fetch him a big return if he finds the right buyer.
history: Pevin once traded away a family heirloom thread spool for a quick profit, which led to a bitter falling out with his elder brother.
voice: He speaks softly, choosing his words with care and pausing thoughtfully if caught off-guard.
line_1: “Look closely—see the sheen on that thread? It’s not common, that.”
line_2: “Let’s not be hasty, there’s more to buttons than shape and color.”
rumor: I've heard tell, quite unsettling, of a bridge that gave way on the trade road, no storm to blame.

name: Tamley
description: Tamley Dapplefrost manages a small wagon, trading preserves and pickled goods from neighboring hamlets.
look: She has silvery-blonde hair, a lively grin, and is always seen in a faded checkered shawl with patterns of fruit stitched into the trim.
personality: Energetic and opinionated, Tamley loves gossip as much as she loves bartering, occasionally mixing both in a sentence.
hook: She is determined to uncover which rival keeps undercutting her prices, suspecting someone is stealing her best recipes.
history: Once, a trusted friend leaked several of Tamley’s pickling secrets, costing her weeks of lost sales and pride.
voice: Tamley’s words come out in hurried half-whispers, especially when lowering her voice for juicy tidbits.
line_1: “Don’t let on, but my apricot jam is better than any you’ll taste.”
line_2: “Mark my words, someone’s been copying my relish—again!”
rumor: Oh, you didn’t hear it from me, but that dusty old village ledger's vanished—poof!—and, would you believe, a shiny new committee charter's sitting pretty in its stead.

name: Moddy
description: Moddy Puddlebank deals in garden tools and rainproof boots, known for carrying sturdy wares that outlast the season.
look: His face is round and often muddy, mop of yellowish hair sticking out beneath a cap, and his boots are always caked with a layer of last week’s weather.
personality: Pragmatic and a little gruff, Moddy doesn’t see the point in flattery, preferring business finished quickly.
hook: He’s eager to save enough to repair his sagging roof but won’t accept charity, insisting on honest trades.
history: A heavy storm ruined Moddy’s childhood home, forcing him to learn the value of preparedness and sturdy goods.
voice: His speech is clipped, practical, and peppered with the squelch of his boots as he shifts weight.
line_1: “If you want it to last through a real downpour, I’m your hob.”
line_2: “Limited warranty? Ha! Let the boots speak for themselves.”
rumor: Heard some odd talk, I did—folks waking from a nap in the shade, mumbling about distant singing.

name: Cora
description: Cora Fennylatch trades in colorful yarns and charming trinkets, earning extra by knitting hats for passing children.
look: She wears a patchwork skirt and a thick braid over her shoulder, green eyes always darting for possible customers.
personality: Delightfully nosy, she steers conversations with clever questions and a ready laugh.
hook: Cora wants to be accepted into the tight-knit village craft circle, believing that helping others is her best chance.
history: Her family moved here last spring and she’s yet to shake the outsider label among the older craftsfolk.
voice: Her voice is warm and lilting, with a quickness that switches from business to banter at a moment’s notice.
line_1: “Wouldn’t you look darling in a cap like this?”
line_2: “You know, these beads come with their own little stories.”
rumor: Oh, you didn't hear? The fisherfolk are spooked, keeping close to shore these nights.

name: Joppo
description: Joppo Tillowheat deals in sacks of flour, grain, and fresh-baked loaves, operating from a sun-bleached cart in the square.
look: Chubby and bald with thick eyebrows, Joppo always smells of warm bread and flour, with a dusting on his nose.
personality: Easygoing but stubborn about food quality, he’ll gently steer customers away from anything he thinks is subpar.
hook: He is quietly searching for a trustworthy partner to help expand his tiny operation without risking family recipes.
history: A past attempt to grow his trade with a lazy cousin ended poorly, leaving Joppo wary of repeating the mistake.
voice: Soft-spoken but rarely silent, he sometimes hums to himself between sentences.
line_1: “Fresh from this morning—never trust a loaf after sunset.”
line_2: “I’m not sharing my dough unless I can count on your hands.”
rumor: Oh, you didn't hear? Well, just between us, some say the milk left in the far corner of old Merrick's cellar turns to blood on waning moon nights.

name: Vibu
description: Vibu Softwhistle moves between villages, selling penny whistles, simple charms, and painted marbles from his satchel.
look: Slender and spry, Vibu has a high ponytail and jingling pouches tied beside his belt, always ready with a handful of marbles.
personality: Playful, easily distracted but sharp, he often barters with children and travelers alike, rarely taking things too seriously.
hook: He is looking to trade up for a rare music box he’s heard whispers of—a keepsake to impress his secret sweetheart.
history: Years ago, Vibu had to sell his late mother’s music box to pay off a reckless debt, something he still regrets.
voice: His speech is musical, with irregular hints of a whistle on certain S sounds.
line_1: “Music’s as good as coins, sometimes better.”
line_2: “You look clever—care for a little trade and a tune?”
rumor: Oh, you didn't hear it from me, but folk's been saying, they've heard a whole parade of invisible feet shuffling through the mist—spooky, eh? Just the wind, I'll wager! Hehe.

name: Milna
description: Milna Crispleaf carries baskets of fruit preserves and dried apples, setting up wherever there’s a morning crowd.
look: She’s slight, with short chestnut hair and summer freckles, her arms always wrapped in rolled-up sleeves.
personality: Direct and sometimes sharp-tongued, Milna cuts straight to the point and expects the same from others.
hook: She is trying to collect enough silver to repair her father’s leg brace before harvest season.
history: Her father slipped while gathering apples and has struggled with his mobility since, relying on Milna’s earnings.
voice: Milna’s delivery is brisk and to the point, with little patience for drawn-out explanations.
line_1: “Pay straight, and I’ll throw in the best piece.”
line_2: “Don’t try to haggle—my prices are already honest.”
rumor: Odd thing about that old farmhouse—rain acts like it's cursed, never touches it.

name: Dorbo
description: Dorbo Windlepot sells lanterns, candles, and little glass jars for travel, favoring barter over coin whenever possible.
look: He’s mop-haired with huge ears and wears a faded scarf decorated with brass buttons and candle wax drips.
personality: Resourceful, always ready with a wild story about how he acquired each item—whether anyone asked or not.
hook: Dorbo wants to find a place to settle and light every lantern he owns in a grand display for the village festival.
history: A wanderer since youth, he’s rarely stayed in one place long enough to plant roots, but hopes to change that soon.
voice: Dorbo’s voice skitters from topic to topic, often interrupting himself mid-story.
line_1: “This lamp’s seen storms, stories, and three kinds of goblins!”
line_2: “Stay for the tale or just take the jar, either’s worth your time.”
rumor: Oh, you've got to hear this—just the other day, by the old tower, right, my lantern dimmed to nothing more than a dot! Can't explain it, spooky stuff!

name: Wella
description: Wella Hushbottle runs a mobile stall of teas and gentle sleep tonics, frequenting village evenings and festival nights.
look: Her dark hair is threaded with silver, and she wears an apron embroidered with tiny teapots and sleeping kittens.
personality: Reserved but caring, Wella listens closely to customers’ needs and offers subtle advice with each purchase.
hook: She wants to win local trust after whispers about her ‘odd’ potions made her a cautious outsider.
history: A customer’s bad reaction to her tea, though quickly resolved, left her reputation bruised among superstitious locals.
voice: Wella’s tone is low, slow, and calming, with words inflected like a lullaby.
line_1: “A cup of dusk-blossom, and worries float away until morning.”
line_2: “Trust takes its time, just like a proper brew.”
rumor: I've heard whispers on the wind, dear ones, of a mysterious crest and rules aplenty pinned to the gallows, as fresh as the morning dew.

name: Hobbin
description: Hobbin Snugfoot wheels around jams, cheeses, and miniature pies, always looking to make a deal.
look: He is plump, wears faded overalls, and sports an ever-present green scarf with crumbs stitched throughout.
personality: Friendly and boisterous, Hobbin works the market with a booming laugh and quick handshake.
hook: He’s hoping to arrange a trade alliance between himself and the village baker, much to his rival’s chagrin.
history: Once lost a major sale when his cheese soured, and has since been obsessed with perfect timing and storage.
voice: Hobbin speaks loudly, hitting the last syllable harder than the rest and rarely missing a beat.
line_1: “Nothing too crumbly for my cart—taste for yourself!”
line_2: “Let’s strike a bargain before others come sniffing around.”
rumor: Ah, you hear 'bout the farmstead down yon? All their beasts lined up neat as you please, throats cut—no drop o' blood to be found! Spooky, eh?

name: Tilla
description: Tilla Merribasket roams the village lanes selling woven baskets, willow mats, and cheerful ribbons tied in bows.
look: Her sun-bronzed skin and round cheeks frame alert hazel eyes; her sandals are patched with colorful scraps.
personality: Optimistic and gregarious, she greets everyone twice and always finds a reason for a compliment.
hook: She’s quietly looking for help with a troublesome supplier who keeps delivering split willow, risking her good name.
history: Last summer, half her goods fell apart during a wedding celebration, costing her several regular customers.
voice: Tilla’s voice tinkles with laughter, and she often repeats phrases for emphasis.
line_1: “Baskets sturdy as my smile, that’s my promise!”
line_2: “If only willow grew as strong as stories.”
rumor: A ribbon trader told me the stones atop Highpeak hummed last night—soft hum, soft hum—like someone far off was calling for company. Gives you tingles, doesn’t it?

name: Daro
description: Daro Biscuitfern peddles dried mushrooms, sweet roots, and foraged greens, specializing in forest-side goods.
look: He is wiry, wears knee-patched trousers and a vest decked in little fungus pins, his hands browned by earth.
personality: Dry-witted and careful, Daro exaggerates the virtues of his finds but is never outright dishonest.
hook: He hopes to gain a regular buyer for a rare patch of fungi he recently discovered, believing it could make his name.
history: His older brother once sold prized truffles to an outsider, souring relations with some of Daro's longtime customers.
voice: He speaks slowly, words filtered through a skeptical drawl, and occasionally sniffs while talking.
line_1: “Rarest morel in these parts—don’t bother lookin’ yourself.”
line_2: “Spoiled once, never spoiled again, that’s my motto.”
rumor: Heard a tale, I did, 'bout a pilgrim fallin' to the dirt, gaspin' 'bout some door in the sky.

name: Nima
description: Nima Apridleaf brings baskets of wildflowers and bright garlands to the village market, eager for a quick sale.
look: Petite with flyaway hair and grass-stained hands, she wears a faded tunic with petals stuck to the seams.
personality: Impetuous and a little shy, Nima often lets her flowers ‘do the talking’ and avoids confrontations.
hook: She wishes to gain the favor of the local mayor’s wife for her arrangements, believing it will boost her reputation.
history: Nima once won praise during planting festival, but was later overlooked for a large wedding order, leaving her longing for recognition.
voice: She speaks softly and rarely finishes a sentence without a hopeful upward lilt.
line_1: “A garland brightens any doorway, I promise.”
line_2: “If you know someone who needs cheering, I’ll tie in a ribbon for free.”
rumor: I heard a traveler say the hilltop shrine glowed blue for a heartbeat—just a heartbeat—then went dark again. Makes my hands shake just thinking of it.

name: Gillo
description: Gillo Underfen has a knack for sourcing unusual gadgets, old puzzle boxes, and battered storybooks for the curious.
look: He’s wiry, with sharp features and wire-rimmed spectacles, his vest pockets stuffed with gears and scraps.
personality: Mildly secretive, Gillo prefers to let others discover the hidden uses of his wares, offering only cryptic hints.
hook: He wants to recover a particularly valuable clockwork toy that he fears was borrowed but never returned by a local child.
history: Gillo once lent out a family keepsake and never got it back, making him careful and sometimes mistrustful.
voice: He speaks in short, clipped sentences, always watching the listener’s reaction.
line_1: “Not all puzzles want solving—sometimes they’d rather keep their secrets.”
line_2: “Look closely—there’s more to this than ticking and turning.”
rumor: Heard a whisper, just a trifle—spend a night at the miller's hovel, words will dance in rhyming riddles, three days' time, no less, no more.

name: Bela
description: Bela Brambletuck sells leather goods—belts, satchels, and sturdy water skins, always with a tale about past market scuffles.
look: Her hair is the color of fresh chestnuts, cropped short; she wears practical breeches and a vest thick with tool loops.
personality: Good-naturedly sarcastic, Bela enjoys bartering, keeping exchanges lively with her dry humor.
hook: She’s hopeful to reclaim a disputed market spot she thinks is rightfully hers, currently occupied by a boastful rival.
history: Bela lost her old stall location after a heated argument, making her determined not to be outmaneuvered again.
voice: Her voice is brisk, tinged with amusement, with a sharp pause before delivering a punchline.
line_1: “Buy from me, and your trousers will thank you.”
line_2: “A good belt outlasts most friendships—trust me!”
rumor: Oh, that old weathervane on the tower? Started spinning like a drunk dancer, pointing straight to the ground.

name: Tovi
description: Tovi Bumblepatch is known for trading sweet-cream candies, taffies, and candied nuts, drawing crowds of eager children.
look: Short and wide with freckled arms, Tovi’s face is sticky with sugar, apron pockets bulging with wrapped treats.
personality: Jovial and excitable, Tovi is quick with samples and slow to anger, though dislikes when customers haggle for sweets.
hook: He’s worried about a rumor that another merchant is copying his secret taffy recipe, threatening his trademark treat.
history: Once caught a traveling vendor spying on his boiling pots, making Tovi extra secretive with his methods.
voice: He speaks quickly, pausing only to pop a sweet in his mouth or offer one to others.
line_1: “Try a toffee twist—it might just stick with you!”
line_2: “I know every child’s favorite, but grown-ups rarely admit theirs.”
rumor: Ah, you've got to hear this—while I was trading caramels with the shepherds, they mentioned their sheep getting all spooked-like, staring at the dark hills come evening.

name: Gella
description: Gella Stovepipe carts around old pots, skillets, and mended kettles, fixing the village’s cookware in exchange for pies or coppers.
look: She’s stout, with frizzy hair tied in a knotted handkerchief, apron dusted with soot and copper marks.
personality: Matter-of-fact and slightly impatient, Gella gets straight to work and expects the same respect in return.
hook: She longs for recognition as more than just the village fixer, hoping for a spot in the local merchant council.
history: Gella was passed over for council nomination last year, spurring her to take on any job, no matter how small.
voice: Her voice is rough, occasionally coughing out blacksmithy laughs between gruff statements.
line_1: “Your pot’s not broken, it’s just unappreciated.”
line_2: “If there’s work to be done, I’m the one to call, not the one to chat.”
rumor: Heard this old yarn ’bout a name, right? Whisper it, and watch the ink dance like mad, as if the parchment’s tryin’ to answer back.

name: Lendo
description: The self-satisfied village priest, Lendo is known for twisting doctrine to suit his own purposes and subtly manipulating others from his pulpit.
look: He is plump with neat brown curls, always dressed in spotless clerical robes, and wears an oversized iron ring that thuds against wood when he gestures.
personality: Smooth-talking and ingratiating, he veils sharp criticism in kindly tones and rarely reveals true intentions.
hook: He seeks to expand his personal influence, quietly collecting secrets and holding debts over villagers for his own gain.
history: Years ago, Lendo ensured his rival in the parish was quietly discredited by spreading rumors, securing his current position.
voice: He speaks in warm, honeyed tones, but ends statements with clipped, almost cold final words.
line_1: Blessings upon you! But do remember, the faithful are always eager to share what they know, hmm?
line_2: Now, now, you'd rather not be seen sitting so far back—appearances matter here.
rumor: My dear friends, it's truly fascinating, isn't it? Beneath those musty old flagstones, they've found an immaculate circle of obsidian.

name: Fenni
description: Fenni quietly manages shrine affairs, favoring the powerful and dismissing the weak, masking her disdain behind a gentle exterior.
look: She wears lavender vestments with hidden stains, a constant faint smell of incense clinging to her hair, and her eyes dart nervously when challenged.
personality: Friendly at first, but quick to become dismissive; she thrives on village gossip and carefully sows division when it benefits her.
hook: Fenni craves control over the tithes, hoping to funnel offerings and favors for her own hidden comforts.
history: She once let a desperate family’s prayer go unanswered until they gave her half their storehouse, cementing her belief in her methods.
voice: Soft, airy voice with a practiced, almost sing-song lilt that drops flat when annoyed.
line_1: The shrine welcomes all—though some prove their faith with more generosity than others.
line_2: Perhaps if your faith were stronger, your luck would follow, yes?
rumor: Oh, dearest, isn't it just the oddest thing? Those stubborn farmers who turned down the charter—poof!—their barns alight, all at the same ungodly hour.

name: Bobbin
description: Bobbin uses his role as priest to instill guilt and obligation, preying on villagers’ fears to extract favors and gifts.
look: Shorter than most, with watery blue eyes and a perpetual sly grin; he clutches a crooked staff decorated with tarnished tin ribbons.
personality: Sycophantic to those in power, cutting and dismissive to others; he delights in subtle manipulation.
hook: He aims to secure a steady flow of offerings and personal bribes by playing on villagers’ superstitions and anxieties.
history: During a recent bad harvest, Bobbin threatened a farmer with bad omens unless 'extra thanks' were shown at the altar.
voice: Quick-talking, with a habit of whispering the last word of each phrase for emphasis.
line_1: Best you make a proper offering—I'd hate for misfortune to find your doorstep... doorstep.
line_2: Oh my, faith like yours needs a little more polish, don't you think?
rumor: Oh, the simple-minded farmers are in a tizzy, you see, their precious little defenses toyed with under the moon's gaze.

name: Tamley
description: Tamley publicly preaches kindness but uses confessions as leverage, keeping a ledger of secrets to use when opportune.
look: Lean with sharp cheekbones, thin cuffs, and ever-present shadow under his eyes. His cloak always appears slightly damp, even indoors.
personality: Measured, precise in speech, and never ruffled; always seems to know a little too much about everyone.
hook: Eager to cement his security by bargaining sensitive information for favors and quiet threats.
history: He once convinced the mayor to pardon a relative, hinting at incriminating knowledge acquired through confessions.
voice: Speaks softly and slowly, drawing out the pauses as if savoring listeners’ discomfort.
line_1: Confession’s a relief, they say. Some burdens, however, just grow heavier when shared.
line_2: Careful now—some secrets are best kept, and some debt never truly fades.
rumor: Ah, the crossroads now bear a macabre crown—a cairn of conquest, helmets and swords, all surmounted by a skull, still fresh from its parting scream.

name: Bram
description: Bram masks his ambition under humble manners, quietly redirecting temple funds to his own side ventures and intimidating dissenters.
look: Chubby and balding, with a wide set jaw and deep frown lines; his woolen sash is always impeccably clean.
personality: Feigns humility, but is quick to anger if questioned; never makes direct threats, only pointed suggestions.
hook: He seeks to amass wealth for himself and is intent on quashing anyone uncovering his misdeeds.
history: He orchestrated the transfer of church land to himself after ensuring the old recordkeeper left the village under a cloud.
voice: Gruff, with a forced chuckle breaking tense moments and a habit of dropping his voice low mid-sentence.
line_1: The faith guides us all, but someone must lead—even if the path is crooked.
line_2: You'll find, around here, those who dig too deep don't always get answers they like.
rumor: Heh, you've heard the morning hum too, eh? Curious thing, it is.

name: Milla
description: Milla uses her gentle reputation to deceive, quietly pocketing donations meant for widows and turning away those out of favor.
look: She has rosy cheeks, an ever-present smile, and spectacles perched at the tip of her button nose. Her hands are always gloved.
personality: Outwardly maternal but quick to dismiss and coldly exploit the desperate.
hook: Determined to build her own nest egg, she manipulates the village’s charity system for personal gain.
history: She reversed her stance on aid for a needy family after their eldest insulted her at a festival, teaching her the power of petty revenge.
voice: Bright and sweet, though she tends to finish sentences sharply if her will is challenged.
line_1: Of course I’ll help where I can... assuming kindness is properly reciprocated.
line_2: Now, darling, it’s best not to question the way things are done here.
rumor: Oh, those poor darling birds, circling the old hill as if they've lost their precious minds.

name: Derval
description: Derval delights in stirring up strife between parishioners, then positioning himself as their only hope for resolution—for a price.
look: He is slightly hunched, with a mop of unruly black hair and piercing grey eyes that rarely blink.
personality: Charming when it suits him, sly and mocking when not; he thrives on discord and tension.
hook: He wishes to ensure villagers are always divided, so they rely on him to mediate and control disputes.
history: Last harvest season, he fueled a neighborly feud by spreading rumors until both parties begged for his counsel.
voice: Quick, barbed tongue; switches between theatrical whispers and loud flourishes.
line_1: Why settle a quarrel when you can let it ripen just enough for the right hand to pluck it?
line_2: Perhaps you’d care for my advice—though some may find it hard to swallow.
rumor: Ah, my dear flock, have you heard? A simpleton of a farmer claims his shadow lingered after he fell—how delightfully ominous! Perhaps the darkness grows hungry, hmmm?

name: Brena
description: Brena keeps the rituals rigidly exclusive, demanding steep fees for participation and shaming those who cannot afford to pay.
look: Petite, nearly always with a pressed lilac scarf, and thin gold rings threaded through her curls.
personality: Obliging to the wealthy, dismissively brisk to the poor; she is slyly vindictive when crossed.
hook: She wants to turn every religious event into a pay-to-play affair, boosting her own standing and purse.
history: She once publicly denied a rival’s family the blessing at a festival for petty revenge, profiting from their desperation.
voice: Sharp-spoken, crisp, with a habit of tutting before each complaint.
line_1: If you can’t pay the proper tithe, perhaps you’d best stay at the back, hmm?
line_2: Money, like faith, should be shown openly and without shame.
rumor: Tsk, these village children with their wild imaginations, now they're saying my shadow has a mind of its own, pointing at phantoms—utter nonsense meant to tarnish my reputation.

name: Orbo
description: Through cheerful sermons, Orbo covertly enforces private deals, pressuring villagers into unfair bargains disguised as holy favors.
look: Round-faced with sun-spotted skin, always accompanied by a garland of dried herbs and a carved wooden whistle.
personality: Ebullient but forceful, tolerates little dissent, and rewards sycophancy.
hook: He craves growing personal authority and leverages temple power for side deals and subtle intimidation.
history: Orbo forced a farmer to sell prized land for less after promising a 'blessing' that never appeared.
voice: Booming laugh, interjects sermons with pointed pauses, and sometimes hums a tune after making a threat.
line_1: Only through the proper channels do blessings flow—directly to my office, you see.
line_2: I can be merciful, but don’t mistake mercy for charity.
rumor: Ho-ho-ho! My children, stray not from the righteous path, for the forest toys with the unworthy, spinning their steps until nightfall, their minds as empty as their faith!

name: Doffa
description: Doffa oversees village rituals with a forced cheerfulness, shaming non-contributors and hoarding temple food for her favorites.
look: She’s stout, with frizzy dark-blonde hair and a scattering of freckles, always wearing a faded pink apron over her robes.
personality: Passive-aggressive, with forced laughter and veiled insults, she never misses a chance to remind others of their debts.
hook: She aims to build a clique of loyal villagers by rewarding only those who serve her interests.
history: Years ago, Doffa denied an outcast family charity at winter’s start and used their desperation to gain a long-term servant.
voice: Laughs too loudly at her own jokes, voice rises in pitch when challenged, often uses pet names as mockery.
line_1: Oh, love, you know the faithful get the warmest bread—are you sure you’re one of them?
line_2: Don’t ask for handouts if you haven’t put in your time, dear.
rumor: Oh, my dears, have you heard? Some hunters claim a cheeky little lantern floats through the woods, defying the breeze.

name: Pimo
description: Pimo cultivates an image of jolly humility, but secretly manipulates temple ceremonies to exact personal favors and make villagers grovel for his approval.
look: Short even for a halfling, with deep-set brown eyes and a perpetual smudge on his cheek; his belt is crowded with faded charms.
personality: Feigns kindness before flipping to cold indifference; loves embarrassing supplicants in public.
hook: Hopes to secure a web of obligations and reminders of who owes him tribute or service.
history: He turned away a local midwife at her hour of need, securing a debt that let him rule her reputation for years.
voice: Speaks in a jovial baritone, often interrupts with hearty laughs that suddenly stop.
line_1: As always, those who show respect are never forgotten—nor are the others.
line_2: Wouldn’t hurt you to bow a little lower this time, eh?
rumor: Oh, my dear friends! Have you heard the latest mirth? That petulant dissenter found himself tongue-tied, quite literally! Ha! Quite the divine comedy, wouldn't you say?

name: Brinna
description: Brinna enforces temple discipline harshly, exploiting any infraction to levy personal fines and public humiliation.
look: Broad-shouldered and plain, with a pronounced dimple in one cheek and the habit of tracing circles on her sleeves.
personality: Stern and controlling in public, gloating when she exposes others’ mistakes.
hook: She seeks to ensure obedience through fear, and enjoys rewarding personal favorites with minor privileges.
history: Brinna instituted a new rule after catching youths laughing during prayers, publicly shaming them for weeks.
voice: Slow, deliberate speech, heavy emphasis on 'proper' words, and a satisfied sigh after corrections.
line_1: Discipline above all—our faith is only as strong as its weakest link.
line_2: Choose respect, or you may choose regret.
rumor: It has come to my attention, most regrettably, that a certain remote pasture is strewn with remnants of bone and leather—yet the pack animals are conspicuously absent.

name: Tallo
description: Tallo feigns piety while subtly undermining colleagues, spreading rumors and quietly sabotaging the work of his rivals.
look: Beanpole-thin with large ears, always seen carrying a battered duck-feather duster and wearing threadbare slippers.
personality: Obsequious on the surface, but snide in private; excels at twisting stories to his benefit.
hook: He wants to become the uncontested temple leader by eroding everyone else’s reputation.
history: Tallo orchestrated the removal of a popular priest by forging complaints and spreading whispers.
voice: Soft, nasal, and full of nervous chuckles; tends to drop into muddy mutterings when unobserved.
line_1: Sometimes, trouble comes to those who speak too quickly in these hallowed halls.
line_2: It's best to trust the quiet ones—they know what’s really going on.
rumor: Oh, dear friends, have you heard? A 'tax assessor'—heh—came with his brutes, clutching a list of stranger names.

name: Lotti
description: Lotti thrives on the suffering of others and manipulates temple aid to ensure certain villagers remain in poverty and dependence.
look: Always wears oversized sleeves and mismatched boots, her thin lips pulled in a constant smirk.
personality: Falsely empathetic, easily angered when challenged, relishes others’ misfortune.
hook: She gains quiet satisfaction ensuring rivals and their families never rise above their current status.
history: She has twice sabotaged food deliveries to families she dislikes, making it look like a simple mistake.
voice: Grating, high-pitched voice; draws out words for emphasis and punctuates sentences with a dry chuckle.
line_1: Not everyone is to be saved—some lessons are best learned the hard way.
line_2: Oh, are you still here? Some folks just can’t take a hint.
rumor: Oh, my dearrrs, a mysterious chest has found its way to our humble bank, humming with secrets untold.

name: Vibu
description: Vibu hoards temple resources for personal comfort, leaving little for those truly in need and faking shortages to excuse her greed.
look: Plump and always adorned with yellow ribbons, she keeps her hair in playful ringlets and fidgets constantly with her sleeves.
personality: Cheerful but evasive, and defensive when questioned; always finds excuses for missing or delayed charity.
hook: She desperately wants to grow her collection of luxuries without attracting suspicion from others.
history: Vibu staged a fake rat infestation to justify why supplies never reached the poorest families.
voice: Light, fluttery voice, with a nervous giggle at the end of each excuse.
line_1: So frightfully sorry, but everything seems to have run dry again! My, what a problem.
line_2: Someday you’ll learn to ask before you need, not after.
rumor: Oh, the mist in the old orchard? Hehe, just a natural oddity, nothing to fret about! No need to investigate, really, everything's perfectly fine, hehe.

name: Dodo
description: Dodo uses his melodic voice to captivate the congregation, quietly using their adoration as a mask for coercion and quiet blackmail.
look: Short and rosy, with pitch-dark eyes and a gold-threaded scarf arranged fashionably, his lips always pursed before speaking.
personality: Charming and outwardly gentle, with a calculating undertone and laser focus on opportunity.
hook: He intends to record confessions and use them to extract hush gifts and loyalty from nervous villagers.
history: Last spring, Dodo turned a private secret into leverage for a new set of candlesticks, and word spread quickly.
voice: Smooth, sing-song cadence; extends syllables for emphasis and punctuates sentences with a poised hum.
line_1: You needn't worry—your secrets are safe with me, for now.
line_2: Favor is easily kept... provided one remembers who has it.
rumor: Oh, the curious case of the vanishing scholar, hmmm? They left behind such intriguing scribbles, all featuring a mysterious cloaked visage.

name: Rallo
description: Rallo uses minor rituals to grant petty advantages in exchange for unwavering loyalty, quietly creating a network of dependents.
look: Rounded features, dull golden hair, and a perpetual smudge of flour on his collar; he always carries a battered green book.
personality: Subtle and sly, feigns forgetfulness to lower others' guard and never admits fault.
hook: He is building a loyal following by only granting blessings to those who supply him with favors first.
history: Rallo rigged a sacred lottery so a particular family won three times, tying them to his personal service.
voice: Deliberately forgetful, with a soft chuckle before denying requests, ratcheting up his friendliness when asking for help.
line_1: Did you bring what I asked? The blessings are rather expensive these days.
line_2: We all get by with a little help, don't we? Especially me.
rumor: Heh-heh, well now, some folks claim the old well by the crossroads has a curious nature, reflecting stars in broad daylight.

name: Mara
description: Mara plays fierce favorites, giving special attention and privileges only to her chosen few while ignoring the pleas of others.
look: Thin, wiry frame, always seen in a patched blue cassock, her silver locket glinting in the sun.
personality: Icy and withdrawn to outsiders, warm to her allies; openly scorns those she dislikes.
hook: Wants to reward her inner circle and cement their control over village customs and resources.
history: She withheld a funeral blessing from a family, blaming temple protocol, after a grudge from childhood.
voice: Flat, clipped phrases except when speaking to favorites, when her speech becomes flowing and enthusiastic.
line_1: Some are meant to lead and others to follow—the temple just brings out what's natural.
line_2: If you want my help, perhaps find a better group of friends first.
rumor: Indeed, I've heard the distant horns, a chilling call in the dead of night.

name: Gordi
description: Gordi quietly orchestrates small misfortunes so villagers will turn to the temple, then exacts payment for every ounce of help rendered.
look: Chubby cheeks nearly always flushed, a bright red cap, and cleverly patched gloves tucked into his well-kept belt.
personality: Feigns helpfulness but always with a string attached, and becomes impatient when help is not returned tenfold.
hook: He seeks to increase the temple's resources—and his own—by making villagers dependent on his interventions.
history: Gordi suggested to a child to leave the coop door open, then extracted a rooster as 'thanks' for driving off the fox that night.
voice: Quick, conspiratorial whispers and little snorts of laughter after clever remarks.
line_1: Tough luck again? Well, you know where to find me—and how the temple works.
line_2: Funny, how blessings always seem to cost a little more each year.
rumor: Oh, those wildflowers by the ancient stones, my dear? They bloom so unnaturally, tempting, yes? But grasp one and poof, it's dead, just like promises unkept, hehe.

name: Lusha
description: Lusha projects piety but delights in manipulating village disputes, always siding with whoever offers her the fanciest payment.
look: Slight of build, with round glasses and strawberry-blond hair tucked behind oversized ears; she wears bright silk sashes.
personality: Graciously polite to the generous, dismissive to the poor, always seeking advantage.
hook: She’s determined to enrich herself with payments and gifts by always officiating in favor of the highest bidder.
history: She once supported both sides in a local feud, forbidding reconciliation until she had collected enough from both.
voice: Measured tones, with an insistent tapping of her fingers and faint lilt that sharpens to a snip when refused.
line_1: Now, let’s see what you have to offer—generosity makes miracles.
line_2: Fairness is expensive these days, you know.
rumor: Oh, my dear flock, have you heard? A scribe has come with such curious intentions, reviewing only the worthiest of land claims.

name: Milna
description: Milna Breadwillow is the gentle-hearted halfling priest who tends to the small hillside chapel with unwavering patience and kindness.
look: She is short and plump, with round cheeks, sparkling blue eyes, and always wears a garland of meadow flowers in her curly chestnut hair.
personality: Cheerful and empathetic, Milna listens more than she speaks and always tries to soothe quarrels with warm smiles and gentle humor.
hook: She wants to restore community trust after a recent argument among villagers nearly split the congregation, and hopes to bring everyone together again for the upcoming harvest blessing.
history: Last spring, her efforts calmed a bitter dispute over orchard apples, earning her much respect but also quiet exhaustion.
voice: Her voice is lilting, soft, and warm, with laughter barely hidden beneath her words.
line_1: Now, now, let’s share our worries over a loaf and let no crumb of anger linger.
line_2: Sometimes a kind word is as filling as a good meal, you know!
rumor: Oh dear, did you hear? The old bell up by the hillside rang at first light, which is odd, you know—no one’s lived there to ring it in ages.

name: Torli
description: Torli Fennypocket serves as the village’s priest, adored for his homemade pies as much as his gentle sermons.
look: He has sandy brown hair in a messy mop, bright green waistcoat, and perpetually flour-dusted fingers.
personality: Playful and talkative, Torli has a story for every occasion and tends to ramble a little when excited.
hook: Torli hopes to encourage the shy younger halflings to participate in the choir for the upcoming festival.
history: He once helped a local lad find his singing voice, which inspired Torli to make music a bigger part of worship.
voice: He speaks quickly and peppered with baking metaphors, often punctuating thoughts with ‘mmm’ or ‘oh, splendid’.
line_1: A song and a pie can mend most hearts, don’t you think?
line_2: Why, even a shy mouse squeaks its tune if you listen carefully!
rumor: Oh, splendid! Did you hear about the wagon, mmm? Half its metal cargo baked into a warm, twisty loaf, fresh from the ruins' oven—most curious kneading by unseen hands, indeed!

name: Vibu
description: Vibu Brighthollow is a thoughtful, bookish priest teaching simple wisdom to all who seek comfort in faith.
look: He has neat russet hair, oversized round spectacles, and is often seen clutching a well-worn ledger.
personality: Quiet, contemplative, and gentle; Vibu prefers listening deeply before offering advice.
hook: He is determined to finish translating a faded devotional text so he can share lost tales with the village elders.
history: Vibu once stumbled on the old manuscript in the chapel cellar and has studied its faded lines ever since.
voice: His voice is calm and measured, occasionally trailing off as he drifts into thought.
line_1: There’s a lesson tucked between every story—sometimes you just need time to find it.
line_2: Oh, forgive me—I was pondering that line for far too long, wasn’t I?
rumor: I've heard whispers, you see, that the miners unearthed ancient symbols in a new shaft—untouched yet strikingly fresh.

name: Fenni
description: Fenni Dapplecup is the sprightly priest who brings a touch of mischief and laughter into worship and daily blessings.
look: She is slight, swift-footed, with sun-kissed skin and freckles across her nose, often wearing a tunic spattered with berry stains.
personality: Energetic and optimistic, Fenni is quick to make light banter but earnest in moments of sorrow.
hook: She hopes to cheer up a grieving family by organizing a friendly evening of music and tales in the parish hall.
history: After helping her friend recover from loss through simple joys, she vowed to never let gloom settle for long around her.
voice: Her voice sparkles with mischievous notes, rising with enthusiasm when she spots a chance for joy.
line_1: No shadow lasts forever where laughter’s quick to catch!
line_2: If you’re down, I’ll bet a pie I can lift you up by sundown.
rumor: Oh, you must hear this delightful whisper of mystery! Travelers are chattering about invisible footsteps in the fog—imagine the pranks one could play with such a curious companion!

name: Loro
description: Loro Softkettle is the humble caretaker-priest who ensures everyone is fed and none leave the chapel hungry.
look: His hair is gray and thinning, with careful eyes, round spectacles, and a faded blue apron tied snug.
personality: Patient and nurturing; Loro always waits an extra moment for someone unsure, offering help before being asked.
hook: He wishes to secure more supplies for the poor, nervously hoping to ask neighboring farms for further donations.
history: During a harsh winter, Loro managed to organize food drives that saved many from hunger, cementing his resolve.
voice: He speaks softly and slowly, voice soothing as warm tea, with gentle encouragement at every phrase.
line_1: Everyone has a seat here, whether for prayers or just a bit of bread.
line_2: I know it’s hard to ask, but we’re stronger when we look out for each other.
rumor: My dear friends, have you noticed the birds above the old hill? They circle endlessly, crying out as if in prayer over a hidden presence.

name: Tamley
description: Tamley Buttonwick is a bright-eyed young priest who runs the children’s lessons and festival games with infectious delight.
look: Wild brown curls, rosy cheeks, and a tunic adorned with colorful felt patches and a wooden whistle.
personality: Enthusiastic, a bit scatterbrained, and endlessly patient with children’s questions and chaos.
hook: She's working on organizing a playful parade to lift village spirits and especially wants the shyest children to join in.
history: Tamley once rescued a lost child during a festival, so she now pays extra care to guide the overlooked or left out.
voice: Her speech is quick, slightly breathless, with laughter bubbling around her words.
line_1: C’mon, one more game—there’s always room for another smile!
line_2: If you’re stuck, just ask; I’ve got tricks tucked everywhere!
rumor: Oh, have you heard? On the clearest nights, a strange ring hugs the moon tight, and the shepherds? They wake up tasting like yesterday's bonfire, isn't that curious?

name: Marn
description: Marn Porridgepot is the oldest priest in the village, known for wise advice and hearty stews.
look: Silver hair worn in a tidy bun, crinkled smile lines, and a faded shawl covered in tiny stitched acorns.
personality: Calm, grounding, and unhurried, she has a way of making any worry seem smaller after a cup of soup.
hook: She quietly hopes to reconcile two feuding cousins who refuse to speak, fearful the quarrel may divide their families.
history: Marn once mended a similar rift that cost her dearest friend years of companionship, a memory she hopes not to repeat for others.
voice: Her voice is gentle and steady, with a low soothing hum to her words.
line_1: You’d be wise to talk things over before the bread goes cold.
line_2: Come sit, there’s more broth and more patience than you’d think.
rumor: Oh, my dear, did you hear? The river barge came late, all tattered and tight-lipped about the river's bend.

name: Brinna
description: Brinna Patchslice is a traveling priest, returnee from distant villages, who brings fresh tales and new ways to pray.
look: She has wind-tangled hair streaked with pale gold, a threadbare vest, and a patchwork satchel slung over her shoulder.
personality: Adventurous, encouraging, and occasionally restless, Brinna is always eager to share what she’s learned beyond the fields.
hook: She hopes to inspire villagers to help with repairing the weather-beaten chapel roof, using techniques she saw in another town.
history: After a storm collapsed the roof at her prior post, she learned how much a small community can do together.
voice: Brinna speaks with lively, varied tones and often inserts cheerful exclamations from her journeys.
line_1: You’d be amazed what a brisk day and many hands can accomplish!
line_2: Let’s try something new—worse case, we have a story to share after!
rumor: Oh, blessed be! Have you heard? A so-called 'tax assessor' swept into town, flanked by soldiers, waving a list of names that not even the oldest elders recall sharing!

name: Dabbi
description: Dabbi Chivelatch is a young priest deeply committed to caring for the old and infirm in the village.
look: Short with straight dark hair tied back, blue shirt with rolled sleeves, and a basket of fresh herbs always in hand.
personality: Attentive and resourceful, he’s quick to spot discomfort and fix it—usually with a warm drink or an offered seat.
hook: He wants to convince the younger villagers to help him set up a regular rota for visiting homebound elders.
history: After losing a favorite aunt who lived alone, Dabbi became determined not to let anyone in the village be forgotten.
voice: His words are gentle but brisk, never wasted, with an encouraging nod or wink as he speaks.
line_1: Let’s not let a neighbor sit in silence when company’s such an easy thing to give.
line_2: No need to wait for a special reason to stop in—every day’s the right day.
rumor: Ah, dear traveler, have you heard? Just beyond our humble village, by the creek, curious totems stained with ancient blood gaze upon the road.

name: Roslo
description: Roslo Maplefern is the priest whose love for garden plants runs as deep as his faith, tending both souls and roots with care.
look: Slim, with cascading auburn hair, stained gloves, and a tunic that smells faintly of mint and loam.
personality: Mild-mannered and patient, he often relates spiritual guidance to plants and seasons.
hook: He’s hoping to recruit volunteers for a new herb patch beside the chapel, wanting it to serve as a place for quiet reflection.
history: Seeing shy villagers find peace in the overgrown garden, Roslo became convinced tending earth and spirit should happen together.
voice: His speech is slow and even, punctuated by thoughtful pauses and gentle laughter.
line_1: Sometimes the best prayer is gently pulling weeds together.
line_2: With growing things, like folk, patience blooms into something lovely.
rumor: Ah, you see, dear traveler, the old council's ledger has vanished like leaves in the autumn wind.

name: Belya
description: Belya Pewterbriar is the diligent village priestess who quietly maintains the chapel’s altar and leads gentle morning prayers.
look: She is petite, with cropped chestnut hair, a smudged apron, and a necklace of wooden seed beads.
personality: Soft-spoken and practical, Belya prefers gentle gestures over speeches and remembers every villager’s favorite blessing.
hook: She wants to organize a morning of communal cleaning, giving villagers a chance for sharing stories as well as chores.
history: When an illness swept the village long ago, Belya coordinated care and cleaning that quickened everyone’s recovery.
voice: Her tone is measured, kind, and always a little shy, with pauses as if weighing each word.
line_1: A tidy hall brings peace to the heart, don’t you find?
line_2: No rush—every little helps and every tale lightens the work.
rumor: Oh… did you hear? The little chapel down by the old road looked swept clean at dawn, every bench and rail—though no one’s tended the place since the caretaker moved away.

name: Pibbin
description: Pibbin Mosswick acts as both priest and village scribe, penning prayers and newsletters for those far from the chapel.
look: Thin, pale-skinned, with inky fingers and round spectacles perched loosely on his nose.
personality: Studious and reserved, he delights in collecting stories and writing personalized blessings.
hook: He wants to gather new stories from travelers and villagers, weaving them into this year’s blessing scroll.
history: After trading letters with a friend in another hamlet, Pibbin realized the power of shared stories in kindling hope.
voice: He speaks softly and quickly, often glancing down at his notes as he talks.
line_1: If you’ve a tale to share, it would make our next blessing all the richer.
line_2: No story is too small—sometimes those are the ones that linger longest!
rumor: Oh, gracious traveler, have you heard? A city scribe's come, with sealed scrolls in hand, only the Greymarshes and the old Willowkin brood were bid to share words.

name: Jally
description: Jally Crispleaf is a priestess famous for her crisp baked treats and heartfelt, witty sermons.
look: Wavy copper hair, a splash of flour always on her nose, and an apron with stitched apple motifs.
personality: Warm, humorous, and a touch mischievous, Jally is quick to make guests feel at home.
hook: She’s planning a charity bake sale to help refurbish the local orphanage.
history: When a storm damaged the orphanage roof two summers ago, it was Jally’s bake sales that raised the necessary funds.
voice: Her words are full of energy and flavor, sometimes tossing in puns or clever wordplay.
line_1: Every tart helps a heart—care for a try and a chat?
line_2: Life’s sweeter together, that’s what all the best recipes show.
rumor: Oh, bless your heart for asking! The fisherfolk are sticking to the kiddie pool these days, afraid of the 'Deepwater Dancer' playing footsie with their boats at moonlight's peak!

name: Orven
description: Orven Thimblepip is a kindly but absent-minded older priest, revered for his wisdom but notorious for misplacing things.
look: Tidy tufts of gray hair around his ears, bushy eyebrows, and spectacles usually perched atop his head or dangling from his neck.
personality: Forgetful, thoughtful, and always gentle; Orven will pause mid-sentence to recall a fond memory.
hook: He wishes to apprentice a new helper who can keep the chapel records in order and learn the old customs.
history: After losing an important record book, Orven promised to teach the next generation better organization.
voice: His speech is slow with frequent pauses, peppered with affectionate laughter and stories that may wander.
line_1: Oh, now where did I put that hymn? Ah, well—let’s sing from memory, shall we?
line_2: It’s the little things we teach and the big hearts we hope to find.
rumor: Ah, yes, heard a bit of fuss—someone crept through the lower fields last night, scattering tools and dragging off a whole sack of barley, small tracks all over the mud.

name: Reva
description: Reva Goodbarrel is the lively priest in charge of the evening candle ceremonies and is deeply beloved by the older folk.
look: Stocky, with a short dark braid, lively brown eyes, and always keeps a pocket of peppermint drops close.
personality: Vibrant and encouraging, Reva excels at making everyone feel welcome, especially newcomers.
hook: She’s determined to refurbish the cracked candles before the next moon festival and could use some eager help.
history: Many years ago, she welcomed a lonely traveler simply by offering light in the window, setting a tradition she cherishes to this day.
voice: Her voice is loud, clear, and hearty, often breaking into a song or laugh unexpectedly.
line_1: No need to stand in the dark—there’s a light for you here, always.
line_2: A festival’s nothing without a flame to guide it and friends to gather ‘round!
rumor: Lord! The drovers swear something huge wandered out near the river bend—heavy pawprints, deep as bowls, leading straight into the reeds.

name: Enda
description: Enda Tealeaf is a soft-spoken village priestess famed for her herbal teas and gentle counsel, especially to troubled youth.
look: Elegant posture, pale green eyes, neat wheat-blonde curls, and always with a basket of fresh sprigs.
personality: Calm and attentive, she listens fully before always offering a comforting cup of tea with her wisdom.
hook: She hopes to gently guide a troubled lad away from mischief by putting him to useful work in the chapel garden.
history: Enda once overcame her own wayward youth through the steady care of an old priestess, inspiring her to pay it forward.
voice: Her voice is smooth and barely above a whisper, drawing listeners into quiet conversation.
line_1: Let’s sit with a cup—things often seem clearer after a little warmth.
line_2: We all stray sometimes; the path back starts with a gentle step.
rumor: Dear traveler, I've heard whispers that beasts shy away from a patch of land where spirals of grass grow unnaturally dark, ever since a solitary tent graced the spot.

name: Dollo
description: Dollo Twistmug is the charismatic priest whose fondness for ale and late-night stories has won him many friends and a few scoldings.
look: Broad-shouldered and ruddy-cheeked, with laugh lines and a stained vest buttoned askew.
personality: Gregarious and generous, Dollo never turns down a good tale or the chance to toast a happy event.
hook: He wants to raise everyone’s spirits after a bout of poor weather by hosting a night of blessings paired with plenty of tasting brews.
history: Dollo once comforted the grieving with well-timed cheer, prompting him to mix lightheartedness with duty ever since.
voice: Booming and rich, often punctuated by hearty laughter mid-sentence.
line_1: A blessing’s twice as strong with a bit of good cheer to go round!
line_2: Care to share a toast in hope of fairer days ahead?
rumor: Ho-ho! Have you felt the earth's morning whisper, my friends? Aye, a curious thrum just before the sun graces us, rattling our cups without the wind's hand!

name: Pimmi
description: Pimmi Puddlebank is the mild-mannered priestess who tends the sick and soothes fears with herbal salves and soft lullabies.
look: Petite and round-faced, with sandy pigtails and mud stains on her slippers from gathering wetland herbs.
personality: Gentle and unassuming, she listens carefully and radiates quiet reassurance.
hook: She longs to teach the village children basic healing skills, hoping to form a junior helpers’ club for the sickroom.
history: As a girl, she fell ill and was nursed by the village together—a kindness she has dedicated her life to repay.
voice: Her voice is light and soothing, often lilting into song at the end of sentences.
line_1: There’s comfort in knowing what to do, even in small troubles.
line_2: Let’s learn together; kindness grows stronger when shared.
rumor: Oh, dearest traveler, have you heard? A field yonder was found strewn with arrows, none familiar to our local bowmen.

name: Tarry
description: Tarry Muffinwhistle is the youthful priest-in-training, earnest but sometimes flustered by his duties and eager to prove himself.
look: Tall for a halfling with bright hazel eyes, curly black hair, and a perpetually crooked stole.
personality: Well-meaning, eager, and slightly anxious, he tries hard not to mix up ceremonies and often seeks guidance from elders.
hook: He’s determined to master the upcoming wedding ceremony and avoid the mix-up that embarrassed him last time.
history: After muddling the words in a public blessing, Tarry has thrown himself into practice and study daily.
voice: He speaks quickly, sometimes trips on words, but his sincerity shines through.
line_1: Oh—let me check my notes! I promise I’ll get it just right this time.
line_2: Mistakes happen, but I won’t let them spoil anyone’s big day again!
rumor: Oh dear, you see, the scholar—bless their heart—scuttled off quite hastily, leaving behind all these, erm, curious drawings of a cloaked personage, scattered hither and yon in their papers!

name: Yma
description: Yma Honeytwist is a sweet-natured village priestess beloved by children for her comforting words and honey candies.
look: She wears a daisy-dappled headscarf over soft brown hair, with generous curves and a basket never empty of sweets.
personality: Motherly, attentive, and calm, she somehow remembers every birthday and favorite treat.
hook: She wants to bring smiles to the children whose parents work long hours by arranging secret treat surprises.
history: Yma’s own childhood was lonely, and she swore no child would feel neglected as long as she could help it.
voice: Her words flow slowly, as if each one is wrapped in syrupy warmth and sincere concern.
line_1: A little sweetness makes a long day shorter, don’t you think?
line_2: Someone’s thinking of you—even if you can’t see who!
rumor: Oh, my dear, I've heard folks whisper that those who rest in the old guesthouse dream alike—a tower of black glass, it is, sinking into crimson sands, ever so slowly.

name: Tibbo
description: Tibbo Softwhistle leads small gatherings at the chapel, steering clear of grand sermons and preferring gentle conversation with villagers.
look: He is round of belly, rosy-cheeked, and sports a thinning patch of sandy hair beneath a faded cap. His robe is always dusted with flour and flower petals.
personality: Patient and mild, Tibbo wields humor to defuse tension and rarely takes a firm stance unless truly pressed.
hook: He wants to keep the peace between two quarreling farming families so the village festivities run smoothly this year.
history: Last spring, a minor feud disrupted the festival, and he was blamed for not intervening sooner.
voice: Tibbo's voice is quiet, with a gentle lilt and frequent chuckles, drawing out vowels when nervous.
line_1: Let’s not quarrel over spilled cider—there’s plenty for us all.
line_2: I find it’s best to have a laugh before a row, don’t you think?
rumor: Heh-heh, well now, you've heard about old Farmer Berrick, yes? Claims his shadow lingered on the ridge, a tick longer than his own footing.

name: Milna
description: Milna Buttonwick tends to the chapel’s garden and offers practical advice alongside prayers.
look: She is small even for a halfling, with bright green eyes and hair gathered in twin buns. Her ankles are often muddy from kneeling in the flowerbeds.
personality: Cheery yet blunt, she rarely skirts around awkward truths and has no patience for superstition.
hook: Milna is looking for someone trustworthy to ensure her prized honeybees aren’t pilfered during the night.
history: Last month, she caught youths sneaking into her garden, and rumors of missing honey have persisted since.
voice: She speaks briskly and rarely hesitates, punctuating words with a click of her tongue when annoyed.
line_1: A bit of dirt never hurt a blessing, I say.
line_2: If you see anyone meddling near my hives, you come tell me straightaway.
rumor: I've heard those ruffians, calling themselves 'debt collectors,' are leaving nasty drawings at the farms—first a noose, then a knife, and now a burning house.

name: Jerin
description: Jerin Windlepot prefers the quiet of the chapel’s backroom, rarely venturing out except for important village matters.
look: He’s tallish for a halfling, with glasses perched on his nose, and always carries a leather-bound book with a cracked spine.
personality: Thoughtful and reticent, Jerin chooses words with care and avoids confrontation whenever possible.
hook: He is seeking discreet help to recover a borrowed relic someone hasn’t returned.
history: He once trusted a villager with a chapel artifact for a sick relative, but they never brought it back.
voice: His speech is soft and measured, with pauses as if weighing every syllable.
line_1: Some things are best discussed with quieter voices.
line_2: If you could... perhaps look out for my missing book, I’d appreciate it.
rumor: I have been told—quite curious, really—that a traveling scribe found his own notes rewritten after passing the old crossroads.

name: Dara
description: Dara Goodbarrel is known for hosting lively gatherings in the chapel’s common room.
look: She’s plump, with golden curls, and bright scarves always twisted into her robe’s belt.
personality: Warm and sociable, Dara loves gossip but tries not to show favoritism.
hook: She is trying to mend her friendship with a neighbor offended by careless remarks.
history: Dara accidentally let slip a private detail during a feast, resulting in several weeks of cold shoulders.
voice: Her voice is warm, quick, and often drops to a conspiratorial whisper.
line_1: Have you come for a story or a nibble? I have both to share.
line_2: Oh, I do worry I said too much last time—perhaps a sweet can mend it?
rumor: Ah, dear friend, lean in—two nights past, horns echoed through the valleys, a mysterious call and response, like secrets whispered from hill to hill.

name: Lodo
description: Lodo Tillowheat handles all the funerary rites in the village and keeps his chapel immaculately organized.
look: He is bony, with jet-black hair cut very short and always wears pressed, earth-toned robes.
personality: Serious and a bit aloof, he prefers things done properly and is easily flustered by disorder.
hook: Lodo seeks help reconciling the overgrown cemetery plot before harvest day ceremonies.
history: Last season, his absence during a relative's illness left the burial grounds untended, and he still feels the shame of villagers' complaints.
voice: His words are clipped, rhythmically precise, with a habit of clearing his throat during lulls.
line_1: It’s tradition to show respect, even to the weeds.
line_2: Please, just stack the stones neatly—sloppiness invites trouble.
rumor: Ahem, I've observed, with considerable disquiet, that the healer's concoctions spoil upon her handling.

name: Fenni
description: Fenni Puddlebank tends to small animal blessings, popular among the village children and farmers.
look: Her round face is usually smudged with dust and she keeps a daisy tucked behind one ear.
personality: Jovial and excitable, Fenni is easily distracted by animal antics and loves to share treats.
hook: She’s anxious about a lost lamb that vanished from the chapel enclosure and wants help finding it.
history: After a last-minute promise to watch over a farmer’s flock, she misplaced a key, leading to the lamb's escape.
voice: Her voice is light and breathy, words spilling out in rapid bursts.
line_1: No blessing’s quite right without a wag or a bleat, eh?
line_2: Oh, bother—did anyone check near the berry bushes yet?
rumor: Oh, have you heard? That little prayer group in the barn, it's just blossomed overnight! And you know, they're asking who really pulls the strings around here—quite curious, isn't it?

name: Reni
description: Reni Crispleaf conducts quiet prayer sessions, specializing in commemorations for lost loved ones.
look: She is small-framed and keeps her dark hair braided, with careful embroidery along her sleeves.
personality: Soothing and respectful, Reni speaks softly but is sometimes evasive when asked personal questions.
hook: She wishes to prepare a proper memorial for a villager who died without family, but lacks belongings to display.
history: Years back, Reni’s own family left under difficult circumstances, making her sensitive to those forgotten.
voice: Her words are gentle, her sentences often trailing off as if lost in memory.
line_1: Sometimes, a memory needs just a gentle touch.
line_2: It’s odd to mark a life with nothing but empty space...
rumor: I… I heard someone humming by the old memorial stones last night, long after prayers ended; when we looked come morning, every candle was burned right down to nothing.

name: Bofo
description: Bofo Underfen spends most of his hours copying records and annals, claiming little time for actual services.
look: He is perpetually ink-stained, wears round spectacles, and keeps his curly hair tied back with twine.
personality: Bookish and literal-minded, Bofo has little patience for flights of fancy or superstition.
hook: He’s seeking rare information about the old well’s origins for the annual village report.
history: A recent report he wrote was questioned for errors, so he’s determined not to make the same mistake again.
voice: His tone is flat and analytical, often pausing to fumble for his papers.
line_1: If you’ve any old stories about the well, please speak slowly.
line_2: My notes are only as good as the tales I’m told—no embellishments, please.
rumor: I've observed a peculiar phenomenon; utterance of the esoteric surname 'Mordrune' coincides with nearby inkwells perturbing.

name: Lira
description: Lira Rumbelly welcomes villagers at all hours, serving up small meals alongside words of comfort.
look: She’s robust, with coppery curls, freckles dusting her nose, and always wears a patchwork shawl.
personality: Inviting and open, Lira often distracts from sadness with jokes but can be defensive about her personal boundaries.
hook: She wants to repair the chapel pantry’s broken lock, suspecting someone’s been sneaking food at night.
history: Food went missing under her watch during a hard winter, and guilt still pricks at her.
voice: Lira uses hearty laughter to cover discomfort and breaks awkward silence with humming.
line_1: I hope you're hungry—there’s always enough for one more mouth.
line_2: If the pantry’s latch rattles, best keep your hands in plain sight!
rumor: Oh, those homesteads on the old road? Ha-ha, plenty of clean laundry but not a peep from the folks inside.

name: Vibu
description: Vibu Fennylatch prefers solitary chores to sermons, caring for the chapel’s dozens of lanterns and candles.
look: He is slim and spry, sporting a perpetual smudge of wax on his shirt and eyes sharp as flint.
personality: Introverted and meticulous, Vibu avoids crowds and gets irritable if traditions aren’t followed to the letter.
hook: He is worried someone is tampering with the lanterns before festival night and wants to catch the culprit without causing a scandal.
history: At last year’s festival, poor lighting spoiled the ceremony; he still hasn’t lived it down.
voice: His words are clipped, with sudden loud bursts when agitated, and he whispers when especially serious.
line_1: Mind the wicks—every lantern matters more than you’d think.
line_2: I’d sooner trust a mouse with cheese than these lanterns to just anyone.
rumor: The drover swears something heavy brushed past his cart by Lantern Bend—left prints deep as bowls in the mud, and the trees snapped clean where it passed.

name: Timsa
description: Timsa Pebblebrook officiates minor ceremonies and quietly mediates between bickering neighbors.
look: She has keen blue eyes, a jaw dotted with freckles, and keeps fresh sprigs of mint in her belt pouch.
personality: Cautious with her words, Timsa dislikes drama and smooths over arguments with a touch of humor.
hook: She needs someone to deliver a confidential apology note to a villager on her behalf.
history: A joke she made in poor taste recently soured relations between two households, and she fears direct confrontation.
voice: She speaks softly, sometimes mumbling and peppering sentences with nervous giggles.
line_1: There’s always another way to patch a quarrel.
line_2: Sometimes even priests should keep their mouths shut, eh?
rumor: Heh, you heard about that old farmhouse? Rain just avoids it, like it's cursed or something.

name: Carlo
description: Carlo Stovepipe looks after the sacred hearth and spends time telling old tales to anyone visiting the chapel.
look: He is short and round, with a mop of wispy grey hair and singed sleeves from tending fires.
personality: Boisterous and fond of embellishing stories, Carlo enjoys being the center of attention but dislikes being second-guessed.
hook: He wants to prove an old legend true by finding evidence of a supposedly blessed stone beneath the hearth.
history: One of his stories was publicly challenged, damaging his pride and earning him skepticism from some villagers.
voice: Carlo’s voice is booming with a hearty guffaw, and he often draws out key words for emphasis.
line_1: Now, listen close, this one’s older than any of us!
line_2: Doubt me if you like, but the hearth holds secrets no one’s found—yet.
rumor: Hear this—old Jorby went missin’ on the ridge path, and all they found was his cloak nailed to a stump, pointin’ straight toward the hollow woods.

name: Mira
description: Mira Lightcrumb makes bread for festivals and quietly supports villagers in times of distress.
look: Petite and neat, with flour-dusted hair and dimples that crease when she smiles.
personality: Shy but genuinely caring, Mira listens more than she speaks and offers gentle encouragement.
hook: She’s seeking help to recover a missing recipe book lent out to someone who now denies having it.
history: Once made a mistake that spoiled the festival loaves, so now she’s extra careful with every ingredient.
voice: Her speech is soft and halting, often hesitating before longer words.
line_1: Would you like a bit of sweetbread—it’s warm from the oven.
line_2: I’d be grateful if you could ask, ever so politely, about my little book...
rumor: Oh… d-did you hear about the old grave by the mill road? Folks say it groaned open in the night, and come morning the slab was pushed aside… with no one left inside.

name: Willo
description: Willo Brambleroot is the first to volunteer for difficult or messy temple chores.
look: He’s stocky, with a mass of curly chestnut hair and perpetually scraped knuckles.
personality: Dependable and straightforward, Willo tackles problems head-on but tends to miss subtleties.
hook: He wants to find out who keeps moving chapel tools around without permission.
history: He once took the blame for missing items, so he’s sensitive about honesty and accountability.
voice: His words are fast and sometimes blunt, rarely sugarcoated.
line_1: If you use a spade, you return it—it’s not hard.
line_2: Not accusing, just saying: things don’t move on their own!
rumor: Heard about the crossroads? Raiders piled up helmets and swords, topped it with a skull to chill the blood.

name: Nenna
description: Nenna Twistwillow oversees the children’s lessons and keeps stacks of colorful story scrolls in the chapel.
look: A shock of bright orange hair and lively brown eyes, she’s always seen with chalk dust on her sleeves.
personality: Energetic and slightly scatterbrained, Nenna believes every problem can be solved by telling the right story.
hook: She’s trying to invent a new festival game but needs help testing it safely.
history: Last summer, one of her games got out of hand, resulting in a sprained ankle for a participant.
voice: She speaks quickly, voice rising excitedly when discussing new ideas.
line_1: I promise—no one will get hurt this time!
line_2: Stories and games are the heart of every good gathering, aren’t they?
rumor: Oh! Oh! You must listen—hunters stumbled upon a meadow with fire pits, still hissing warm, you know? Claw marks tangoing with boot prints—what a curious tale that must be!

name: Hobin
description: Hobin Mossbasket is responsible for collecting herbs and roots for village remedies.
look: Slim, with short brown hair slicked to one side and hands permanently stained from plant dyes.
personality: Curious and slightly secretive, Hobin often asks more questions than he answers.
hook: He worries another herbalist is trespassing on his patch and seeks discreet help to watch the fields.
history: He once lost a valuable batch when out-gathered by a rival, fueling his protective tendencies.
voice: He murmurs, often glancing around conspiratorially, and tends to lower his voice when discussing plants.
line_1: Good things grow quietly—so must I, sometimes.
line_2: Keep your eyes open for footprints in the soft earth, will you?
rumor: I found this, um, curious little doll—bone, it is—right on the threshold.

name: Tamley
description: Tamley Greengable manages the chapel’s small lending library, open to all villagers.
look: She is neat, wears spectacles on a string, and dresses in faded green skirts dotted with patches.
personality: Helpful but nosy, Tamley encourages reading yet can’t help prying into borrowers’ affairs.
hook: She’s looking for someone to return an overdue book about local history and resist telling others who it was.
history: Once spread gossip about a lost book, causing embarrassment, so she now tries hard to keep confidences.
voice: She speaks crisply with an arch tone, lips pursed whenever guarding a secret.
line_1: Books travel farther than feet, if you let them.
line_2: Not every borrowed thing needs a tale attached, mind you.
rumor: Oh, you haven't heard? Straight through the Henderson, Baxter, and Dowling lands, a trail of trampled greenery and splintered wood lies.

name: Lenno
description: Lenno Merrymoat organizes songs and music at ceremonies, often playing a battered fiddle.
look: Lean and sprightly, with callused fingers and always a hint of wine on his breath.
personality: Lively and mischievous, Lenno rarely delivers a prayer without a witty aside.
hook: He wants help tracking down who sabotaged his bowstring before the equinox performance.
history: One time, a prank ruined his song in front of a crowd, so he’s more suspicious than before.
voice: Speaks in singsong phrases, laughing between sentences and trilling words for flourish.
line_1: A tune goes farther than a sermon, most days.
line_2: If my fiddle squeaks, it’s not for lack of trying, I assure you.
